I'd like to set the record straight, even though this isn't "official" or anything, I'd like to clear up the fact that this movie is not all that its cracked out to be.  Yes it's a very good movie, but all the hype it's gotten has just ruined it.  Yes, the special effects are incredible, and the plot is very unique, and the action scenes are good, and the acting is surprisingly good for this type of film.  But this movie is only so well liked because people like violence.  And for those who don't like it, the fact that a violent movie is actually good for once causes one to overlook the violence and appreciate the movie for what it is.  Whereas the young audience just wants to see people get blown up.  Most people would like this movie, so if you haven't seen it, see it, because you'll probably like it, but don't appreciate it for the violence as most people do, appreciate for what it is.

Review title: The second best action movie i have ever seen (the best being beavis and butt-head do America)
Review_body: okay so im guessing you all know the plot by now so im not going to go over that all im going to say is that it has one of the best plots ever!okay the action scenes are AMAZING!!! Seriously who knew Keanu reeves could kick SO MUCH ass and the acting from Laurence Fishbourne is spectacular the soundtrack kicks ass as well with songs from Marilyn Manson,The Prodigy,Rage Against The Machine and Rob Zombie it really is quite spectacularif you haven't seen this film Then SHAME ON YOU!!! get off your computer get the nearest DVD store and buy it!!!story 10 out of 10 nothing to say but WOWsoundtrack 10 out of 10 briilliantAction 10 out of 10 people say the fight scenes are outdated They lie!! Review title: The movie that changed the future for Hollywood ever since the release of the perfect movie to celebrate a new millennia.
Review_body:
I am not a journalist, nor am I a payed critic. But it kind of feels like I should be because just like the Wachowski sisters I got it. On release I was merely a teenager, ironically not completely unlike 'Neo' as I was subjected to the hype from other hackers online since I were a programmer and hacker, at least by night. Student by day although I can't say I didn't do some hacking in school from time to time! I'm not talking as much about the character depth development and I'm not looking for hidden philosophies when I admire the perfection I experienced when I first watched this film. No.What I perceived was a largely philosophical film (and due to the late Dr. Stephen Hawking*** more current than what's comfortable to admit!)
made in a new format. Set in a future or past - void of themes associated with different decades - scientifically barely fiction as it relates to our day and age more than ever today. 
Not even realism (usually important for a geek like I) was in doubt as this aesthetically, cinematographically* and technologically groundbreaking Platonistic masterpiece surpassed all expectations and turned into something above and beyond what is possible to dislike as it's more likely close to a life-changingly ecstasy and truly original. Most certainly capable of being inspiring, you want to watch it over and over again. I think it helped a lot that I was a hardcore 'Ghost in the Shell' manga and movie fan although at the time completely unaware of the Wachowskis own fascination with Masamuni Shirorows universe and Ghost in the Shell.** You have most likely seen it even if you havn't. 
The style, atmosphere, cinematographic techniques and thoroughly thought trough yet somehow tastefully, sexy minimalism is present in almost all major films produced today. To break it down in components:
Aesthetics Camera work and post filming techniquesThe use of music that fits the atmosphere of the scene whether you like that particular music or notThe digital "feel" that often isn't that digital and often is when you wouldn't believe it.The absurd level of detail and dedication put into every aspect of every part of the production. From props, dust, textiles and filter to the spotless chrome or endless seemingly roofless places.An innocent yet particular likeness to both the architecture, clothing, and so forth of the NSDAP (Hitler's party in Germany) and Hugo Boss timeless designs, then as now. The list goes on but a lot of these points were unique to The Matrix and the original film that used them all together impacted the world. 
Actor performance?
Few actors have impressed an audience, colleges, directors and crew the way Keanu Reeves have.I'm talking about Reeves amongst extremely well performed actors such as Laurence Fishburne and Hugo Weaving. 
 Both in terms of thespians with an intensive presence and the art of mastering complicated choreography, partially thanks to the Martial Art Institute representatives such as the "kung fu team: Hong Kong" members: Yuen Eagle Shun Yi, Woo-Ping Yuen, Daxing Zhang. They did an extraordinarily good job on such a short notice and that's probably partially because of the actors dedication to aim for perfection. I should know. I am a Wing Chun Kung Fu examined and graduated certified trainer and I bow in honor to the KFT:HK as I acknowledge their superiority in their ways as trainers, showing I have yet more to learn.  The Matrix, however that wasn't a unique occurans as you'll be able to assess if, and you should, watch this movie. I wouldn't call it purely talent since talent alone isn't enough when you want to impress in a heavily invested and With this level of satisfaction, or if you subscribe to the possibility of perfection, the dedication Keanu his delivery and choreography*Noun
 - cinematography (countable and uncountable, plural cinematographies)
The art, process, or job of filming movies. 
Motion picture photography.**Ghost in the Shell
Please do not mistake the movie with the live action Hollywood movie produced in 2017, they are barely cousins and the plot is butchered beyond acceptable parameters***Stephen Hawking, cosmologist, physicist and professor in mathematics at Cambridge, best-selling writer and physicist, more current than last year, since he predicted, postumely, that the development of A.I amongst threats such as man-made irreversible changes with catastrophic consequences to the environment to largely be about

A revolution in filmart was born the day the Matrix hits the screens!!Our eyes still don`t give the right signals to the brains of the things we have seen!The truth is: There is no spoon!But there is a sum of all cyberfears inside of us all after this amazing film!

this film is excellent because of its superb fighting and jumping in the air kind of stuff. the film starts of by trinity having a conversation with cypher telling her that they were going to kill Nero. then the film goes on until Nero meets trinity and tells him his life is unfortunately in danger, and so... Nero goes to see Morpheus. now this beginning tells the audience who and what these people are and what they do for a living!later on in the film we find out that Nero is the "one" which is a brilliant breakthrough. erm... whats good about this film is that is well presented, well choreographed and suburb music. (the end credits is the best music on the matrix films by the way). that just about sums it up, so i hope you contribute to my review.

Never has any movie so completely fulfilled my every wish of a movie experience as The Matrix did, and still does.I first saw this movie while visiting an older friend of my family in London. The cinema had two parallel shows; The Matrix and The Mummy. We debated for a while which one to chose (he was more than twice my age at the time), he voting for the Mummy, since he knew that story (he thought) from his own matinées growing up. I had heard just rumor about these two movies, and only knew that I wasn't very keen on a classical matinée (being 29 at the time). So we went to see The Matrix...When we left the cinema two hours later, we were both silent. What had we just seen? Slowly we started talking about the movie experience we had just had, or rather, I did. My older friend was very confused, and I think regretted a little that we hadn't seen The Mummy instead. I on the other hand, got more and more excited. My first impressions were of course the special effects, what I learned to be the so called Bullet Time, in the movie. But the more we talked about it, the more the story of this fantastic action movie became the center of discussion.Yes, the STORY. It spoke to me in so many and interesting ways, I don't even think I understood on that walk home from town. An action movie with so much dialogue, it just doesn't compute! And with so many layers of philosophy, religion, science (fiction) and just pure intelligence, it's not supposed to be in an action movie. Period. Never before (maybe once, with Baraka) has a movie added to and completed my view of life, the Universe and Everything... I'm not sure I slept at all that night.I saw it again, after returning home to Sweden, and then got the DVD at its first release. Have I got it on Bluray? Not yet!

Review title: Gripping action combined with a touch of philosophy
Review_body: There are two sides for this movie. On one hand, it is able to deliver the excitement of an action movie, a bit of chasing, fighting and those kind of stuff, but on a whole other level it approaches our daily life with a very interesting perspective and makes the viewer question what reality is. Some famous quotes have made their place in literature about this concept. (Such as 'There is no spoon' or 'If real is what you can feel, smell, taste and see, then 'real' is simply electrical signals interpreted by your brain'). 'There is no spoon' is actually my all time favorite movie quote. It is definitely a must-watch, both in terms of entertainment and self thinking development.

Review title: There's a reason this is my favourite movie
Review_body: I watched this movie as a child, way before i should have seen it to understand it fully the first time around.That has created an effect that i believe that has changed me all the way through today. I didn't get it the first time, so i was curious, so i watched it again, and again, and again. Until i understood it. It's a great way to question your existence when you're down (sorry to hear that btw) and an amazing way to confirm it if you feel confident (you go girl!)This movie had the ability to change me and I believe those are the movies worth watching! So go ahead!

Well when it first released in 1999 nobody had thought it was just a start to the sensational phenomenon that followed. This movie deserves all the credit. It was a silent killer one would say and the best of all the sequels. It's the story of bondage, a story which asks a deep question within yourself about the world we are in. It actually represents a realistic probobility of what would happen if dependence on machines increases. Well that's what every sci-fi film does you might say but the greatness in this film is all the characters and the plot holes he uses are mythological and real. That blew me off.Frankly when I first saw it on the theatre with my parents i couldn't understand much. It was only after three times viewing I had begun to love the beauty of every frame in it. Every time one sees he learns a bit more. The cast is perfect. Keano Reeves as Neo, Lawrence Fishburne as Morpheous, and who could forget the macho-looking Carrie Anne Moss as Trinity. i think she has made a mark in her career through this film. The action sequences are breathtaking and it gave birth to a new bunch of animations. All in all a thouroughly researched well directed movie which is worth your money.I gave it 9.Giving it anyless than 9 would be shameful, I think.

The Matrix...when I first heard about it, I expected just another sci-fi action thriller. Good and filled with insane stunts, but not terribly intelligent.Boy, was I wrong. Oh, the stunts are there in spades, all right, and yes, they are awesome. And the special effects are absolutely amazing (even if similar ones have been used in other movies as a result- and not explained as well).But the movie has plot as well. It has characters that I cared about. From Keanu Reeves' excellent portrayal of Neo, the man trying to come to grips with his own identity, to Lawrence Fishburne's mysterious Morpheus, and even the creepy Agents, everyone does a stellar job of making their characters more than just the usual action "hero that kicks butt" and "cannon fodder" roles. I cared about each and every one of the heroes, and hated the villains with a passion. It has a plot, and it has a meaning...and lo and behold, a plot does help the fight scenes! Just try it, if you haven't seen the movie before. Watch one of the fight scenes. Then watch the whole movie. There's a big difference in the feeling and excitement of the scenes- sure, they're great as standalones, but the whole thing put together is an experience unlike just about everything else that's come to the theaters. Think about it next time you're watching one of the more brainless action flicks...think how much better it COULD be.All I can say is WATCH THIS MOVIE. If you haven't, you're missing out on one of the best films of all time. It isn't just special effects, folks.

Review title: Technically astonishing action? Philosophical text? Conspiracy thriller? Pop culture pastiche? How about all four?
Review_body: There is little to be said about The Matrix that hasn't already been said, but I stand it up with Fight Club and Network as one of the most important and rational pieces of cinema to emerge in decades. The many relevant ideas and wisdoms expressed are still resonating throughout society and creating debate. Unlike many modern blockbusters, the effects and battles are astonishing eye candy, but are always backed up by plot or symbolism, image by image. The viewer can spot many references to anime and other media texts, creating both a subconscious landscape for the audience and inviting them to go deeper. The more-than-competent acting (yes, even Keanu), and stylish techno-green production design are just the icing on the cake for this incredible piece of work that demands multiple viewings.A word on the sequels: they cannot compare, but with a little patience and study into philosophy, they at least make for great brain food.

The green WB logo at the opening credits still send shivers down my spine! The green code that flashes up just before Trinity attacks the guards is one of the best opening scenes I've ever seen!I heard that Will Smith was considered for the role of Neo, but he would have taken the part to light heartedly and incorporated his own style on Neo (no disrespect to Will, just that Neo is a very serious character with a dark background, no humour about him).There's no point me going on about the story line and discussing the special effects as I'm sure most film lovers have seen this. If not, I suggest you get yourself down to the local video store and request a copy immediately!

The Matrix has excellent special effects, incredible action scenes, mixed acting, an original premise, BUT. . . a somewhat weak story.Fishburne is quite good; and this movie was MADE for Keanu. I found the screenplay threadbare, giving the actors not enough meat to work with. The premise is marginal and a bit watered down to make it as science fiction. The story and direction leave holes big enough to drive trucks through.About half way through the movie disbelief kicked back in and the film seemed merely a platform for special effects. In comparison, Mel Gibson's Payback is a more intriguing and better directed revenge/action flick, and Johnny Nmemonic (also featuring Reeves) has better Cyberspace science fiction.This is a violent film, which I have little problem with in general, but here it's particularly De-humanizing which I *do* object to. Payback is extremely violent and profane, but the violence is focused and meaningful in that it serves to advance the plot and has human consequences. The violence in The Matrix blends a cartoon-like disregard for its consequences with an elitist notion that it's all OK because the human victims have been brainwashed by the bad guys and are essentially pawns in a larger game. Violence should have a moral dimension or at least move the plot if it's to have meaning. If not, it desensitizes viewers to violence which can't be a healthy thing for society.

Spoilers, if you've been in a coma for 22 years.The unnecessarily cryptic dialogue is still annoying ("I can't tell you what The Matrix is, you have to see it for yourself." Really? Why can't you just say "This is a simulation?" Drama queen.)
The soundtrack is great if a little dated but despite all the spoofs it's still really engaging.

Review title: The first one is always the best
Review_body: The Matrix has intrigued and fascinated me, just as it has with so many millions of other viewers. Besides the obvious aspects of the movie (philosophy, action, and filming style) that people are interested in, I saw that the Wachowski Bros. have paid close attention to detail and mood in this movie. This is the mark of almost every truly great film, of course. The fact that this movie digs deeper than the superficial, entertaining level of most movies says a lot. I find myself absorbed into the world of The Matrix each time I watch it, because of the skillful artwork that the Wachowski Bros. have employed. There is so much symbolism in this movie, I won't even go there. I love how well this movie sets a dark, sci-fi mood. The buildings are shabby and run-down; everything is dark and ominous. I am particularly reminded of the image of Neo waiting under a bridge in the rain and darkness, and of Neo, Trinity, etc. climbing the checkered spiral staircase. The Wachowskis managed to create a movie that caters to the movie going interests of many different viewers, while at the same time retaining the mood and attention to detail of a true work of art. I give this movie a 9/10 only because of the excessive profanity that dumbs it down. Most of the profanity is unnecessary.
It is happening now!Watch and think carefully since we are witnessing it in real time.

Review title: I Have Seen Most of the Ultimate Matrix 10-DVD Set, By Now
Review_body: I learned of the "Ultimate Matrix" DVD set last year, near Christmas, which was undoubtedly what it was intended to be purchased for. Since I'm in sobriety, as of River Phoenix's autopsy signature date, November 15, 1993, I have taken a keen interest in his, his family's, his friends', and colleagues' histories. He was with Keanu Reeves, as many of you know, in "My Own Private Idaho," in the early 90s, where they did drugs to do the sex scenes, from which River never fully recovered, and this ultimately led to his OD, outside The Viper Room, in LA, on Halloween morning, 1993. I could write on and on about the "Matrix" series, which is most likely what Keanu Reeves is now known best for--and before that, it was the "Bill and Ted" movies. He and River tried to "escape" their teen idol images, by being in Gus Van Sant's horrible movie. I have a limited time, on-screen, at present, as I'm at the library and I need to get to a meeting in Mill Valley, now.To "cap," I find the "Matrix" movies to be "too violent and sexy." It should be a rating--and then, the movie wouldn't get made that way. I just did a little "research" on the Wachowskis, at this humongous and prominent site, where I've been harassed routinely for my November 15th story, and I just found out that Andy Wachowski's wife, Thea Bloom, filed for divorce in late 2002, because he was leaving her for a "professional dominatrix," who had made him his "slave!" Keanu Reeves "owes an apology" to us, if I may be so bold. I didn't think I'd "demand" this, publicly, as I write him, "clandestinely," via Paulie Kosta of Becky, the band they're in together with Rebecca Lord and Rob Mailhouse, but I never hear back directly anyway, so here goes!I could get much more "deep," as I just heard the commentary by Cornel West and Ken Wilbur, with which I did not always agree, since I feel you cannot "justify" such violence and graphic sex in movies. Most out of Hollywood are this way for me--and the sex scenes in "My Own Private Idaho" led indirectly to River's OD. Is anyone in sobriety as of that, but me? I just think these people were "lucky" if they survived the Wachowskis. What is not covered in the very long DVD "ultimate" series is the fact that Jennifer Syme, Keanu Reeves' girlfriend, who gave stillbirth to their daughter, Ava Archer, on Christmas Eve, 1999, is not mentioned. After their "break-up" over this, shortly thereafter, she died in an apparent DUI, where she was the only one driving, after coming from Marilyn Manson's mansion in LA, where there'd been a party! She'd been with Reeves, apparently, just the day before, having lunch in San Francisco at Crepes on Cole, which I've never heard of, near where the "burly man" scene was being shot for "Matrix Reloaded," among others in Alameda County! Manson's obscene music is on the first movie's soundtrack, and a video of it is included in the DVD series, unbelievably! Jennifer's mother, Maria St. John, sued Manson for "wrongful death," about a year later, but he apparently has so much money that I think she "lost," since he denied charges. The "architect" scene was filmed at that time, and it was later used in an MTV movie awards ceremony introduction, starring Justin Timberlake, which was "foul" about women, in this case Trinity--and "made fun" of Gloria Foster's role in the movies, too. Reeves gave his approval to use his image from these scenes, and it was not "OK" with me! Gloria Foster died of a sudden heart attack, during shooting, and Aaliyah died in a plane crash, too, that year, as well as the terrorist attacks occurring. A reason I am "concerned" about Reeves, in particular, when it comes to the "Matrix" series, is because he has been in a number of DUIs, most notably one in the 80s, where he shut his headlights off on his bike in Toganga Canyon, where he apparently "lost his spleen," according to the "Hardball" directors' commentary! Hence, my "demand" for an apology!One good thing that has come of all my writing is that last fall, Johnny Depp finally gave his controlling share of The Viper Room to Anthony Fox's daughter. Fox "disappeared mysteriously," after suing Depp for money. A judge was trying to shut down the club. I wrote him about my getting into sobriety, as of River's autopsy, "coincidentally." I don't think it's a "coincidence," really. If you look at this date in history, it is "significant," and I feel the spirits convened for me.

It might seem – but it isn't – condescending to find it ill-considered for any one of us, in unqualified fashion, to declare one particular motion picture the "very best" unless and until thoroughly familiar with the whole spectrum of all genres and disciplines from the last century. An absolute favorite, certainly, as in music, literature and the arts; but there is the work of Mizoguchi; Godard; Buñuel; Riefenstahl; Fellini; Ozu; Fritz Lang; Satyajit Ray; Renoir; Dreyer; Truffaut; Bresson; Murnau; Welles; Kurosawa; Kazan; Ophuls; Eisenstein; Keaton; Bergman; Kubrick; Minelli; Kieslowski; Yimou; Hitchcock; Rohmer; etc. "B-e-s-t" might reasonably include at least a handful of other movies in world culture.

Review title: Matrix, a complex and well developed metaphor
Review_body: The Matrix is probably the most important film made in the last 20 years. There are several reasons for this, the biggest of which has nothing to do with metaphysics and "what is real?"; a question which is quite literally asked throughout most of this film.The Matrix is a story about Neo, a computer hacker living the double life of Mr. Anderson, a person with a "job at a respectable software company" and "helps his landlady take out her garbage". Yet as No, the protagonist is looking for something just a tad out of reach and in so doing falls into the Alice in Wonderland world of the Matrix.Neo is portrayed as sort of a savior, a single being whose promise is to win a war against a vastly superior force of super-smart and super powerful machines. And on his way to that level, Neo discovers that the world is nothing like he thought.The Matrix is a movie brilliant on many levels, the most base of which is special effects. Some people are willing to dismiss this as nothing more then a good story, a good action film. But hold on now, I say this movie is deep. This movie has a level of subtlety that not many have caught on to.Here's a question worth asking: why is the dream world of the Matrix set in the 20th century? What purpose did the brothers who made this film have in using this time period ad the period represented in the Matrix? In a very conscious effort on the parts of this movie's creators, the Matrix is, in a sense, a dream world which reflects our current world. This then is the metaphor that the brothers have tried to set up.We are living a dream. Every aspect of our lives is designed to pull wool over our eyes. We understand Neo, because Neo's initial plight is relateable. In a way, this time period was chosen because it was the hight of capitalism. In my opinion, the Matrix is a movie which creates a complex metaphor where humans literally become cogs in a great machine. The literalness of being into a battery must be translated into real life. Like those living in the matrix, we in real life, are serving a system which ruthlessly and unapologetically exploits us.Quite literally, the Matrix is the capitalist machine, dehumanizing and exploiting individual humans. That at least is the message I get from the Matrix: a harsh criticism of the capitalist machine that makes up our "real life"
This was an awesome film. This was an awesome film.This was an awesome film.This was an awesome film.This was an awesome film.This was an awesome film.

I know that this is one of the most popular movies of all time, but that is a flaw in the viewing public. The main reason I dislike this movie so much is because it was a rip off of a much better movie that came out a couple years before it. That being Dark City. Lets review the similarities shall we? First of all our main character wakes up disoriented and not understanding the world around him JM because he lost his memory and Neo because he is taken out of the matrix. We find that both characters have been given a false set of memories by puppeteers (be them aliens or robots) We find that these puppeteers are doing the same thing for all people in an attempt to keep their own race going (matrix as batteries DC cus they need to find the soul) Finally the main character proves to be the savior of the humans by finding they are the only one who can put an end to the false lives that the puppeteers are forcing humans to live. they both do this through the same method. by having a mentor teach them how to use the devices of their captors against them (neo learns how to hack and control the matrix while Murdoc learns how to use the machines of the strangers to alter reality. also we see stylish black leather as the main wardrobe in the matrix. black leather gowns are the main wardrobe for the strangers. moving away from the rip off problem we see that Dark City has a message implying you to ask yourself if your identity is more than just the sum of your memories. the matrix makes people feel smart for understanding the movie, but really offers no deep thought. the feel of Dark City is also better since it has the dark ambiance created by the same director as The Crow. while the matrix has nothing new or special about its "feel" just your basic action movie with a plot to try to make the viewer feel smart. Point is: same movie only better (although lacking the eye candy the public adores) is Dark City

This is one of the most over rated rubbish i've seen.This film borrows so much from the Asian cinema and some sci-fi classics.The acting in it,is well TERRIBLE to say the least.Keanu Reeves walks around like hes smoked way to much blow.He is that wooden Disney have signed him for a re-make of Pinocchio.The special effects are good but no better than T2 made 9 years before this..Why this film has such a big fan base is beyond me.if you wanna see a film about robots taking over the world/destroying all of mankind.Go and rent any of the Terminater films to see this subject done in style.And don't watch Matrix 2 or 3.Their even worse

Review title: Effect overladen copy of Fassbinder movie
Review_body: The Matrix is nothing but a cheap and effect overladen copy of Rainer Werner Fassbinder's excellent TV-movie "Welt am Draht", which was broadcast in 1973. Typical Hollywood overblown style, where they think FXs are everything. The Fassbinder movie hardly uses any effects at all, but is ten times as intelligent and a hundred times more enjoyable. Yach! Sorry, brothers Wachowski, have a look at the Fassbinder movie again and learn that less is more. Some people like this kind of action; for me it ruins a movie completely. I was still a kid when I saw that Fassbinder movie, and I would like to see it again; but their are some legal problems about the rights to this movie, and it can't be broadcast at the moment.

I'm surprised by many of the extremely negative reviews of The Matrix. Rating this movie a 1, really? Almost seems like there's a cabal. I rate an 8, and minimum a very strong 7. I viewed it 20 years later with my 10-year-old son and his friend, and the FX certainly stands the test of time, since they were both impressed. Even with everything that's out there today.Obviously, if you hate sci-fi or tech, stay away from this movie. Unless you're a tween, you're not going find much philosophical enlightenment either. Having said that, at the time, it did create a standard for the genre and remains a entertaining movie.As for the story line, in 1999, we hadn't reached the ten-year mark of the popularization of the internet, so the themes certainly struck a chord. Still does today.Relax and enjoy.

I 've just seen this film for the second time and I can't understand why I have had such sadomasochistic behaviour . However, I think I've understand the way the Machowsky Brothers, I mean Sisters, ... Mr and Miss Machowsky write and produce that ... well, movie shall I say . First, they imagined a pseudo-philosophical, pseudo-smart story with some kind of "oh my god so that's how the world is ruled ! Its so evident ! Well, it isn't" . Then , they had to write a script .Pretty useless (XXX , Godfather III and others made lots of money without it) but can help . it was easier :they just need a "Dictionnary of Philosophy for fools" . Example:letter D : Descartes imagine that all our lives could be an illusion created by a "bad genius" . Good ! letter N : Nietzche : Give up our desire is give up what made us human , etc ... And finally they just need to direct actors . Well, they were tired (can understand) so all the actors play consists in making beautiful but useless moves. Now , I can't wait to see the sequels : will they discover the letter O of the dictionary, will the moves be more useless ?... So many questions I hope I 'll never have the answer .
Meticulous in every thing: plot, acting, stunt what have I. This is one of the best movies to have ever made.

Review title: A modern movie that is different then others.
Review_body: A cool insight on the theory of simulated universe.

When I first watch "The Matrix" I thought I understood what is wrong with our world. I felt like Neo, waking up while he was still connected to the System. That's what this movie should be: a wake up call to all of us, to start living, once and for all.We're so trapped in our day-to-day actions and we forget to live for ourselves, we forget to look around, to have feelings, to learn to avoid being trapped in our small bubble, connected to a Reality which is not ours.I watched this movie so many times, without developing an obsession, and every time it's a fresh sip of air, helping me to move on with this life as it is. I'm addicted to it, but in a good way. "The Matrix" will help anyone to be more determined, to look for a way out from this System, without disrupting the wires which keeps it connected.In my opinion, is the best movie ever, for so many reasons. If you did not watch this movie, do it. Leave aside the awesome effects, forget about the small errors. Think that YOU can be trapped inside the Matrix and make a choice: the BLUE pill or the RED pill. This will define you: you're either one of us, or one of them. There are no other options.The movie is outstanding: the effects, the characters, the plot, everything is very well made, Andy and Lana Wachowski did a perfect job. Nobody else but Keanu could play Neo's character. The costumes, the make-up, everything was done in the right way.If you did not see the movie, you don't exist. If you've seen it and you did not understand the essence, is worst.

When the movie first came out, I thought to myself - here we go again with a bunch of geek wannabes all dressed in Emo!The setting at first just seemed to be the common cops and robbers type from the early 50s it had appeared. I still love the line from the Officer in Charge to Agent Smith about jurisdictions.It started out really slow, and sometimes I still get angry at how they made Neo into such a baby back b***h in the beginning. I mean come on - you go all the way out to the ledge just to turn yourself in? I feel that where it really started to get good was the meeting with Morpheous, and I love the blue pill/red pill reference. It is something I use myself to people to this day as to say "Hey, are you going to keep doing the same thing monotonously, or are you going to take charge and do something daringly different with your life". So it was very clever! And it was clever for Neo to discover that he was the one - not everything can be handed on a silver spoon (the funny thing I can say is a great allusion with the monk like child to Neo's meeting with the Oracle).At the end of the day - there are a lot of hidden messages and life lessons to be picked up from this movie. I am not sure what the intentions are of the writers of it (are we ever?). However it is a movie that I feel was definitely ahead of its time when it came out and is not a disappointment by any means! Romance, action, betrayal, fantasy, it has a little bit of everything and even for the younger generations to gain some interest!Check it out people - especially on a rainy afternoon if you have nothing better to do!

Review title: A film that inspired a generation of movie makers.
Review_body: Unfortunately, no one can be told what the matrix is - apt description of a movie that has spawned an entire generation of films/series that have subscribed to one or the other concept in this film : Avatar, Kungfu Panda, King Arthur, Westworld, the other Wachowski brother films such as V for Vendetta, Cloud Atlas .. the list just goes on. The fact that it is loaded with so many seminal concepts weaved into such an entertaining format makes it that inexplicable phenomenon - you could question the casting then, as the only weakness, but I doubt if even the Wachowski Brothers knew what they will end up making. I see film making as pre-Matrix & post-Matrix. It is my personal holy scripture that guides me on every aspect of personal & professional life - and it still keeps resonating with me every time I see it. Watch it if you love punches or punchlines - this film has a truckload of them.

The first and only movie i ever watched back to back to date! Why i am calling this a masterpiece is for two reasons. One: The concept and script blew my mind. In a good way of course. There are so many dimensions to this concept that you can take, grasp and comprehend in so many levels, metaphorically and literally. On one hand i grasped this concept literally. The dystopian narrative which we all have already seen in movies alike; rise of the machines and war between mankind and human beings. Metaphorically speaking, the concept can be related to the top rich elite who run the world. Us, the ignorant public are just their puppets. Listen and believe all their propaganda because at the end of the day, they hold the power to do so. Media! Two: The cinematography and the groundbreaking photography techniques are just awesome. Not did it only introduce this new technique but draws the audience in and take us for a ride. One of a kind ride! I don't think any one of us who had watched matrix will ever for get the bullet scene with Keanu. All in all, kudos to the Wachowskis and Bill Pope. Forever grateful to this masterpiece. One of a kind!

There are a number of good reasons why The Matrix could not be a seen as a serious study of modern urban culture. The modern city depicted in the film has two faces: one is that of gleaming office blocks, the other is made up of the ruins of an industrial past. In both cases, the city that is depicted is a vague and generic representation of post-industrial urbanism. The new modern city portrayed is nothing more than a software program which provides an all encompassing hallucination, keeping humanity mentally 'occupied' whilst their bodies are used to power the mechanistic 'real' world. Therefore, The Matrix is not a film about the physical dimension or actuality of a city, nor a film which can tell us anything about the future state of urban society. It is a paranoid dream of destruction which has been seen a thousand times, for example in The Terminator, Total Recall, and Mad Max. However, by choosing to address the modern physical city by casting the city as a program, the film highlights a range of ideas that are useful for talking about the culture of the city. At this moment, communication networks and information exchange are widely considered to be the most important forces shaping our experience of modern urban culture. (adapted from Highmore, B., Cityscapes, 2005) orangewarm@yahoo.co.uk

Review title: From a deep psychological thriller to a keenu reeves action movie
Review_body:
I watched this movie a week ago. Given how much the world is terrified of AI and how high this movie is rated, I though it will be more thought provoking. The first half of the movie did that pretty well and i was really interested to reach the end. Later on, the movie had the best action scenes i saw a long time ago but I assume it lost its original goal (atleast it is the goal i assumed from the beginning) and i was left there wanting to know more about agent smith ( who was one of the most interesting characters i saw since a long time) but he wasn't given enough screen time and was only portrayed as pure evil. I may be on the minority here but hugo weaving did not do a good job in this movie but i think it is mostly the director's fault. 
Also, casting keenu for such a role which deserves a lot of acting capabilities gave the director little to no options but to have a lot of action scenes and diverge away from what is expected.
Still this movie had a lot of good action scenes and effects. it is regarded as a classic but i just can't see why.

Review title: I still have some doubts about the World we live in.
Review_body: It's been almost 20 years, since The Matrix and It sure left a scar. I still have some doubts about things and tangs, I still see glitches in Deja vus. Not many movies have that kind of impact. Perfect for my taste. The ending was the biggest cliffhanger of my childhood. I have to write a minimum of 5 lines of text for that review, so that last sentence is just a filler.

Review title: This films digs into the ID
Review_body: When I first saw this film I knew nothing about it save that it looked cool. I was sucked into the world immediately and I believed and still believe it's plausibility. Reality is a great subject to play with in a film and there is no better reality spin than the one in this film. What we know as truth is a lie and what we never could believe is the absolute truth. Reeves does a great job, none better. He has the perfect blend of innocence and charm and inner strength and "go for it" attitude. One of my favorite things about this film is that the writer/directors are from my old home town of Chicago. Chicago has produced a lot of great comedians as well as hard core actors and writers. There is something gutsy about people from the Midwest. And this film is a great example of out of the box thinking.

Review_body: I am still watching this movie time to time. Every time I saw the Matrix series I could be able to grab some missing points. I love this movie series specially The Matrix.

Review title: One of the best movies ever! (This review is only about the original Matrix movie)
Review_body: The Matrix is one of the best sci-fi movies ever made!I read it used to be one of Tarantino's favourite ones too, but the second and third ones ruined the whole beautiful idea and brought the overall value of the movie pretty low.The story/philosophy is mind-blowing and the directing, special effects and the overall performance absolutely amazing. Thomas Anderson (Keanu Reeves) is an IT specialist in his day-to-day job and a hacker (alias Neo) during the night. He is looking for Morpheous (Lawrence Fishburn) who could give him the answer to the question 'What is the Matrix?' The more relevant questions to ask, though, would be "How would you know the difference between the dream world and the real world?" and "How would you know if what is happening right now is not a virtual reality?"The antagonist, Agent Smith (Hugo Weaving), is one of my favourite characters. Just watch his mouth - the way he speaks, the tone and pitch of his voice, his pronunciation, even the pauses he makes while speaking, have an incredible effect on the viewer. The concept of people being like cancer to this world is absolutely astounding.Carrie Ann Moss was the perfect choice for Trinity because any other blond, big lipped, big brested 'bimbo' would have totally ruined her character.A few more questions pop up in one's mind. "Haven't we gone too far creating such super intelligent machines?", "What if they become so powerfull one day and take control over humanity?"The acting's just amazing, all of them, no exceptions. The 4 leading characters though... (Morphy, Trinity, Neo & Agent Smith) - (yes, to me there are 4 leads) - I love them all. I can't imagine the movie with any other 4 actors but L. Fishbourn, C.A. Moss, Keanu and H. Weaving. They were born to play those roles.Whoever did the casting did a terrific job. Bravo!Brilliant, absolutely brilliant!

Cannot get enough of this classic. So many themes incorporated to give the story a deeper philosophical meaning, which are not immediately noticed. Definitely one of those movies that really makes you think. Thought-provoking. Great effects. Intense soundtrack. Excellent story.

Review title: Quite a boring and stupid film
Review_body: No solid storyline,no profund world view,just a few people fighting for God knows what, dialogues are weak,cliche, boring,not on point. Characters are aimless and superficial. What a disappointment.

Review title: It's fantastic, but you'll feel like a complete moron afterwards.
Review_body: Personally, I believe that movies are about bringing dreams alive. Nothing does that better than The Matrix. It'll keep you up at night wondering. That's why they made the Animatrix, they probably got bajillions of e-mails asking, "What about this, can you give me some information about this?". Same thing happened with Star Wars, so they put out all those technical books. The Matrix is also great because it took a long time for those guys to come up with and organize. Now most movies are thought up like, "Oh I wanna do a movie about... Capote! Yeah!". This was the Wachowski brother's life's work...I think. I mean, that movie was very complicated, and yet flowed very nicely! I can see why a lot of people don't like it, as it's just too weird for them. As for the rest of us, enjoy.

The story has a lot of elements taken from other movies. There is a lot taken from Terminator, They Live and Nirvana, but the final result is a really great movie with a non original but still wonderful story. It has been such a pleasure watching this movie that I am planning to go to see it again as soon as possible. I think it's one of the best sci-fi/thriller movie ever made.

Review title: A totally new radical concept and plot: The Matrix
Review_body: When you go to the movies, you always come into the darkness of the projection place thinking about you have already seen everything, and well, at least lets give this movie a chance.The Matrix changed everything, there was simply no way you could guess what the movie come up with. I also think that maybe not other movie has generated to much talk and analysis (personal and group) after the lights got back.

Review title: Wow. I just hope they would make a sequel!!!
Review_body: What is the Matrix? Well go and see, hear and feel it for your self. Not on a small screen, but on the big screen. It`s not worth to be looking at otherwise.The first thing I said to my self after the movie was: "Wow. I just hope they would make a sequel". Why???? Because there is so many unanswered questions.Maybe they just should keep it with one movie? Maybe the meaning with the movie is to keep us wondering? I don`t know... Go and find it out for your self... Good luck!!!

...Everyone but people who don't like to think and don't enjoy stunning visuals and action scenes. The plot could be described as "the exact opposite of the Lawnmower Man," and the feel of the film is strangely similar to the computer game Half-Life.If you're the thinking type, The Matrix will leave you wondering for quite a while. The all-inclusive plot and expert exposition are really the heart of the film. Rarely does one see movies so well-thought-out and believable in general release. Not only does this film take you on a mental trip, it makes you think for yourself. If you're sick of all the condescending and unimaginative SF films of the last few years, this is the cure.If, on the other hand, you like to be blown away by startling shots and powerful fights, The Matrix has you covered. The crew has done a great job of creating an immersive environment that both dazzles and frightens. The painfully tedious world of the Matrix and the post-apocalyptic Real World are both rendered with great detail. The action, which seems to unfortunately get the spotlight in many reviews, is, of course, fantastic. You'll get the feeling that you're watching a video game as the characters duke it out. The crazy moves that "bend" the laws of physics will keep your eyes glued to the screen.All in all, this was one of the most believable SF movies I've seen in a long time. When you see all the hard work that went into this movie (as opposed to the half-a$$ed less] ones with which we're inundated), you'll know it was worth the ticket price. Plus it's exciting! If you can't follow it, at least you can just stare and have a good time.

Review title: Some of the best special effects to date
Review_body: The Matrix is a breakthrough film that surpassed all expectations.  Keanu Reeves finally broke the mold of playing bad roles and delivered an extraordinary performance.  For those of you who like the film "Blade", "The Matrix" is definitely for you.  The special effects were unbelievably crisp and very realistic.  This film is a benchmark for films to come.  A real keeper.

Review title: One of the best movies I've seen
Review_body: Though the plot was vaguely reminiscent of other recent sci-fi movies, overall the movie was excellent.  Keanu Reeves delivered a strong performance, and the supporting cast was great as well.  Even if it wasn't for all these things, the movie would be worth seeing just for the special effects alone.  This is a movie you truly need to see on the big screen to appreciate.  And as a bonus, it also has the Star Wars trailer :)  For all these reasons, The Matrix is a movie I strongly recommend.

Immediately upon seeing the first trailer for the movie, I thought that they were showing us all of the cool parts, and that the "No one can be told what the Matrix is, They must see it for themselves" line was just another ploy to get you into the theatres.I never would have thought how right I was.While the movie was ambitious, truly, truly ambitious in what it wanted to say, and with what it attempted in scope in action and plot. Ultimately it fell flat. The action scenes were played out (can you say Jackie Chan?), the SFX are tired and old (c'mon now, if GAP is doing something, it is apparently a fad and no good), the plot was tired after Dark City, and the acting was truly terrible. The only one to pull off a decent job was -gasp- Keanu Reeves.And this isn't going to be a popular opinion. I was in the theatre and in the car with my buddies after the movie. The audience ate this movie up...I just can't figure out why...

With under two months until Star Wars and the unprecedented hype and pageantry of what may be the biggest movie of all time, The Matrix has a big shadow to avoid.Yes, everyone knows the movie has great effects.  A sci-fi movie cannot make it today without them.  What most people may overlook from this movie, amidst the stunning filming and some choice one liners, is that it may be a watermark in Hollywood.  I found the most intriguing aspect of the movie was the story.  It was intricate, thoughtful, and concise.  Some places it was hard to understand what has happening, or more specifically, why it was happening, but don't let it get you down.  It's all explained as you go. This is a movie you HAVE to see at least twice.  It is just so much more enjoyable to soak in the brilliance of a well written script.  It's mystical and technical.  It's retro and futuristic.  It's truly like nothing you've seen before.

Review title: Prepare a space in your video library.
Review_body: One of the best sci-fi movie since Aliens; yes the one with the S.  My god this movie was incredible.  Let me do you a favor, don't listen to critics whom don't appreciate or understand sci-fi genre.  If you like sci-fi, action, consistency of plot, and movie that has refreshing look and feel-See this movie.

Review title: Dangerously close to being the coolest movie I've ever seen.
Review_body: I'm not a science fiction fan.  I like Star Wars and all that, but going into "The Matrix" I didn't have extremely high expectations.  Coming out of that movie, I felt like I had just seen a movie that will be the standard for sci-fi action for years to come.  I won't go on about the storyline, it's too complex for me to even begin.  But the fun comes in the imagination of the story, and the action scenes (which rival that of John Woo).  If you like action movies, science fiction or just entertaining movies in general, you really need to see "The Matrix".  I've never heard an audience clap so loudly before.

As much as i dislike Keanu Reeves' acting ability,...as much as the trailer for this flick told u absolutely nuthin...as much as i had no faith ... i am now a true believer. this movie was fantastic. it had as much action as "blade," but with an incredible sci-fi edge that was deep as well as breathtakingly exciting. the storyline was good and solid and the movie's pace kept me jumping in my seat. what the hell,...i'm going back to see it again!

Review title: Laurence kicks Keanu's a**... Going to see it again tomorrow.
Review_body: I thought that this movie was gonna be cool since it had Laurence Fishbourne in it and you see a scene in the trailer where he kicks Keanu Reeves's a**. BUT... This movie goes way beyond cool with the action, special effects, and plot.I also thought that I'd either give Keanu a chance to perform well as an actor or just ignore his acting, but I didn't have to worry about in this case since he, Laurence, and all the rest worked really well together and pulled off a great performance. I plan on seeing this again very soon (probably tomorrow) and hope to catch the nuances I didn't see before, like the clip from "The Prisoner". My only question is not, "What is The Matrix?" (for I know the answer) but "What was the purpose of The Matrix?" Oh, and as my friend, Zathras would say, "It IS The One."

Review title: Prepare to have your sense of reality destroyed!
Review_body: This movie makes you question everything that you took for granted.  It's amazing!  You will leave wondering whether or not you're who you think you are and whether you can exist in the way you once did. MUST SEE!

Review title: Too much a movie of today.
Review_body: It's hard to believe that people say they like this better than Star Wars. The chic, flip cyberpunk postmodernism will wear thin in a year, mark my words. This is not a timeless movie.

Review title: Best SF movie I've seen in 5 years. Will re-view 3 more times.
Review_body: Best SF movie I've seen in 5 years.  I will be watching it at the theatres another 2 or 3 times paying full fare!  It's got the necessary ingredients for an epic sci-fi flick: 1)Great story line: post-doomsday setting with a prophetic messianic premise. 2)Great actors who happened to be in their "I take my profession very seriously" mode. 3)Expensive, detailed, and fluid (as opposed to stop-action type) special effects. 4)Expert editing with full consideration for continuity and story.

I recently had the chance to see an advance screening of The Matrix at Michigan State.  And OH MY GOD, this movie is going to BLOW YOU AWAY.  A new standard has been set for sci-fi action movies.  Move over John Woo.  Move over Michael Bay.  The Wachowski brothers have redefined what an action movie should be all about.Right from the beginning, this movie is just one HUGE adrenaline rush. And unlike the sorry, pathetic excuses for decent action movies during the summer, The Matrix delivers.  None of that horrendous acting and weak storylines here, The Matrix has been refined down to the smallest details. The action sequences are UNBELIEVEABLE, the choreography is SUPERB, the script is incredible, the special effects are mind-boggling, and the acting is great.  This movie has it ALL.Storywise, like The Usual Suspects, this movie has you guessing and thinking until the end.  What IS The Matrix?  Who IS The One?  The story is incredibly well written and clever, it is definately one of the best sci-fi scripts out there.However, by far the best part of this movie is the action sequences.  The choreographer, Woo-Ping Yuen, known for his work in several Jackie Chan movies, refused to join the crew unless the actors intensively trained in the martial arts everyday for several months.  The work paid off, as you will see right away in the opening scene. I must admire and congratulate the dedication and work put into filming the action scenes by the actors, the end result is truly amazing.  Fight scenes in The Matrix is to car chases in Ronin, they're both in leagues of their own compared to other movies.In closing, I honestly think this movie will give Star Wars a run for its money in overall satisfaction after watching it.  This movie had me thinking for days afterwards, still in awe of it.  It may not be as big or make as much money as Star Wars, but if you're going to see another movie in 1999, let it be The Matrix.

Review title: Butt-Kicking Action Shows Hong Kong Roots
Review_body: This movie shows a lot of the benefits of Hollywood power and will surely dazzle the considerable majority of viewers with action scenes unlike any they have seen before.  The deep pockets of Hollywood have slicked-up with post-production CGI and editing pure Hong Kong style martial arts and gun fight sequences heavily influenced by imagery drawn from Japanese anime. The synthesis is quite fresh, but really is an anticipated evolution of East meets West action motifs.  Worldwide audiences should eat it up. Action-director Yuen Wo Ping is a veteran of Hong Kong masterpieces and should get much of the credit for the visual impact of the action.  To experience more of his dynamic work (not to mention the soon to dazzle America charisma and skill of Jet Li) please check out Fist of Legend and the Once Upon a Time in China series from the  martial arts section of your local video store.  You will not be disappointed.  The Matrix receives an eight out of ten.

The Matrix is stunningly well executed via great direction and flair.  Not a movie of great substance, although it does give you some food for thought when you leave.  Definitely a perfect ten when it comes to the good old Sci-Fi look and feel.  The Matrix (with its visuals and effects) shall do for science fiction movies of the next millennium what Blade Runner and Alien did for Sci-Fi of the '80's and 90's.

Review title: This is what Science Fiction is all about...
Review_body: Had the opportunity to see the sneak preview of this last night. I was hoping as I walked into the theater that it would be as good as I hoped. I was wrong.  It was even better than I had imagined.  Excellent performances from both Keanu Reeves and Lawrence Fishburne.  The special effects were well thought out and the story line fascinating.  A lot of thought had been put into the plot.  If you love a good Sci-Fi movie like I do, go see 'The Matrix'.

Review title: A tapestry of lucid imagery, shocking twists and just a thread of B movie
Review_body: Whoa, it's Keanu Reaves trying to act.  Mind you, I'm not insulting the movie overall by saying that the acting in this film was consistently sub-par.  But I guess that's the good thing about it--consistency.  It was evident early on that the scratchy dialogue was purposely placed there. One could argue that their speech was a result of their society (watch the movie and find out what I mean).  But then one could argue that dolphins taste like chickens.  Worthy Sidenote: Laurence Fishburn tried his best.At any rate, the acting never took away from any of the wickedly ingenious twists (and there were quite a few moments of those) nor did it infringe upon the brilliant fx and cinematography.  What kicked me the most was how the commercials got me to salivate yet still only represented a portion of what was installed for me.  Another reason I believed the "B movie" dialogue to be planned was that some of it was actually quite funny and clever. The comic elements would not have been possible had the film taken on the seriousness of Dark City.  Overall, a worthy deal for the price of a ticket.

Review title: Now this is what I call real movie. By the way, what is "real"?
Review_body: The Matrix is a very confusing movie in the very beginning if you don't have any background knowledge. But this is just making the viewer (in this case, me) more and more anxious to find out what this is all about. 'Cause with Lawrence Fishburne doing the character of his life and doing it to its full extent, and Keanu Reeves probably doing his best picture ever, this is a movie full of anxiety and excitement.When you finally figure out what The Matrix really is (and I'm not gonna tell), the movie really blasts off. With the correct use of special effects, great acting, and a breathtaking story, "The Matrix" will surely take it's place in peoples' mind as one of the best Sci-Fi-Actions in history.The thing about the story, is that it's so unreal and so Sci-Fi, that the directors can do whatever the want, and it won't seem unnatural, 'cause "if" it really was like the movie, stuff like that could be. And we will never really know if the world actually is as described in "The Matrix".You didn't see it yet? Well what the heck are you waiting for? (I voted 10 for excellent)

This is a great movie. The premise was a bit unbelievable and there were holes in the plot. But the movie was so well done that those lapses were forgivable. The way the movie ended and with its success I'm sure there will be a sequel which I will look forward to seeing.

Review title: Interesting premise and good special effects
Review_body: The Matrix is an interesting film that blurs the distinction between reality and the unreal.  Based on the premise that we're all really living in a dreamworld, it asks the question "What is real?"  The answer seems to be "Who cares, so long as it seems good to you?"  There's lots of action and good special effects, though not on the spectacular scale of a Star Wars.  Keanu Reeves looks good, and Laurence Fishburne gives a chilling performance.  It's surreal, and if you're looking for logic, go somewhere else.

What do you get when you take the Terminator, Dark City, and Mortal Kombat and throw it all together? The Matrix.  When I first saw the previews, I was sure it was just another effects extravaganza with nothing behind it, but it was actually a great "popcorn movie"; it was fun to watch.It contains plenty of surrealistic gunfights, kung-fu fights ("you're out of bullets!" "so are you!" "how convenient! now we must fight!"), and trippy special effects to keep anyone interested, while not taking itself too seriously.  How _any_ film besides Star Wars can talk about an "oracle," and "the one," and "dessssstiny" without making an audience crack up is amazing, but this one pulls it off.Oh yeah, and the Episode One trailer is attached to the movie :)Things _not_ to do while watching The Matrix:DO NOT play "air guitars" whenever Keanu says something like     "whoa." He's really not bad in this one.DO NOT speak for Vader and say "it is your dessssstiny."         Fishburne does fine on his own.DO NOT count plot holes.DO NOT complain that movies don't portray computers as they      actually look like in Real Life.DO NOT get tense.  You think this is a movie where the bad       guys win? HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAA.DO NOT count the number of movies The Matrix "borrows" from.     You'll be talking throughout the movie.

Review title: Yes, it IS more than hot special effects!
Review_body: Well, that quote in the preview, "you have to see it for yourself" worked on me; I went and saw it. But still I went only expecting those great digital effects, and not much in the way of a plot. I even wondered if all that computer generated imagery there for no other reason than to dazzle the eye. Boy, was I ever wrong! This sci-fi thriller had a great storyline, written and directed by two brothers. Think of it having a dark reality like in Blade Runner, yet the action and adventure of Die Hard. Great effects, unique sci-fi quirks, and an AI Agent so rotten you're glad to get to the end of the movie just so you can see him get killed off! Unfortunately, I cannot give away the storyline... you have to see it for yourself!

I think sometimes we tend to confuse dark science fiction movies with cyber stuff in them as also being really smart movies. The Matrix, which is really just William Gibson lite, does this unabashedly, it even has some weird pseudo zen-buddhism nonsense to try to overcomplicate "The Matrix". Fishburne spends half the movie saying, "The Matrix" is this, "The Matrix" is that, when he should have just gotten to the point that "The Matrix" is virtual reality. I can't stand pretentious science fiction. Maybe, if you've never read a science fiction novel, or seen a sci-fi movie in your life you'll like this, but otherwise its just a dopey comic book.

A cool premise but a plotless execution.  While watching it, I had the feeling I was seeing a kung fu movie with modern eye candy (lots morphing & slow motion).  If you like kung fu & eye candy, it's probably pretty good.  If you want to see the premise developed with character, plot, & maybe even a moral or two, you'll be disappointed.

Review title: One of the greatest Science-Fiction films ever to grace the silver screen
Review_body: Have you ever had a lucid dream. Y'know one of those dreams where you realize that you're dreaming and you can then alter the course of the dream however you want. Well, what if your entire life was a dream and you suddenly realized it? What would you do? That's the question that Neo faces in "The Matrix".

This is simply one of the best movies I've ever seen! Keanu Reeves usually acts and looks the same in all his movies but this time he really fits the character, and even better than he did in "Johnny Mnemonic". The visual effects are incredible but in no way done just for the sake of having visual effects, they're all completely justified and the story wouldn't have been the same without them. And the story is probably the only truly original story for a movie I've seen in a long time (just when I thought I couldn't be surprised), it had me in suspense from beginning to end. If I was to choose one movie that I was forced to see every day for the rest of my life, "The Matrix" would be it. It really kicks butt in every way, go see it now!!! (Star Wars episode 1 will have a hard time beating this movie!)

Review title: Amazing.. one of if not the best movie I've EVER seen.
Review_body: They REALLY did it this time.  They managed to create a classic SciFi movie without the fallacies and technical impossibilites of  computer related movies of late.  A complex plot well executed, excellent acting, SUPERB visual effects make this an INCREDIBLE film.  If you like ANY science fiction movie... EVER... go see this, it'll rock your world.Bravo to all involved with the film.. thanks for a masterpiece.

I went to see the Matrix thinking it would be a cool science fiction film, with lots of interesting twists. It turned out to be mostly an action film with some nice fight scenes, more along the lines of a Chuck Norris or Jackie Chan film. I am a big science fiction fan, and I was a little disappointed that the film wasn't more interesting, but I enjoyed it anyway.Keanu Reeves looked good as always, but didn't achieve any kind of epiphany or express much human emotion (also as usual, unfortunately.) I would really like to see him increase his emotional range and expressiveness. Without it, he's just too 2D.

Review title: WOW! What a trip! A MUST SEE!
Review_body: A SciFi / Psychological / Philosophical / Action thriller movie all in one! DO NOT miss "The Matrix" in theaters. And, PLEASE, don't ruin it for yourself by reading spoilers!The Matrix will blow you away, there is no question of it. So, do you want to know what the Matrix is? You'll just have to see it for yourself.

To tell any portion of the plot of this movie is to give away too much. All I will say is that even Keanu Reeves could not ruin the quality of this film.  For once an action flick with a plot that wasn't brainless.  Go see this. It is worth the ticket!

I went to a preview screening of this movie, and it kicked a**!  This was as visually stunning as Dark City, except it packs a lot more punch.  It's too bad it's coming out this time of year, it has all the potential to be a huge summer hit, and it is sad that its accomplishments will probably be dwarfed by Phantom Menace.  This has some of the nicest camera work I've ever seen (some of it similar to Lock, Stock & 2 Smoking Barrels).  This movie also manages to create whole world, in the same way that Dark City did.  All in all, this is probably one of the best sci-fi flicks of the decade, and it is certainly much more innovative in its special effects than Phantom Menace seems to be.PS: don't be scared of the fact that Keanu Reeves is in this, he does a good enough job not to ruin the picture

Review title: Watch out! you may happen to be the chosen one!
Review_body:
Imagine you finally wake up from lifelong illusions and your consciousness is but a nightmare. Imagine you don't wake up. Imagine you discover your mind is not necessarily yours. Imagine artificial intelligence creates men and not the other way round. Imagine you realize all dèja vu's and why you miss things you have never seen. Imagine the answer you have always been longing for is seeking you.
Rethink power. Rethink freedom. Mix Calderón's freewill dream; Bob's "Redemption Song" and Blake's arrows of desire; Deckart's awareness; Dufresne's hammer, and Babette's salvation.You may be the chosen one... but only if you choose to be it!

Review title: In "Cyber"wood - The Matrix raises the bar...
Review_body: The way Hollywood makes movies is changing, Spielberg gave us the Jurassics, Lucas gave us the Stars Wars - whose second film of the new trilogy will be filmed digitally, and now The Matrix steps over a new line.Instead of being "WOW'd" by the effects, you will not see them - you will enjoy them, you will feel them, you will be moved by them, but the visual effects of this film have been so meticulously intertwined with the visual mundania, that you won't see them. And you'll love it. This is a fast action, hard hitting, superthriller.Everything that I had ever hope a comic-come-to-life could be.Bravo! Encore!

Review title: Very good eye candy for the big screen
Review_body: It's not the best film, but it's certainly not the worst. The movie asks the basic question, "what is reality?"...it's up to you to decide what the answer is. If you have the slightest inkling to see this film, see it on the big screen, in as large a theater as you can get to. This movie will not be very enjoyable on a television set. The effects are great, and due to the nature of the story, never distract you from the film. Tons of action, but slows down inexplicably in the middle. Keanu doesn't talk much, so Keanu-haters should be able to tolerate him. All in all, a fun time.

That such a derivative and badly-done movie is the most popular film in the United States at the moment is saddening. The inevitable CGI FX (for what it's worth, better than any seen before) coupled with awful acting on Reeves' part and a plot structure that allows for about an hour and a half of exposition all add up to... one over-hyped blockbuster. And what's that romantic interest all about? Accck! I'm voting 1 on this one out of spite. Please have mercy, Keanu! The most edifying thing about The Matrix is the main characters' clothing.

Okay, I just saw this movie and I must admit that it was somewhat confusing at first, but that's because my attention was being focused on the two idiots sitting behind me.  Anyway, if one were to pay attention to this movie (which is what I recommend), one would notice that there was basic philosophy in this movie.  And many people who like philosophy, like me, would absolutely love this movie. However, I did notice the similarity towards the end of the movie with one of Keanu Reeves' earlier movies "Little Buddha".  But I won't say what it is because I wouldn't want to spoil the end for you. Anyway, I would recommend it if you are one of the people who likes to come out of the theater with an expression of disbelief...it's worth it.

I went to see this movie last week, but I just can't get it out of my mind. It was absolutely brilliant; one of the most original and well put together films ever made. But the bit I liked best about it was that it keeps you thinking well after you see the movie. I couldn't give it anything less than a 10 and a high recommendation.

Review title: A very good movie with a great premise.
Review_body: The Matrix is a very good movie with a great premise.It is well written, and well acted and there aren't any holes in the plot (as is usually the case in action/fantasy genre).  The kiss scene is the only shadow on an otherwise realistic film.I wasn't a Keanu Reeves fan before watching this movie, and I'm still not, but he pulled off a convincing performance in The Matrix.The special effects are wonderful, and must be seen to be believed.Overall, the premise, plot, and special effects is what made this movie so good.  I wouldn't be surprised if there was a Matrix 2 -- but I hope that they don't call it that.9/10

Review title: Entertaining, but a major premiss is silly
Review_body: The movie was entertaining, but the writers' ignorance was glaring.The idea of harvesting heat from people to power machinery is silly since you have to put more energy into a person than you'll ever get out.  And with no sun, there would be little plant life to feed the people.  If all they had to feed people was the remains of the dead, the population would have to be in continuous decline.When Trinity said "Dodge this," she gave the agent much more time to get out of the way than he'd need if he were adept at dodging bullets.

Review title: Great Idea, Poor Execution... equals entertaining movie
Review_body: I had first seen the previews of The Matrix in the theatres and I have to admit they intrigued me because of the stunning effects.  However I wasn't going to spend ticket money on a film  with Keanu Reeves.  Then some friends of mine who I respect told me that it was actually worth the money and was a really good movie.With this in mind I went to see the movie and immediately noticed the directors and writers (their brothers) were smart to keep Keanu's dialogue to a minimum.  I also was even more stunned by the special effects.  The lighting was very reminiscent of "The Crow" (the first) and "Dark City", both movies noted for their effects.   Laurence Fishburne gives an excellent performance and the casting was done well.  However, Keanu Reeves as the protagonist actually was a pretty good choice because he plays a very good dark hero.  Though I would have loved to see Brandon Lee play the main part.The Matrix was described to me as reminiscent of Plato's Allegory of the Cave, and if anyone has read this cannon of philosophy it becomes clear that the movie is almost a direct modernization.  However, it seems that the movie could have easily been 20-30 minutes longer.  About half the movie takes place within the Matrix and the other half in the "real world". But,the movie fails to add any depth to either of these two worlds.  Some more time spent on analyzing how Keanu Reeve's character interacted within the Matrix would have been very helpful and interesting.  Instead the movie begins with him already "feeling" something is wrong with the world around him, but shows not a single reason why this would be true.  I would like to think the writer's did this to minimize Keanu's dialogue and role in the movie.  Added to the thin development was the corny fight scenes.  The actual strikes and blows were very well choreographed but there were some very ridiculous posing which made most of them laughable.  If that was the goal of the fight scenes (which I don't think it was) then I can't understand why they were done that way.  The entire theatre couldn't help but snicker seeing Keanu do Martial Arts pose seemingly for no reason whatsoever.To sum up, I think the movie bought up some very interesting questions about reality and our perception of it.  However the two very interesting worlds that were created were not developed enough to satisfy my interest in either.  I came to the site and was appalled to see it ranked #20 on the top 250 list because of these shortcomings.  I gave it a 6 out of 10 and would recommend it to a friend as an entertaining action flick that would not blow them away.

At first, I thought "Oh god, not another one."  We've had the disaster movies (Armageddon, Titanic, ...), we've had the ..., and now we're having the "is it real or is it VR"movies (EXistenZ, ...). But not so with "The Matrix". OK, it's about virtual reality, but what a virtual reality!  The plot is overwhelming, unbelievable and perfectly logical.  A real mind teaser. The special effects were simply fantastic. In my opinion, it's one of the best movies of the year.  You will leave there stunned, overwhelmed and begging for more. If you haven't seen it, go and do so!!! Deserves at least 10/10.

Review title: Everything a movie should be..and more!!
Review_body: I'm still recovering from seeing this film five days ago. The Matrix is the only movie I can honestly say is worth paying seven and a half bucks for. It went beyond my expectations and not only did the special effects blow me away (understatement), the whole premise was amazing, clever, and believable. Every character played their role with perfection and didn't allow the movie to be just visually satisfying. I'd admire these actors a great deal for dedicating many months to learning martial arts. What must have been a very long and difficult experience paid off extremely well, and each actor should be proud. Overall, I walked out of the theater like I had just walked off of a rollercoaster; shaken and flabbergasted. If I had to recommend one film out of the thousands I've seen, it would undoubtedly be The Matrix. Once you've seen it, your perception of cinema will never be the same.

This movie is out of this world brilliant. Here I am eagerly awaiting the arrival of The Phantom Menace and along comes The Matrix to totally steal its thunder. If The Phantom Menace is better than this it will be a good year.Just try to draw a breath during the shootout in the lobby of the government building - it can't be done.

Plotless, lets-see-how-many-weapons-transports-characters-we-can-make-look-like-insect s limit to creativity. About 1.5 hours too long. Clever, intriguing dialogue something like:He: I must bring back Morpheus She: No. You can't go. He: I'm going. She: OK. I'm coming with you. He: No you're not. She: Yes I am. He. OK. Let's go. We need lots of guns.Has everyone seen Life is Beautiful, The Imposters, Last Night, Night on Earth?

Review title: Pretty funny; too bad it's not a comedy.
Review_body: When the audience laughs at every line the hero utters, but it's not a comedy, that's NOT a good sign. I loved the FX, fight choreography, art direction, costumes, and the performances of Fishburne and Weaving. The film has a not-braindead plot and a couple of genuinely memorable, chilling images. But I found Reeves, the dialog, and the pacing appalling. Great action pictures deliver on all fronts: this one had me looking at my watch. A shame, really.

Review title: Decent movie, but could have been a lot better
Review_body: Cool special effects and computer animation.  The plot was not what I expected; it was dark and depressing.  The movie was somewhat predictable and the ending left a lot to be desired.  Laurence Fishburne puts in a solid, if not stellar, performance and Keanu Reeves still needs acting lessons.  Save the eight bucks and wait for it on video.

Review title: Strong impression, makes you think. Great effects!
Review_body: A great trip, an interesting perspective, makes you think..   This movie had a unique twist that made it fun to watch and wonder what was going to happen next.  A movie for the mindfully challenged, there were a lot of hidden messages...  You might have to see this one more than once!

Review title: The plot is unoriginal, but that means precisely squat.
Review_body: I heard of this movie months before it came out, and thought it would be another Sci-Fi flop. I was wrong. This movie just plain rocks.1) Character development is limited to the main character, but I can certainly live with that.2) Special FX are top of the line.3) Story may be unorigianl, but it is a classic plot that is told better here than ever before.4) Cinematography is perfect. 'Nuff said.5) It's just cool!While it's not very origianl, it is done with a twist (a big one to be honest) and I think it is possibly one of the best sci-fi films of all time.
