Lesson #1 After this movie magically appeared, everyone in the whole world now knows for sure that you cannot trust what you perceive as reality. Maybe there is really no such thing as the whole world either. Right?Lesson #2 We now understand that sentient beings of greater knowledge and power have created our intelligent consciousness and the external world observed by our senses. Otherwise we would not have thoughts of existence or any thoughts at all since we would not exist.
We now also understand that higher level sentient being are probably exploiting us in ways we do not understand, just as we exploit animals and plants which are at lower levels then ourselves.I suggest you get busy figuring it all out.
Clear your mind of preconceptions about the nature of truth and the nature of the universe and admit you do not know. Review title: A great movie for it's time but overrated for present day.
Review_body: I am writing my review to try and offset a little how highly rated this movie this is by present day. When the matrix was released I would have gladly rated it a 9, when it was released it was way ahead of it's time with stunning cgi effects and sound effects, if I was rating this movie honestly I would say it deserves a 7.0 , it is still an entertaining film , I dont find myself looking away from the film too often to loose track of what's going on , I understand the story and I do like it unlike many of the other reviewers who rated it honestly a 1 star, I like many others simply believe this movie had it's time in the spotlight and deserves to have a special place in our hearts for nostalgia but I believe there are many other movies far better than this ranked lower than the matrix that are better in every way by a big margin. I dont believe it deserves a spot in the top 100 simply for how good it used to be.

Review title: It´s is not just a Sci movie, is a study in philosophy
Review_body:
I think with almost 5.000 reviews, i dont have too many to add here. But i will try.First time i watched Matrix its was in 2000, ( i was 12 years old) and took me for the inovative action, i loved it!. In 2003 a lit bit older i rewatched as a study in a philosophy class. And that i just remarckble. After that day it opened my mind to many aspects in films and moviemaking. First for the movies itself ( the oracle and its messages, the pils, the Matrix itself and its meaning). And of course, .this broadened my vision of film interpretation, not just in the Matrix itself, but ignited my perception as whole and after that i become a lover of the seventh art,
In short, I liked Matrix Iwhen I was 12 years old, and I loved it when I was older and could really understand it (or thought I did). The perfect mix of sci-fi, philosophy, action, a perfect mix of cult and mainstream movie, a real masterpiece.For all the meaning that this movie has in my life i would say that its ( of course in my opinion) the best movie the human kind did.

Review title: The more I see it, the more impressed I am with Laurence Fishburn
Review_body: On first viewing, this film wowed me with it's effects and eye candy (Keanu Reeves).  After repeated viewing (I'm heavily into eye candy) I have become more and more impressed with the acting (and voice) of Laurence Fishburn. There are several places that the combination of LF's voice, acting and the camera work just stop me cold.  Those are the parts I will remember long after I have moved on to the next/future favorite movie.I have a copy of the wide screen collectors version with shorts at the end explaining how some of the effects were achieved.  Knowing how the effects were produced has done nothing to reduce the 'sensawonda' I feel when watching the film.

Review title: This movie will re-define the way movie-goers go to the movies.
Review_body: This is one of the best visually alluring movies to ever come out on the big screen.  Who would have thought that a Keaun Reeves movie could be this good.  It just goes to show you that the script and the directing were right on the money.  I loved the kinetic feel of the action sequences and the story was a new fresh take on how we as a society are to blame for everything that happens in our lives.  We are responsible for our own lives.Run, run as fast as you can to this film.  You will not be let down.

The first thing I want to say is : I think this movie shouldn't be even compared or quoted as "good enough until Star Wars releases in May " because it shouldn't. This movie is able to stand on its own as a "techno science fiction ". Star Wars in general is a entity of its own and anything to be compared against it would be unfair.This movie has a great script , great characters , one of the best jaw dropping effects I have seen. Keanu Reeves played a much better role then in Johnny "Moronic" but then again the movie was bad in the first place. Laurence Fishburne had a outstanding role ,and he  shines in this movie (let alone his sunglasses). But my only problem is with Carrie-Anne Moss's role as Trinity. Her character was the best out of the group in the beginning of the film , but after she became Reeves side kick her role diminish over the course of the movie. This movie begs for a sequel and really it has to : because I want to know what "Zion " looks like.If you love this movie after one showing see it again, and I just hope it will look great on DVD.

To quote Keanu Reeves would be an understatement when talking about this film. Even if the acting and storyline suffered severe "Holywood-ness" (which they didn't--well maybe a little) the special fx alone is worth seeing. A lot of work has been put into this film to make it one of the best, most inspiring sci-fi films of this decade. The actors had to go through 4-6 months of martial arts training to do these scenes WITHOUT stuntmen, which makes it so much more real and heart pounding (like Jackie Chan action films). There are fx in Matrix that have never been done before, or at least extensively used throughout the film. Such as, what the Wachowski brothers call "bullet-time photography", which provides dynamic camera movement around slow-motion events that approaches 12,000 frames per second, thus the super smooth slow-motion scenes seen occasionally in the film. This is also one of the first films I've seen that effectively recreates the "Anime" action feel. This is how John Gaeta, of Manex, describes it: "The Wachowskis are from the comic-book culture, and are therefore familiar with the Japanese animation style called anime, which we re-created with live actors for this movie. Anime takes advantage of 'the physics of decimation'  it breaks down action into its components and allows those elements to be meticulously controlled to build the most dramatic effect from dynamic movement." But if you're not a fanatic of incredible sfx and action sequences, you'll still be pulled into the plot like the Matrix pulls in its visitors. Don't cheat yourself from the most incredible cinematic experience of your life. Go see this film!

Review title: Immense fun with only a slight stumble at the end
Review_body: I loved the matrix. It had a solid story, which is rare in most contemporary Sci-Fi, tons of eye-candy, and exhilarating action sequences. There are holes in the story, and I think the directors could have stretched our imagination a little further. But any holes that you can find in the plot are easily made up for by the films style and and over-all feel.

Review title: The world is not what it seems...
Review_body: This was an excellent piece of filmwork that posesses wonderful photography, quality stunts and genuinely impressive computer graphics.  This also contains one of the best gunfight sequences I've seen not to mention skillful use of slow motion and lighting.  The plot is well thought out and the acting is satisfactory.  Keanu Reeves plays his role well and is well supported by Laurence Fishburne.  If you ever wondered about why the world is the way it is, this will blow you away!

Hugo Weaving was also great as Agent Smith....I'm not a huge Sci Fi fan, but this is probably one of the best movies I've seen in a long long time..Do yourself a favor and see this bad boy on the big screen, you'll be sorry if you miss this one.

Review title: A perfect action movie, with philosophical implication and great special effects.
Review_body: The Matrix is not only the best action movie I've ever seen, it has substantial philosophical implications that will keep you thinking after you leave the movie.  It has amazing special effects, some humorous lines and moments, great fight scenes and a great sci-fi story.I admit, I saw this movie the Thursday it came out because I'd heard about and seen some of the amazing special effects.  I'd told my girlfriend about it and she came with me.  As much as I expect it to be the quintessential guy movie, she enjoyed the movie tremendously and the plot and acting turned out to be a lot better than what I'd expected.The movie made me think so much, I went home and opened my Philosophy textbook 'Reason and Responsibility' and willingly read about human knowledge, it's grounds and limits, the mind-body problems, the implications of AI and it's effects on our life.I liked the movie so much, that my cousin and I saw it the very next day. My cousin liked it so much that he also returned to see it two days in a row.  The movie is a lot different the second time around and I found it even more enjoyable than the first time.  Everything the oracle says makes a lot more sense, you can appreciate the special effects without being too involved with what is coming up.  The beginning makes a lot more sense and you notice new things, such as Neo's book, containing a chapter titled "On Nihilism".  While I saw a review for the movie that called it overly philosophical, I would call it a thinking man's action movie.I recommend this movie be seen by anyone who even remotely likes sci-fi or action and/or great special effects, and that if you liked it the first time, see it again in a movie theater.  It's worth it for the special effects and the different perspective on the story.

This movie had great effects and camera angles.  Definitely not a movie for anyone who suffers from nightmares!Extremely thin and disjointed plot for a sci-fi flick.  It reminded me of late '60s and early '70s "stream of consciousness" movies.  It probably would help to be stoned on something before entering the theater.All this combined made for a way too long and way too boring evening out. But it will do fine for the "what you see is what you get" crowd.  Leave your I.Q. at home.

This movie is simply stunning.  The visual effects are some of the best I've ever seen, if not THE Best.  The movie is gripping.  The action never lets up.  You are pulled in from the very beginning and are left begging for more at the end.  The story itself and the questions it raises are incredible. They remind me a lot of a book called "The Mind's I" by Douglass Hofstadter and Daniel Dennett.  The main question is could this really be happening? How can you even pretend to know what someone else experiences if you are not really them?  If you are interested by the questions of AI, separating mind and body, reality, and being other objects, I would seriously suggest you read "The Mind's I."  Most of it is very interesting and raises questions about the reality of the world we live in.

Review title: An exciting sign of what young filmmakers will be able to achieve with CGI special effects.
Review_body: I enjoyed "The Matrix" because the tremendous special effects fit into the story well and served to enhance the film, not define it.  Too often I find CGI distracting, but in a movie that writhes with as much as intensity as this one- it simply brought me to edge of my seat. I give total credit to the young brothers that created this film for imagining the story, and having the wisdom to know that story is, and always should be the most important thing. Towards the end of the film, I wasn't waiting to see bigger guns or cooler kicks, I wanted to know how the story was going to turn out.

Review title: The most stylish movie ever made
Review_body: I was about 12 the last time I left a theatre and wanted to go back in and watch the same movie again, right then and there...until The Matrix. Non-stop plot progression (character introductions last about 5 seconds) coupled with some of the best fight sequences I've come across and almost seamless special effects combine to make this an intense, thought-provoking movie. Morpheus' "born into bondage" monologue strikes disturbing bells even without the matrix. Creditable performances from all the main characters, an internally consistent plot and, unusually, science that didn't make me want to throw up in disgust made my suspension of disbelief not just willing but unnoticeable. Sets, costumes, lighting, cinematography (I loved the "freeze the frame yet rotate the camera around the main subject" technique and thought it could have been used once or twice more); everything hangs together beautifully to create an often dark and oppressive atmosphere which perfectly complements the story.

Review title: Special effects are the only reason to see this film
Review_body: Dark City and The Truman Show were films that caused me to rethink my view of the world.  The Matrix attempted to copy the themes expressed in these films with little success.  It relied on energy and special effects to deliver its message.  I strongly suggest that this film be skipped in favor of the previously mentioned films.

Review title: Great special effects. Some plot holes
Review_body: Great special effects. A visually stunning film. The story had some holes in it, but the visuals more than made up for any deficiencies in the script.

OK, I'm probably one of the very few people that found this film incredibly boring, tedious and predictable.It felt like I was watching Men In Black V. Terminator 2.  I kept expecting Tommy Lee Jones or Will Smith to turn up any minute.  The concept of bad(?) guys wearing dark suits and sunglasses and trying to hide the truth from us mortals has been done before in MIB.  The concept of computers taking over the world in the future and one person being the saviour was done before in Terminator 2.It was predictable that Mr Keanu Reeves was the chosen one, yet he would not realise this fate until there had to be a near death scene where the audience were all to believe he was dead, until he realised he was him - the chosen one.  There was lots of mush in there about if you know then it will happen, oh please fetch me the sick bucket.The special effects are OK, not much to shout home about, and definitely did not add anything to the film.

Review title: Two worlds, one artificial - the other real - separated only by the feds, but not for long.
Review_body: I really enjoyed this movie.  It had a unique "dark" feeling to it and an ubelievable amount of action.  It was awesome.  Special effects made the whole story connect.  This movie, I think, people will either love or hate. I, loved it.

Review title: I expected The Matrix to give me a rush. It blew me away
Review_body: The Matrix is everything Blade could have been, and then some. It's raw, it's intelligent, it's awesome. This movie isn't just another 'what-is-the-earth-like-100-years-from-no'-type of film. It gives you the same mindgames as Total Recall, the same cutting edge special effects as T2 had when it was released, and yet it's simple. Simple because you'll probably enjoy it in whatever mood you're in. Don't take my word for it, go see it!

Review title: Intriguing, awesome special effects, Reeves and Fishburn are great
Review_body: I finally got to view this movie and all I can say is excellent.The presentation was great; the movie had me captivated for the start. "The Matrix" is the best SCI-fi/action movies so far for the year.This is one of those films that you should see especially if you're into sci-fi and action films. This film has in something for fan of either genre.The overall movie was great in my opinion, only problem I had with the plot was Neo (Reeves) having to get a kiss from Trinity (Moss) to revive him after he is shot to death by Agent Jones (Taylor).(Don't take my word for it.... go and see it for yourself once or twice)

Review title: Great effects vs. great plot holes
Review_body: Don't get me wrong. This is a great guy flick and I like guy films as much as the next guy. The Wachowski Brothers do a remarkable job combining sfx with kung-fu and 8mms. The premise even creeped me out (and that's good!). My main problem was these glaring plot holes. In order to turn this film into a Blade Runner type classic sci-fi film, the filmmakers would have had to not give in to the Hollywood mentality that movies must end on a hopeful note, heroes must win, etc.The movie's ending left a very bad taste in my mouth (kind of like battery acid). Too bad because I liked all the sfx and fights. Cool stuff. My ending is not the kind of ending to pull in audiences, but it certainly would have been more honest. If the producers had been honest with us and themselves, I would probably given the film another point or two.

That's the way this movie went.  It started off slowly and confusing. But the pace was gradually picked up and the last hour was total action and explosions.  I went to this movie for the fight scenes and actually came away seeing a movie with a great sci-fi plot and some of the best action sequences ever.  9.5 out of 10!

After Keanu's last romp as a Cyberpunk in Johnny What's-His-Name who would have thought he'd ever be able to redeem himself in that type of role again? Well, the Wachowski brothers obviously did. Granted, the term "Cyberpunk" has a tendency to turn people off since it's been dragged through the mud thanks to the internet but what the Wachowski brothers have done is put a slightly different spin on the genre.  Though many of the plot devices used in The Matrix are easily referenced from other movies, they are presented in a slightly different fashion that breathes new life into them.The special effects are used effectively and don't overpower the viewer. The sound effects, on the other hand, are loud - almost too loud.  The sound effects were a bit overdone in my opinion.  Sound should be used to accentuate the visuals, not drown it out.  In several instances the sound got a bit too chaotic and made it hard to concentrate on the film.The action scenes are some of the most inspired martial arts this side of Hong Kong cinema.  The use of wires and a majority of the slow-motion shots were done exceptionally well.  Because the Wachowski brothers are notorious for extreme closeups, some of the action scenes aren't always framed properly and the amazing choreography doesn't give the audience the full impact (sorry for the pun).  The director of photography, for some odd reason, had scenes with people dressed in black fighting in extremely dark interior spaces which, oddly enough, makes it difficult to see what was going on.But these are only minor gripes for a movie that stands as 1999's first Sci-Fi/Action hit for the year.**** out of *****

First of all, i want to say that this movie is one of the best movie's ever made in almost every aspect. but instead of describing how great it is. i want to point 3 thing that lacked in this movie. 1. the audience was never told why neo started wondering about the matrix and why did he want to find the answer to the question: what is the matrix? what made him find out about the existence of the matrix? 2. i wish that the character of trinity had more aspects then just the romantical aspect in this movie. i wish that her character was more developed. 3. i wish that the audience would know more about the oracle character. again, i wish that this character was more developed.other than those 3, i think this movie is (almost) perfect.

This movie just rocks! It just passed The Fifth Element as my favorite sci-fi flick of all time. If you haven't read anything about the plot, please don't! It was so cool to figure out the plot with the protagonist, Neo. I was truly awestruck. This movie has martial arts, gunfights, philosophy, humor, a little bit of romance, a whole lot of heroism, and an enemy that everyone living on this planet can justifiably hate without remorse. If you don't like ickiness, the worst part (I think) is right after Neo demands a phone call while being interrogated; so close your eyes for a few minutes. Blech. Anyway, do go and see this movie, but remember, it's just a movie. Movie producers are not the philosopher-kings of this world. You may be highly disturbed if you don't remember this after watching.

Review title: Movie rocked! Storyline, effects and action make it the T2 of '99
Review_body: Great concept.  Not totally realistic, but close enough to be lots of fun to think about and make it a great story.  Incredible action sequences.  I'd say it's pretty much the best movie ever, especially if you like Sci-Fi and Action.

This movie had everything.  Great special effects, a strong story, and even Keanu Reeves put in a good performance.  I spent the whole movie switching between shuddering at the view of the future, and saying "Wow, how did they do that shot."  Definitely one of the best action movies of the past few years.

I know people who say, "Keanu Reeves, oh brother."  To them I say, "Get your butt to see The Matrix."This movie was UNBELIEVABLY good!  Its one of those movies where the heroes are Gods, but in this one there's actually a reason why.The storyline I won't tell you.  All I'll say is that if it's based on a book, I'm going to go read it.  What a plot!

Yet another film from the school of thought that thinks special effects compensate for no plot or character development.  At least Keanu isn't given an opportunity to act; that really would have made this film horrendous. Instead, it's an o.k. action film that has its fun effects and its dull moments.  Consider it a lukewarm appetizer before Star Wars opens next month.

Review title: Present - effects, combat, style. Absent - acting, plot,script.
Review_body: In a parallel universe William Gibson knocked this story out in a morning, read it back and consigned it to oblivion. In the alternate reality that is late nineties cinema the story has resurfaced and stretched to over two hours. You can tick off all the desirable style elements, herds of animals contributing to the de rigeur black leather, more pistols packed than Lara Croft with the endless ammo cheat and Keanu Reeves, the most other-worldly element in the whole competent but workmanlike effort.

Review title: The new standard in sci-fi action
Review_body: Incredible, ground-breaking action sequences make this movie ultra-cool, but it's more than just flying bullets. This movie is like anime come to life.Yes, the Wachowski bros. toss in bits of every myth and fantasy they could find, yes, they lift bits from dozens of other movies -- from Alien to Star Wars to Face/Off -- but they make it all work. Even better, they draw the best performance from Keanu Reeves since Speed.As sheer movie spectacle goes, it's brilliant.

Amazing special effects, mind twisting plot, and excellent music combine to make this one of the best sci-fi flicks in years.  I'm still wondering if I'm in a Matrix two days after I saw it.  A must have on DVD!

Review title: It's like watching a Hong Kong action film that has only Hollywood actors.
Review_body: If it wasn't for the special effects, I would have left the theater in the middle of the film. I mean, this is one of those films whose dialogue is so lame, you just want to tell the actors to stop talking and start fighting. I thought Hugo Weaving was going to be good, until I got sick of the way he was talking. The Wachowski brothers should have made him into a silent character, one who does everything but talk. The special effects were spectacular, but I have to say the action scenes, especially when the actors were shooting at each other, were really unnecessary. When Keanu Reeves was firing his weapons, he was always in slow-motion. It's like watching a Hong Kong action film that has only Hollywood actors. This film should only be watched by people who are EXTREMELY fond of special effects.

The movie was great.. You really need to follow the film closely..Don't get up out of your sit for popcorn..You just might miss some of these Special Effects that are incredibly believable. A well thought out film both special effects and dialogue. Keanu Reeves and Laurence Fishburne both deliver great performances along with Carrie-Anne. Be careful, it could get you thinking about were and what we live in know.. Is it Real or Is it False..Our surroundings.. Find out what the word "Matrix" means to their world. Are you one of the Chosen? Computer and Sci-Fi Fans - it's a Must to See Movie.

This movie was totally awesome.  It had a good script, good actors, an excellent plot, and the movie was just well organized.  I loved the action, and the effects.  Didn't care for the end too much with the romance stuff, but other than that the movie was very well done.

Review title: This movie summarizes all sci-fi and peoples fears into one movie.
Review_body: After seeing the first trailer for this film I wanted to see it the day it came out. So far twice. Is this world just a false reality?? Or are we just mindless drones looking for a way out that does not exsist. This movie starts out with a mind blowing scene with Trinity, who then goes on to demonstrate her ability to jump higher, run faster and escape from anything out there. If I go on then there will be no purpose for you to see the movie. Once again this movie was the best I've seen this year, the f/x only made the plot more belivable.

Review title: Amazing! Dark City, Blade Runner and any John Woo film in one!
Review_body: I saw the trailer for this film on my computer about a month ago and was waiting with baited breath to see it! Well I was not disappointed. It was excellent. Really good special effects, gun fights, bleak-futuristic cyber-punk film-noir stylee. YES! The Kung-fu scenes were very well choreographed, and the actors themselves performed the fighting, very fast, very exiting. Even Keanu Reeves managed to do well in his role as "Neo" the Hacker, turned Leather-clad, sub-machine gun wielding fighting machine. The coolest film I've seen since 12 Monkeys SEE IT NOW, Miss it at your peril!

Review title: An absolute must for people who like a good paranoia!
Review_body: Although you can't be completely objective the day after you've experienced something I'd have to say that this has to be one the best movies I have ever seen! It has the music (LOUD!), it has the actors (COOL!), it has the effects (UNBELIEVABLE!) but most of all it has that wonderful "None Of This Is True" angle.If you've ever found yourself at the end of a good party talking to someone and discussing the possibility that the world is designed just to fool you and none if this is really happening, you will know what I mean. It usually leads to the question: "If the world is created specially for ME, will YOU disappear once you walk out of site?"A friend and I where already p****d that they stole "our" idea to make "The Truman Show" but now The Wachowski Brothers gave us the change to watch our paranoia in a +2 hour during rollercoaster ride and I was blown away! Forget Star Wars and go see this movie!

This movie is great, a definite must see for any fan of The Terminator (1&2), Total Recall, Blade Runner and/or Strange Days. Also has the eerieness of Se7en and Dark City.Even with Keanu's background of poor acting in poor scripts, he makes a nice comeback with this movie.  Laurence Fishburne (aka Cowboy Curtis) is also great.  Plus, lets not forget that Trinity (Carrie-anne Moss)!Any one that doesn't think this movie is great, tell me what is?  It has action (setting a new standard in visual effects), a great story (any comic book fan will love), a sappy love angle (probably the only poor part of the movie) and great suspense.The only ones I can see not liking this film are people that don't have the intelligence to follow the story.  Some women that are Action film haters may not like it either, although when I saw it on opening night, 75% of the audience were women, and they all loved it.

I saw 'The Matrix' and have to admit. I Loved It. The first few minutes will blow you away. The stop animation fights got you tense and then kicked some. But unfortunately, after the first few minutes, it gets dry for awhile. There are exciting bits here and there during that dry time, but really it's a first five minute/last 30 minute movie. Everything in the middle was just to get you to the last scene(s). But those last scenes didn't disappoint me at all.I really think this is a movie I'm going to go back and see in a week or so, to get it burned into my head a little better. One of the good things about this movie is, it can make fun of itself. Through the whole thing, It would take itself seriously, then suddenly, something was ridiculous, and that really broke the tension. The audience laughed during the funny scenes, and actually clapped after some of the fight scenes and moves that the actors did.The fight sequences were so creative, and original. The special effects were amazing. Just so fun to watch. So surreal. Almost convincing, but that's not really necessary for this kind of movie, because the special effects are there to make things surreal. One thing can be said though, the ending is predictable.  Through the whole movie, you are trying to figure it out.  They tell you about it, but never tell you everything. That makes it really interesting.  All in all, if you are a Steven Seagal fan, see it. If you are a sci fi fan, see it. If you are a Keanu Reeves fan, see it. And if you like girls(and guys) in black leather, see it. So go out and pay a couple of bucks for The Matrix, if nothing else, you can make fun of it afterwards by saying "what is the matrix?" and doing some stop animation/slow motion fighting with your friend, as my friends did.  But I definitely recommend this movie.

The Matrix had me cheering and nearly jumping out of my seat just as I had done when I saw Terminator 2. Both movies frame the 1990's perfectly and both deal with a possible future for man if he doesn't, in a sense, wake up from the machine oriented reality he has fashioned for himself. Do you see how wild The Matrix is? It has got me babbling on about reality and machines!! Cool, man!!

Review title: I don't know about you , but it certainly had me
Review_body: This film is one of pure genius, with Reeves back to what he does best, and Fishburn overflowing with coolness. If you haven't already seen this film then you don't know what you're missing. A film which sets new standards in the action genre which many films will have to comply with (which can only be a good thing). This film has everything and is for everyone.  I have seen this twice, and it's just as good the second time. I bet George never saw this phantom menace coming!

Review title: The special effects don't carry this DOG...
Review_body: This was one of the worst movies I've ever seen. > Overall, the movie is a grotesque union of bad science fiction and bad philosophy.  The writers decided to trot out that old "what if a mad scientist had your brain in a jar..." nonsense except this time it's a mad computer program and it's your whole body instead of just your brain.  The director's view of Man's nature is one of a cross between a virus infecting the face of the Earth and a battery.The special effects are well done, but aren't good enough to carry the rest of the film.My recommendation is "Don't waste your money", I'm sure sorry I wasted mine.

Review title: When so many films that try to capitalize on the virtual world fall flat, the Matrix exceeds expectations! The Matrix was a refreshingly good sci-fi film with excellent visual effects and great casting.
Review_body: I'll admit... I'm not a big Keanu Reeves fan, so I kept my expectations a bit lower than usual when I went to see this movie. I was definitely surprised! I think this was his best performance ever. Neo is a likable character thrust into a world that he was neither aware of nor oriented to, and then expected to save. There is an innocence about the character that is touching when he discovers the Matrix and learns how to interact within it. As the movie progresses, you really hope that he is the One.The rest of the cast was wonderful as well. I'm usually critical of the strong female image many movies try to project. But this movie surprised me there as well. Trinity, played by Carrie-Anne Moss, is also an interesting and compelling character. She initially appears to be Neo's watcher/bodyguard, but somewhere the relationship becomes more personal... and even more interesting.The visual effects were the best part of the film. That's mostly because I can often clearly see the computer enhancements and can point them out. These visual effects flowed smoothly and were not obvious. It really was fantastic.Lastly, I've got to say I loved the Oracle. She was great.

This film fairly exceeded my expectations.  Right off the top of my head I cannot think of a single thing that I disliked about it (as I sit here listening to the soundtrack).  I can't claim that this is a "good" or "great" movie, or give it a fair, unbiased rating.  What I do say is that I'm extremely glad that I spent the 120 plus minutes sitting in the dark, and becoming totally absorbed into another reality.  Movies to me are a total form of escapism, a glimps into impossible dreams, and in that aspect "The Matrix" more than accomplished its purpose.

Review title: One of the coolest movies ever
Review_body: The Matrix has a very complicated plot and can be hard to understand at first but it makes up for everything with its very unique effects.  This has got to be the BEST sci-fi movie so far this year!  What I really like about it is that it gets me thinking about what if WE have a matrix too.  What if we are all sleeping right now?  Great movie.

The movie was great!  The actors were perfect in their roles, the plot was a fantastic idea, and the action scenes were out of this world.  The only thing you might be disappointed in is the ending of the movie.  Even though the movie was over 2 hrs. long I wanted more.  Maybe there will be a sequel.

A movie that pays tribute to many of the great sci-fi movies of the past while charting its own territory.  Great, great action sequences, superb cinematography, well realized concept.  First half hour a little slow but after that the movie pulls you in and just keeps building.  Please let the Academy nominate a sci-fi movie for once and give full credit to the creative visuals in this film.  Critics usually have trouble "getting" sci-fi movies: this movie's visuals deserve the chance to put an end to the embarrassing lack of critical appreciation of this genre.
Quite simply, The Matrix is an incredible combination of state of the are visual effects, awesome fight choreography, and impressive screen-writing.  A must see for any sci-fi or action film fan.

Review title: Computer generated reality a way of life.
Review_body: This is one of the best movies I have seen in a long time.  I didn't even mind the $9.50(canadian, yet!) price tag.  In fact, I am planning on seeing it again.  Excellent cast.  All I can say is, it really makes you think. The premise is an updated version of the "What if we are just an experiment in a petri dish in a lab somewhere?" question. Even if you don't like Keanu, it's still a really good pic.

Review title: Fantastic story, done in the best PKDickian manner.
Review_body: I want to congratulate the film makers on a wonderful story and exciting special effects film. PKD fans will applaud the question asked and sci-fi fans will love the action.  A well done film. Kudos to Mr. Reeves also, I forgot all about the previous films he made me cringe in.

Review title: One of the best films to come out of the 20th century...minus Keanu.
Review_body: This is truly one of the best movies I have seen in a long time.  It's been what seems like forever since a mainstream production has been so artistic and yet so able to capture everything that makes a good movie interesting. All the action, drama, and especially the visual effects are astounding. The only drawback is the fact that Keanu Reeves plays the character of Neo which is the film's focus.  If Keanu knew how to act instead of just playing himself as every role he's ever done then this film would be ever better, which is hard to imagine.  Another wonderful feature of this movie is that it has a full and interesting plot.  Unlike most films of the recent past, the storyline not only builds through out the movie but it also comes to a very well done conclusion.  The Matrix is definitely an instant classic in the sci-fi genre.  See this film...then see it again...and again...and again...

Walking out of this movie, I felt giddy and excited.  It was a fun flick with impressive special effects that didn't seem entirely tacked on.But the more I thought about it, the more I felt cheated and manipulated. The plot was fairly decent... for the first half of the film.  Then it pulls out and lets the special effects take over.  I know the purpose of film is to manipulate emotions, but being stroked into thinking a movie is great because it looked pretty is just insulting.I recommend seeing it at least once, especially on a big screen, but not because it's the great sci-fi film everyone's touting it to be--because it's a good two hours of mindless entertainment with some decent loud music and entrancing special effects.

Review title: It's one of the best movies I've ever seen, and it makes history
Review_body: The Matrix is one of the best movies I've ever seen, and maybe not many people could understand it because it plays with the reality and the ficcion. It's about technology and where technology could take us, about the progress with the virtual reality. And that's why this movie is so good, for the plot itself and the visual effects. I only see one thing wrong and it is at the end, the scene between Neo and Trinity. I don't comment it only say that this things is typical in Hollywood.

Review title: One of the best movies of 1999
Review_body: A great movie!  I have seen Dark City, Bound, Hackers, The Crow, and Johnny Mnemonic.  If you liked all or any of these movies I highly recommend The Matrix.Keanu Reeves gives one of his best performances along with a great cast. This was not a "Supporting" cast in my opinion as they each brought something of their own into the vision of this movie.Among them, Belinda Mcclory whom I believe was a wonderful addition to the cast.  She brought a bit of attitude and beauty to the screen.  Plus, she made herself stand-out in one seen while everyone was wearing black, she wore white.  That's style.And I think that pretty much sums up "The Matrix."  Style.

Review title: A great sci-fi action film, with SUPERB special effects . . .
Review_body: A GREAT sci-fi action movie.  When I heard a day before it opened that people were raving about it I knew that was a good sign.  It ranked up there with Blade, as an action movie; and surpassed it as far as storyline.  If you liked blade, bladerunner, etc., you should like this flick.

Review title: This movie ROCKS! Great action! Great plot! Awesome effects!
Review_body: Seldom has a movie exceeded its anticipation as Matrix. I saw the trailers and thought cool.  The trailers do it little justice.  The action sequences: hand to hand, gun fights, and others are amazing.  The plot makes an X-File conspiracy look tame.  This movie took me to the edge of special effects and action without sacrificing a great science fiction story line.  Anyone with the capacity for understanding its plot would enjoy this movie.  Aside some action scenes that may be scary and harsh, (no nudity, little profanity [gave a finger],deaths) I would recommend this movie to any age group with ANY kind of taste.  This movie rocks!The best way I can describe this movie is a better written, if possible, Dark City with an even more mind boggling plot and better special effects along with the added bonus of great action sequences.  Whooh, say that three times fast.  Back to my original comment, MATRIX is a great movie I would see more than once and can't wait to purchase.

Review title: Entertaining, but not as thought provoking as it tries to be.
Review_body: The Matrix is enjoyable to watch and possibly even worth the eight bucks, but the concept is so far-fetched that it falls short of being as thought provoking as it tries to be. They want you to walk out of the theater with the Oliver Stone type feeling of "It's a conspiracy, man!" but it doesn't exactly work. The makers of the movie could have taken an example from Men in Black, in which the concept of the movie explained some weird stuff that is in our world so that it would make sense, but The Matrix just introduces even weirder new stuff.

Nearly mindless Hollywood action/kung-fu/sci-fi entertainment. Interesting premise is beaten to death by unrelenting video game mentality and special effects, clichéd ending. Go for the matinee cheap seats.

This movie left me wanting so much more from the script and the rest of the plot. That and Keanu Reeves seriously needs to spend more time with his band. Don't get me wrong, the kung fu sequences were spectacular, and the special effects were, to this day, untouched. I loved this movie because of the special effects and the concept. I believe it could have been presented better through the: script, dialogue, and choice of leading man. (NOTE: Check out the sound track. It's very well done and fits the movie quite well.)

Review title: One of the Best Sci-Fi movies I've ever seen
Review_body: This one has it all.  First, I have to say that I was drawn toward this one by the f/x I saw in the trailers. I was amazed that the plot was of the same quality. What amazed me even more was that Keanu Reeves did not stink! Granted, he played a part that called for the dopey look at times, so he wasn't completely out of his element. Still, he pulled everything off well.I know Star Wars is going to be the sci-fi movie of the year, and will probably trounce this movie in almost every measurable category, but even so, the bar has been raised for the action/sci-fi genre.

If you have to see two movies this year ('99), this would certainly be one of them (the other, would be that small George Lucas project). The Matrix is a high tech, gritty sci-fi thrill-ride of what could be reality. Great fight scenes, incredible special FX (look for the awesome "bullet dodging scene"), great performances from Reeves, Fishburne and Moss and what has to be the greatest Hong Kong cinema-inspired shootout EVER make The Matrix one of my all-time favorite films. However, there are some faults, such as the flimsy plot (the background story is excellent, and the following CGI vision, is well, scary, however), just average script, "tacked on" romance, Weaving's "not too bad"-bad guy, and the tackiness of Sydney's skyline (a city with more skyscrapers would've been awesome, but too dangerous for the shot). But these faults are minor, and don't detract too much from the film that is THE MATRIX. Watch it. NOW.

The only thing that attracted me were the fighting scenes and the special effects, the rest all sucked.  Horrible acting by Keanu Reeves, so so by the others.  The most cheesy cliche dialogue I have seen in a long time.  I just couldn't stop laughing, when lines like: "Never send a human to do a machine's job" appeared on the screen.  And the plot, although it looks deep, I just couldn't relate with it.

From the plot, which doesn't make itself fully known until almost halfway through the movie (this is a good thing - it keeps you in suspense), to the special effects, which were beyond stellar, this movie ranks as one of the best I've ever seen. Irregardless of the fact that it draws many elements from other stories of the genre, this movie kicks a$$. No matter what, see this movie at least once. Depending on your point of view, the only problem is with the ending - there was no real resolution of the main plotline. This is bad if this is a single movie, but if there's one thing about the genre, it's sequels. This open ending allows for another movie - which would definitely be a good thing.

Review title: I stand corrected with awesome story-line, action, and SFX!
Review_body: I have to admit.  I had some doubt about this movie and was originally expecting this flick to have glorified special effects and absolutely no story whatsoever.  However, I was totally wrong.  The story was beautiful and well-made!  The effects were not over-played, and were added to only accentuate the mind-blowing narrative.  The action was stupendous with its attempt at making realistic anime-style fighting sequences.  The characters were also memorable and fun.  And this movie makes you think about our precepts and perception of reality.  Truly, one of my favorite original sci-fi flicks!

Review title: It is what movies should be:Visual
Review_body: With the coming of technology,it was just a matter of time that the cinematic experience would change.The very good use of slow motion and suspended in time view, put The Matrix in the leading edge of the new techno-cinema. Because the script moves sometime as slowly as paint drying,this movie is kept from being a great one. But for me as well as many thousands, this atmospheric film is a joy for the vision a movie should be, but don't miss any line because you are going to need help to catch up.Welcome back Keanu.

Who would have though that philosophical allegory, Hong Kong kung fu and high-concept sci-fi would blend so well ?  Unique, thought-provoking and exhilirating, this is could be the best film of 99.  A must

This film was about to finish its runI went to see it at midnight thinking I might fall asleep, wrong .What an incredible film ,not since Bladerunner has a film had such an impact.Apparently it's available in 2 weeks on region1 DVDI'm going to buy a machine and the DVD to play it onWOW
I saw the 10:45 am show today (opening day). I'm leaving in 5 minutes to see the 10:00 pm show. It is THAT good.

Review title: Matrix is the best Sci-Fi movie to date.
Review_body: Here are a few thoughts on why this movie is so great:The kung-fu is spectacular for a movie not out of Hong Kong.   They even did the nice touch of having Keanu learn some of Bruce Lee's little moves from movies like "Enter the Dragon".  But the camera tricks, slow-motion, and actors did a wonderful job!  Wow...  It isn't better than the final fight in Jackie Chan's "Drunken Master II" -- the best fight in all of Martial Arts movie history -- but it is great!The special effects are spectacular.  The first fight scene between Trinity and the police...its energy and speed set the tone of the movie...awesome!This movie is pure anime.  When you watch some scenes they are manga...there are close ups with just enough room for a thought bubble.  The stop-motion pans set a style of viewing that allows one to see a kick or a punch as a process of many distinct moves.  The bounding, fighting, gunslinging... all very very nice and all very live-action anime stuff (flipping and shooting and fighting, oh my!).Finally, and most important, a sign of a great movie must leave you wanting more.  What decision will they make?   Go see it.

Superb special effects. Hideous,stupid,time consuming philosophising and acting,especially by Reeves.The kung fu moves are the best thing in the movie except that the original japanese and hong kong studios have been doing them for years with really skilled martial artists.A 10 for general consumption and a zero for people with a brain. New term for grossing more than 100 million: gross out.

Review title: WOW! I was blown away by the incredible action sequences!
Review_body: This movie breaks new ground in the world of action movies. Good story, inovative footage and action sequences that will set a completely new standard.

Review title: Maybe, Maybe Not! When's the sequel?
Review_body: Great depth in characters, EXCEPT for Neo who is most un-inspiring...the character doesn't inspire sympathy, understanding, excitement or anything (positive or negative) he's just there. He is the weakest part of the film uplifted to the rank of 'Chosen One' - the only reason he was 'chosen' was because it would increase box office takings by having the dead pan Keanu Reeves playing it. But, and it is a BIG BUT, all the other characters are brilliant. MORPHEUS is a superb caricature (I could follow that guy), TRILOGY full of everything human and superhuman (I could fall in love with this one), AGENT SMITH is spine shuddering (I'd run away). All brilliantly acted great dialogue and expertly delivered, I would certainly go out of my way to see any of them again - unlike Reeves...snoringly, boringly banal - they were all totally believable in an unbelievable film. I'd have given it 10 if it wasn't for Neo, I wish he'd have taken the blue pill!The story is fine borrowing loads of references from 'Alice in Wonderland', Japanese animation, pseudo religious themes and even Batman. The basic theme makes the imagination kick in to overdrive for long after the film making it great value for money as a simple flick. The story is full of gaps and missing questions and answers, for instance what IS going on at Zion, what's it about, who's in charge and when is the sequel???SFX - uncompromising in their brilliance - great combination with the Kung Fu - more like poetry than flashy nonsense.Worth seeing, but I reckon the spin offs are more interesting see the web site though it's very contrived.There are no laughs, it's never that shocking and I didn't come out feeling better or worse - I wouldn't miss it if it wasn't there.

Review title: Mind-blowing & intelligent, The Matrix is worth the trip.
Review_body: What is The Matrix? It would be unfair for me to tell you here, but take the time and see for yourself. The Wachowski Brothers have combined slick, state of the art visuals with a thought provoking screenplay and created one of the most ambitious films I've seen in a long time, and I've seen a lot of movies. The Wachowski Brothers manage to seamlessly integrate story influences ranging from Alice in Wonderland to Terminator 2: Judgment Day, and stylistic influences covering the spectrum from Sergio Leone's spaghetti westerns to the best of recent Hong Kong cinema through their own sensibilities to tell the story of Thomas "Neo" Anderson (Keanu Reeves), an ace computer hacker who finds himself a pawn in a larger conspiracy involving world domination. Recruited by band of rebels led by the enigmatic Morpheus (Lawrence Fishburne), Neo becomes the center of a deadly cat and mouse game in which not only his fate, but quite possibly the fates of millions rest on his every move.Revealing more would ruin one of the best joys in watching The Matrix - the way the plot unfolds and the surprising twists and turns it takes. Although The Matrix is being marketed as an action film in the vein of Blade or The Crow, it's much more than that for two reasons:1. The intelligence of the screenplay. 2. Its unwillingness to condescend to its audience.Not only does The Matrix succeed on a visceral butt kicking action film level, but the friends and I who saw an advanced screening of the film were able to pick it apart and discuss the ideas and concepts it presented for *days*.If you're looking for a film to get your brain as well as your adrenaline pumping, The Matrix is it.

Review title: The fantastic action sequences leave you hungering for more.
Review_body: I've never been a big fan of action movies, but the local reviews of this movie convinced me to check it out.The fighting sequences, with the ultra-fast moves, still-frames, and gravity-defying leaps, were among the best I've ever seen in a movie.  The plot is based on the rehashed premise ("What if this is all just a dream?"), but there are enough original twists to make it interesting.  The several action scenes easily outshined the rest of the movie, but the slower parts of the movie were necessary for plot comprehension.  The occasional corny one-liner or holes in the plot are not enough to take away from the awe-inspiring special effects.Until now,I have never left a movie hoping that there will be a sequel made.  Now I will give anything to see more "Matrix" action.

Review title: A pretentiously awful film, made worse by its appearance coincident with the Colorado school violence.
Review_body: Potential high school assassins would find this pretentiously awful film appropriately dour, dream-like, violent, validating of paranoia, techno-babbly, and pseudo-scientifically senseless.  Others with a broader and deeper history of films behind them should be pleased to miss "The Matrix" and never look back.  Its brother team of directors deserve no reward for any technical gimmickry that might momentarily wow an asocial ticket-buyer, because their ignorance (read it "sense of what was hot last week") and disdain for the human component--for people as the best or worst of us really talk and think (or view and listen) damages even actors who know better, such as Lawrence Fishburn.  His appearance, unlucky for him, signals the utter retreat of the film into a doleful pattern of "Captain Video" dialogue--yes, accidental historical accuracy in self-conscious, robotic enunciation of unintentionally scoff-inspiring paradoxical phrases--punctuated, de rigeur, by spasms of billowing orange explosion (for the eye) and nattering automatic weapons fire (for the ear).

Review title: Keanu in his best action-flick ever (yes better th...
Review_body: Keanu in his best action-flick ever (yes better than Speed!) and with Carrie-Anne Moss and Laurence Fishburne in top shape alongside him nothing can go wrong. Is that true? Not if Hugo Weaving comes into the picture. According to me, he steels the whole picture. What a performance!! If you´ve seen the movie I hope you don´t disagree wth me...He created an excellent character, and deserves a huge pat on his back. A big + to The Wachowski brothersfor a supershow, outragous special effects and the best dialogue in an actionmovie in a looong time!!! 9 out of 10!

One word can describe the entire movie ... WOW!  I'm not a fan of SciFi movies, but this movie just grabbed ahold of me and wouldn't let go.  I found myself breathless several times during the movie for several reasons. The special effects and action scenes are amazing, probably the best that I've ever seen.  When the plot behind the story was revealed I got chills pondering over the full truth and intricacy of the story.  Seeing this movie was the best money that I've spent in a long time, don't miss this one!

And boring.  And needlessly confusing.  Leave it Larry Fishburne to make Keanu Reeves look good.  It's always great to see a potentially good actor follow up such stinkers as Hoodlum and the god-awful Event Horizon with a movie that can dig him out of a craphole.  Too bad this wasn't that movie. And what about Keanu, you ask?  Well he's good.  Especially when his mouth disappears.  And credit those Bound brothers, for giving him as few lines as possible.  Unfortunately, they didn't seem to do fit with Fishburne.  And, by the way, when are bad guys gonna be something besides guys in black suits and black shades?  When is a special effects movie going to be made that has a decent story?  When are American filmmakers going to stop copying John Woo?  Does he really deserve to be copied so much in the first place? Finding these answers maybe like finding a reason to watch this movie again: Impossible.

Review title: A feast for the eyes and the imagination.
Review_body: I can not remember having had my expectations more wrong than when I saw The Matrix. Expecting a typical, stupid, special effects movie lacking in plot and character development of any kind, I was amazed at what I saw, and am still amazed. Instead of preparing yourself for another Independence Day, prepare yourself for a film that will make you question reality itself. Combine that with some terrific acting, a truly amazing premise; almost beyond imagination, some terrific fight scenes and incredible special effects, and you have one of the best films I have seen in some time. No one can be told what The Matrix is, so see the film and find out for yourself. You won't be disappointed.

Lots of comments of Matrix compare to many of the best sci-fi films around. Can I now compare it to many of the martial arts films I have seen. Lots of Bruce Lee / Jet Li influences were present in the main "training sequence" with tongue placed firmly in cheek. Taking into account that this is the first full on fight film that I have seen K.R. do, he didn't do too bad for a beginner. The choreography was excellent and helped by surprisingly few special effects. I have not enjoyed a film this much for a long time, but I think Star Wars Eps. 1 will superceed this - just.

Review title: completely entertaining, even if some moments are lame and humorous
Review_body: I really loved this movie, even though some parts are laughable. It's really enjoyable if you just sit back and let yourself enjoy it without trying to analyze it too much, and don't take Keanu Reeves too seriously. Even if some of his lines make you chuckle, just let that make the movie more entertaining for you. And, the effects are actually used in a way that makes sense with the story.  I would definitely recommend it.

Who possibly could make a story this great and this gripping.  I did not yawn I did not look away.  My eyes and my mind were planted.  People, this is not one to miss.  It is filled with non-stop action, a gripping story, and unpredictable scenes I give the MATRIX **** and a 10 out of 10.

Review title: More guns in 5 Minutes than Saving Private Ryan
Review_body: One of the best movies I've seen in a long time, and as a movie projectionist, I've seen almost all of them... It's only the second movie I've seen outside of work at a theater in two years, and I have seen it twice... It rocks... See it

Review title: Great mix of a wonderful plot and awesome special effects!
Review_body: How many times do you go to a movie nowadays and see a movie that not only has the monster special effects that we so crave, AND spend the entire movie enthralled by the twisting rollercoaster ride of a plot that takes turns into uncharted reaches of sci-fi moviedom.  I do not believe I have recently seen a sci-fi (star wars phantom menace included) that  is so good.  I was not expecting it to be this good, and I recommend it to anyone who likes good movies.

I was able to see this from a behind the scenes point of view and it is great!  The visual effects are outstanding and it actually has a story to top it off.  The Wachowski Brothers do an amazing job of building two worlds and exploring both without confusing the audience.  Perhaps I am biased, but I think this will hold us sci-fi fans over till the crowds die down for Star Wars.  Judge for yourself.

Review title: 'Dark City' meets 'Blade', a surreal explosion of film
Review_body: I had the pleasure of seeing 'The Matrix' on its opening night in Boston. I went into the theatre not exactly knowing what to expect out of this film. It has been hyped well.  The trailers left me drooling with their amazing special effects and their intriguing cast.  However, I was a little apprehensive about what exactly 'The Matrix' would turn out to be.  I was afraid that this would be another film where the intense special effects would drown out the directors' ambition to create a good plotline.  I can tell you that I was ecstatic with the final results. This film will leave you wanting more like it.  Its like a masterful combination of 'Blade' meets 'Dark City' meets 'Hackers'.  The actors have all gone through intense martial arts training creating some very impressive fighting scenes.  The story grabs you from the beginning and leaves you pondering your very existence. I highly recommend this film for those with open minds who really love science fiction and who are looking for a surreal experience like no other in film.  I can't wait to see it again.

This film may, depending on the true nature of Stars Wars Episode I, be a benchmark for science fiction.  The brothers Wachowski have created a concept far beyond the imagination of most movie audiences.  I was in awe throughout the film and left feeling as though my dreams were not adequately creative enough to compete with the word of The Matrix.  The film makers were able to conceive visually those aspects of comic books and science fiction literature that have escaped film thus far.  The closest films that have come to this complete visual and conceptual realization might be Blade Runner and Dark City.  For anyone who is interested in thinking about things they never imagined and seeing things they never thought possible, look no further than The Matrix.  (WARNING: Stars Wars fans beware of possible disappointment in Episode I if you do.)

Review title: The first film in years I just *have* to see in the cinema again.
Review_body: If I had to summarize _The Matrix_ in a single word, it would have to be "Cool".  It's slicker than a greased spanner, smoother than ice.  In their black leather and PVC gear Keanu Reeves et al. walk around like they own the copyright on cool.Even if it didn't have a decent plot, it would be worth seeing just for the sheer visual fun of it, but the plot itself is pretty good, too.  The whole "power source" theory is nuts and doesn't make much sense, but apart from that it builds from confusion through a series of setbacks into a near-perfect climax that leaves you gagging for more.The Wachowski brothers lay on the allegory and "intelligence" perhaps a little too thickly (the Alice in Wonderland theme is pushed a tad too hard for my taste), but they have put enough effort into creating a believable and genuinely science-fictional (rather than "sci-fi") world, that the film works on the mind as well as on the viscera.All in all, it's a cracker.  I saw it in a cinema with just old-fashioned stereo sound, and with the bottom half of the picture somewhat blurred, but it still blew me away.  It's the first film in years that I absolutely *have* to go back in and see again.  And then buy the video....

Review title: The Best Sci-Fi movie of all time!
Review_body: You must see this movie!  The beauty of this movie is that the special effects and computer animation are not the best part of the movie (although they are the best we have ever seen).  The story line, the acting and the unyielding pace are what makes this a great movie.

The one aspect of this film that seems to garner almost universal approval is the action.  The reason for this is that the stunt co-ordinator AND martial arts instructor for The Matrix was none other than Hong Kong action director Woo-Ping Yuen, and let me tell you that if you thought The Matrix's action scenes were out of this world, YOU AIN'T SEEN NOTHIN YET.Woo-Ping Yuen's magnificent Tai Chi series contains some of the most beautifully choreographed fight scenes ever to grace a strip of celluloid, and the most impressive of these films is, without a doubt, The Tai Chi Master (1993), starring none other than the now-famous Jet Li.Hong Kong comparisons aside, The Matrix is a visually and conceptually stunning masterpiece (despite an incredibly lame, squirming-in-your-seat, why-did-they-have-to-put-that-in-there, Hollywood-esqe speech from Carrie-Anne Moss during the climactic battle) which will leave you wanting more.  As several previous reviews have stated, Reeves wasn't given enough dialogue to screw up; thus, the film is mercifully (almost) devoid of horrible one-liners.Several critics have accused The Matrix of having no original plot, but my contention is that originality isn't necessarily the key; it's how you work with what you've got that makes all the difference in the world.  I personally enjoyed picking up on the slew of subtle movie references in the film, which include, but are not limited to, Vertigo (I guess this one wasn't so subtle), Superman II, True Lies, and Dark City/Hellraiser, as well as a Looney Tune or two.  There are many more, and seeing them used as tribute rather than rip-off makes viewing the film more fun that it already is.

Review title: Great movie!Awesome special effects,fights and all!
Review_body: The movie is just great for people who don't care much about a clear storyline,and reasonable action,but for the ones who love comic books and all..is a awesome movie.Great special effects,action scenes,and requires some brain use to understand about the Matrix :) For me,specially,I really really loved the Morpheus rescue part..lots and lots of action..for you all..this is a must see movie.

Andy & Larry Wachowski are to be placed right alongside Orson Welles and Stanley Kubrick in the next editions of historybooks as true innovators of cinematography.Although the plot is a bit of ol' this an' that, the performance (on film as well as on computers) is sheer visual poetry.The mood in The Matrix is perhaps borrowed from Terry Gilliam (Brazil, 12 Monkeys) but that is not in any means negative.If the sound by Dane A. Davis and David Lee III (+all the rest) doesn't receive an Academy AwardT I'll have to eat my hat. The audience really was listening on the show I attended, not too common these days - that's a credit as good as any praise here.Contrary to what Morpheus might say, we now can be sure of a bright future for mankind's creativity, the light comes from Oz.

Review title: Never has "Whoa" been delivered so perfectly
Review_body: Keanu Reeves gives a respectable performance in a superb presentation of an intriguing story. The effects are outstanding, as is the cinematography. Laurence Fishburne is dominating, Carrie-Anne Moss is deadly, and Hugo Weaving is ice. The martial arts have incredible choreography. The story is an almost frightening possibility- I hope to see more from the Wachowski brothers.

This was a fun, action packed movie to watch with special effects that were fantastic.I kept flashing back to 2 other similar movies, though, one even starring Keanu: Lawnmower Man, and Johnny Mnemonic. I guess that just goes to show that in the matrix, parallel worlds do exist...

This movie had everything.  Plot, suspense, action, love, conflict, resolve, great special effects, great fight scenes, great directing, you name it. Probably the best movie I have ever seen.  Can't wait to see the sequel.

Review title: gratuitous violence + cheesy story = the matrix
Review_body: after all I had heard about this movie and the number of awards it got, I was expecting a lot more....after dredging up the old 'super-smart computers taking over the world theme' it was down hill after thatthe dude in the trench coat kept making this big deal that you can control everything you want in the matrix, and yet the real people keep running around like chickens with their heads cut off....and exactly how did he not get touched by that chain gun from the helicopter?what kind of self-respecting super computer would let a bunch of pathetic humans screw around with the program anyway?  why hasn't it squashed them long ago?  shouldn't it be aware of everything going on at all times?I guess the self-righteous humans don't mind killing their own to further their own plans as well....who cares about all the police and security guards..they're just in the way I guessand finally, last time I checked, love's first kiss to awaken the dead is only in fairy tales...GIVE ME A BREAK!

Well, I was lucky enough to see this film this morning.  The first viewing of the complete version in New Zealand.  I must say that it totally blew me away.  I was expecting Keanu Reeves to lack the punch the the film deserved its lead actor to possess, but I was happily surprised. The rest of the crew were suited in their roles and I was also happy to see that there were even a couple of Kiwi actors in there.Without trying to give the plot away to much (and yes there is a plot) the world is taken over by computers and only a rag tag bunch of outsiders can save the people enslaved although due to the fantastic advances in VR they dont actually realise that they are prisoners.And of course the only way to save them is with some excellent action sequences and masterful special effects, slowed down for maximum effect. Believe me, if you have seen the trailer then you are in for that and a whole lot more

Review title: Simply the best film in recent years.
Review_body: Very briefly; this film has everything.  You must see it on the big screen to take in the special effects and amazing sound tracking.  Excellent ideas and edge of your pants suspense; wait until you see the scene when Trinity and Neo fire their way into the building to rescue Morpheus; go and see it now.

If you like the Bruce Lee movies, as well as high tech visual effects, then "The Matrix" is definitely a must see! Packed with extraordinary action scenes, this film has proved to be one of Keanu Reeves's best. It can mesmerize you the idea of what the Matrix really is.  Believe me, even if you don't like the story, you will enjoy watching Keanu dodge bullets and fight the bad guy.

I saw this movie on opening weekend - the crowds were out the door. Between the Keanu fans and the fans of the "weird sci-fi" genre... the showing was packed. I at first expected another "Johnny Neumonic" but what I saw was a mature Keanu that has finally found his niche. The movie is well written and the main plot unfolds to explore all the subplots in the story. The audenice was captivated at the writers ability to incorporate humor, emotion and pure mechanoid behaviour without making it too techno. This has got to be the best movie to incorporate new-age special effects...trust me, it makes you go oooh and aahhh!!. The contrast between L. Fishburne and Keanu was well thought out and the "real" fight scenes are impressive. As the viewer in front of me said " He could out fight Jackie Chan with those moves". I would not recommend this movie to those who suffer epileptic fits or those who prefer to be trippy while watching sci-fi...the quick movemnts in these fight scenes make both your eyes and your stomach jump. I would definitely go see it again.

This film ranks up with others such as Dark City for taking an original and sometimes frightening look at what might have been (or is).  It gives a new version of a different reality hidden beneath the one we are in.The amazing special effects drives the vision of the Wachowski Brothers home.  The martial arts scenes were obviously very well done.  You can see the work and detail put into this movie.  All these scenes were by the actors themselves and not by stuntmen, which add to the overall pleasure.As for what the Matrix is, it has to be seen to be understood.

This movie has no right to be this good or this much fun. I went with low expectations and left very impressed and wanting to see it again. Everyone on the cast and crew did a fantastic job on this film, except "Mr. Wooden" of course. (How on earth does Reeves get acting jobs?!!) The only major gripe I have with the film, besides Reeves and the ever present plot holes, is the films tendency to fall back on more action instead of  developing and exploring the interesting philosophical questions it raised. (Dark City comes to mind as an example of a film that spent time with its own philosophical questions instead of defaulting to yet another action scene.) However, with that said, I have to admit the action sequences were extremely well done and a blast to watch. I highly recommend this film.

It isn't original. It's a splice of Terminator 2, Dark City, a Hong Kong martial-arts smorgasbord and about a dozen other science fiction and action movies, plus Gibson and Stephenson novels.But DAMN, I have never seen a movie that combined so many elements as well and come off as something fresh. Finally, someone did a cyberpunk movie and got it right. I'm getting the DVD as soon as it hits the shelves.

Review title: Great for the eyes & ears, what about the brain?
Review_body: As long as you go into the theater without expecting anything along the lines of acting, dialog, and plot, you will enjoy this movie. The look, sound, and feel of the movie is consistently engaging and exhilarating. This is definitely a movie that must be seen in a theater, as it will become absolutely worthless as a video rental. If you want to a movie with some intelligence, while maintaining a similar theme and excellent visual effects, "Dark City" is the one to see.

What an experience this movie was. Thought-provoking, stylish and THE ultimate in action/fighting scenes! The story is also so complex and deep that you'll have to see it again to get it all down pat, but believe me you won't mind!!!P.S. It made 38 million in its opening week and deserved every penny of it!!!!!

Being awed by such superb visual effects and intriguing story while feeling guilty and depressed at the atrocious level of violence in "The Matrix" made my movie going experience fall flat. Unfortunately barely worth the $8.00 per ticket. I give it a 6.

Quite simply the best Sci-Fi film to emerge from Hollywood in recent history.  Artistic, stylish, engaging and action packed. Hats off to the Wachowski Brothers and the crew for bringing it to the big screen and doing it so well.  Bravo.

Review title: great f/x, but confusing story line
Review_body: 'The Matrix' is a top notch action flick.  As one of the few fans of Keanu's acting abilities, his presence was not cause for alarm.  Obviously the special effects were outstanding, but the story line was very confusing.  Using humans as 'energy' sources is a great premise but they didn't expand upon this theme.  "Bound" had a much stronger script and since the brothers did both films, they shouldn't have counted on the action and f/x to carry the day.   Otherwise, it's a solid film.

I've always loved science fiction and I'm always been able to forget the little scientific violations. But I hate when someone pretends to make me forget about logic.The Matrix is just an impossible concept. You can forget the technology involved, you can think (as you do in Star Wars, for example) that the science has evolved enough. But you can't accept when they try to say that A and NOT A are true at the same time. You can't have millions of people (with different ages) living in the same unreal world if it doesn't evolve, if it's always at the end of the 20th century. You can do it by making a special Matrix for every human being (destroying the plot) or making the humans forget every 10 years (destroying the plot).Good special effects. It's the best I can say about this movie. It's not too much.

I loved this movie. It presents the what is reality question with far more skill than any movie I've seen thus far. This movie was the most mentally inspiring movie I have seen since Dark City, and it was much more interesting to me.

Although some of the ideas in the Matrix are borrowed roughly from other movies, it is still very original and has the story line, acting and visual effects to keep almost any viewer hooked. This is one of the best sci-fi movies to come out in recent times. I was most impressed with the performance by Carrie-Ann Moss as Trinity.

Review title: How could anyone NOT like this movie?
Review_body: I have seen this film 3 times in 3 days and I'm in awe each time. The Japanimation style the directors were shooting for came across brilliantly. The best visual effect is the still rotations that I just couldn't get enough of.This film goes from mystery to confusion to despair to amazement and all the time keeps your blood racing with intense VFX and action sequences. It's also about time a late 90s film had a compelling plot.This movie is like Dark City meets Hackers meets Ghost in the Shell. It keeps you on the edge of your seat the whole time. If you like action, sci-fi, or just any well-done movie, this one is a must-see.

Review title: Wow.. This movie is really ace..
Review_body: I do not know if I really should say something about this movie. But there is something which is certain, that is everyone has to see this movie. It must be the one of its kind or the best of its kind. Never seen a film such as this where the effects used as efficient and breath taking as this. You feel the excitement and the amusement at the same time.This is where the beginning, hope we will watch more like these....
A very long two hours.  The special effects were good, but that's about it. The same old plot used over and over again.  Girl kicks butt, guy saves girls butt, guy and girl like each other's butts.

An old and intriguing question of the imagination is brought to life in this modern day tale of a world that isn't.  What if everything that you knew, everyone you loved and you, yourself weren't real.  While I don't want to give away too much of the plot. I have to say the actors did wonderful jobs and I usually dislike Keanu Reeves.  His character, Thomas (Neo) Anderson is played very well along with Laurence Fishburne's character, Morpheus.  The entire cast complements this movie and help keep the action and plot moving along at a fast pace.

(I am French so my english is probably not really good). When you are leaving the cinema, you are looking everywhere and you are thinking if what you see is what you get. I think that "The Matrix" could be a master piece in the "undermind cinema" as Dark City. In the beginning you're lost as Keanu Reeves, and you don't understand what's happening. Then comes the surprise: the heroes are not some kind of supermen, but just some people who know the truth, THE REAL TRUTH. The Matrix brings you into a nightmare, a world ruled by computers, a "ghost world" where men are virus. This movie is crossing the boundaries of imagination and really makes you think about one thing: is the world is true or just a fake. Keanu Reeves is making a quite good characters (but I think that they could have cast somebody else).Just free your mind...and try to jump trough this movie. You will enjoy it.

Review title: A great action suspense thriller, capable of leading cinema into the 21st century.
Review_body: The Matrix is one of the greatest action suspense sci-fi thrillers I have ever seen.  The storyline is imaginative and invigorating.  I spent 150 minutes on the edge of my seat, eagerly awaiting more.  I can't wait to see it again!  It was like wow.  The graphics, and computer imagery were awesome! I can't wait to see what else cinema will have to offer us in 1999.

The Matrix, ahh now what a piece of work.  After a massive stomp at the box-office the film Matrix is sure to be a hit.  This movie makes the Star Wars wait seem like nothing.  It brings you right into the middle of it.  It is so incredible, invincibly awesome that you will see it time and time again.  Keeanu Reeves gives off a spetactular performance (that new huh) in this sci-fi futuristic action thriller.
