This film is sure to be a momentous occasion that may take away some of the Star Wars hype, "What??" you say. Put it this way, we have seen 3 Star Wars already and soon 3 more are coming out.  I couldn't wait for Star Wars until I saw this movie, now I can't wait till I see the Matrix again!

Review title: poor plot, unoriginal quotes, plenty of stereotypes
Review_body:
`I hate those movies based on special effects with a poor plot,' I told my friend when he suggested me to go see `The Matrix' on its opening night. But when I kept hearing excellent reviews of the movie, my curiosity increased, and I decided to give it a try. Well, I was right: not only I did not enjoy the movie, but I also could not wait to rush out of the movie theater.
First of all: the PLOT was truly poor, and it is clear that most of the scenes were designed merely to show special effects, rather than to transmit a precise message (and at least twenty minutes of the movie could have been cut because of this). The first rule of screenwriting is to satisfy the audience's need for orientation, clarifying since the very beginning who are the characters of the movie, and what is their function. I had to wait an hour to understand that. This method (increasing the suspense of this audience by postponing a real explanation of the characters' roles) could have been effective, only if they were introduced in a more clear way. I often felt lost, as many key aspects of the movie were clarified too late (i.e. the phone transportation).
The DIALOGUES were truly lame and unoriginal (except for some funny references to the Wizard of OZ).The CHARACTERS were not developed at all. Still now, thinking about the movie, I cannot really say what was a peculiar trait of each character: their personalities did not stand out at all. They were rather divided into the stereotypical `good' and `bad' categories.
Still mentioning STEREOTYPES, I think the whole movie was a TT (Temple of Testosterone): the ideal place for the satisfaction of a male audience. Why? Because of great fight scenes, vigorous men with a perpetual grimace who want to either save or `own' the world, women with big breasts who don't talk (the woman in red), and strong but yet submissive women driven by sentimentality (Trinity).
What I SUGGEST is to go see it if you like video games and want some entertainment. But if you are one of those persons who want to step out of a movie theater with a new awareness or  even better  a call to action, I suggest you'd save the 8 bucks for a better cause.

I goto school at MSU and they had a free screening of The Matrix on 3/25 and all I can say is Wow! The sfx were out of this world, the fight scenes were the best I've probably ever seen.  The plot kept pace with the non-stop action by making you question the reality of which you live in. The Wachowski brothers have completely redefined what great sfx can do for a movie.  Keanu puts in a great performance, mainly because they limited the amount of dialogue he had, as Neo the reluctant leader of a resistance to free humanity.  The movie immediately grabs you and holds you for the remainder, with the exception of your mouth dropping open during the mind blowing action scenes. Once word gets out about this movie, it's going to make mucho dinero.

Review title: "What is the matrix?" It's two hours of good film spoiled by an awful ending.
Review_body: Apart from the last 15 minutes, Matrix is one of the best picture of the year; it mixes great action sequences and cool dialogues with original and not obvious considerations about our world and the dangers in it. Although there are some unanswered questions it moves quite well in the world of virtual reality where many films such as "The lawn mower" got lost before. What I can' t understand is the ending in a horrible "soap opera-scene" and, in the last sequence. And in contrast with the meaning of the rest of the movie, the audience is satisfied like common people of the movie. "Don't worry" we are told "you don't have to fight to get your freedom! A hero is doing it for you".

Review title: One of the best Sci-Fi Films I have Ever Seen
Review_body: The Matrix has a well developed plot and a great cast of characters.  I was very hesitant going to this movie due to the fact that Keanu Reeves was the lead.  But, I had no need to worry, he finally proved to me that he is worth seeing in a film.  The fight scenes were amazing along with all the special effects.  This movie surpassed my expectations beyond anything I could have imagined.  The plot was exciting, yet it made you think and ponder about our own existence.  I recommend this movie to anyone over the age of 18 who can definitely appreciate everything that is going on.  Go See It!!

I was lucky enough to attend a press screening for The Matrix on March 20th at Warner Bros.  This movie is awesome!!  Cyper-Sci-Fi at the cutting edge. It has action (incredible stuff), humor, suspense, great camera work and editting, and substance.  It's an excellent, and thought-provoking script, and the cast is super.  The buzz is that they all had to train for 4 months for the martial arts/wire work, before the filming even began, and it really shows.  Much of what appears to be special FX is not - they really did what you just saw (or thought you saw).  This one is a must see - preferably more than once since there's so much packed into the film that it's hard to absorb it all the first time.  But that's sort of what The Matrix is all about.  Suspend judgment until you've actually been there - as Morpheus says, "unfortunately no one can tell you what The Matrix is - you have to experience it for yourself."

Review title: purely amazing graphics and action, however the dialogue could've been written better by a two year old
Review_body: I was in aww! the movie had a breakthrough with graphics and the plot harbored within it another plot which was commendable.  The dialogue was crap though, if I had a say it was the king of One Liners.  Once again Keanu will score big with what he's best with, action (little speech hard core violence).  Though I say romantic films are corny this movie reached a level beyond corny with its attempt for romance, that scene was plain stoopid!If you're in the mood for anything but intelligent, deep, witty, or life inspiring, go check this movie.  It's still worth it, it's a fun flick.

Review title: High on action, special effects, and Keanu doesn't ruin it.
Review_body: Damn.  That's what I call action.  Not since T2 have I seen such great special effects coupled with action, only this was better in some aspects. I don't know, I just kept laughing a giddy little laugh throughout because of awesomeness of scenes (i.e. the lobby).  Sure, the dialog could have been better, but that's true with almost every film.  But the effects and action make up for it without a doubt.  You say you don't like Keanu Reeves?  Yeah, I know, he's not an actor, or at least not a good one.  In this though, he fits, and makes a pretty cool bad-ass.  So, if you like action in the slightest, I highly suggest this movie.

Review title: The best science fiction movie ever - two thumbs up!!
Review_body: One of the best movies I ever seen. The best science fiction film ever. Strongly recommend to see it to everyone.

Review title: Woo-ing the action and special effects film going audience.
Review_body: The Wachowski brothers bring their stark (and black leather) visions back to silver screen! And how!  Definitely influenced by the Hong Kong Kung-Fu wire pix and the two handed pistol shooting protagonist a lá Woo, the action sequences are some of the best seen in a movie of this type (unless you count the trailers for "Phantom Menace" - and they still hold their own). The plot can be confusing at times and somewhat hard to swallow, but... what if?  That seems to be the point that the Wachowski's are getting across. Keanu and Laurence are definitely a great pairing.  This isn't so much a buddy relationship as it is a mentorship.  Reminds one of a similar film (and film series) that may have been mentioned beforehand.  The other supporting characters also lend their presence and aren't just backdrops. Hugo's droll performance for the majority of the film fits perfectly in the wetworks world, until he throws the equivalent machine version of a hissy fit.  It's an intense and involving movie that lends itself to fantasy and amusement.  I'm hooked!  Now only if the Wachowski brothers are involved in the development of the inevitable software game, then I'd really be wired in.

Very good film.  This films makes you think about your life the way it is now.  Is it real or is it fantasy?  The special effects are great.  Good comic relief scenes.  Also this movie has a very good plot line!!!  See it.

Review title: A must see for sci-fi fans.
Review_body: Pitting humankind against computer AI.  You would think that it had already been done with Terminator, Johnny Mnemonic, etc., but this puts a fresh face on the concept.  The Matrix is an incredibly well directed, well written movie!  The special effects are undoubtedly the best in a while.  But not only that, the story-line actually supports the action and the effects.  It isn't just an effects movie, the story is well thought out and even thought provoking.  The acting is well directed and each actor's strengths are played upon.  As the premise of the movie states, I can't explain the Matrix, you really need to see it to grasp it.  All I can say is WOW!

Review title: One of the most visually amazing movies done to date
Review_body: I went into this movie upon the high recommendation of my friends.  I thought I was going to be disappointed but I was far from it.  This movie is a breakthrough in technology.  The visuals are simply staggering.  It is about time we were given a good sci-fi/action movie.I give this movie a high recommendation to all of those out there who want to be blown away.  Ironically, one of the trailers was for Star Wars...this film may give it a run for its money.  It's THAT good.

Review title: Christ story redefines the effects bar
Review_body: The Matrix:  8 out of 10"The Matrix" raises the special effects bar yet another notch, with stunning high-speed camerawork, Gap-commercial rotation-freeze frame, blur motion effects, and loads of computer-generated effects that amazed me.  I have not seen such a redefinition of the "possible" using computer effects since I first saw "Terminator 2" and "Jurassic Park".  Because of that alone, this movie will make a lot of money.The movie most closely follows in the dark, cyberpunk tradition of "Blade Runner", but the plot is essentially the Christ story retold with guns, leather, and sci-fi monsters.Keanu Reeves plays Neo (the Christ figure), who is brought into the true "Real World" by Lawrence Fishburne, who plays Morpheus, the leader of a band of rebels from the human city of Zion, fighting the forces of the Matrix, a computer program that has run rampant and taken over the real world.  > I predict this movie will be one of top at the box office in 1999 -- even considering "Star Wars, Episode I" will soon follow and suck up the repeat viewer market.The film combines karate, anime, armed-to-the-teeth, dressed-in-black cyberpunk with a thought-provoking storyline about what is "reality" and what is "computer generated dreamworld".  It reminded me also of "The Lawnmower Man", with the Agents as guardians of the the heart of the computers, and Keanu as the hacker who breaks their security.The story does have holes here and there, especially in explanations about the machines harvesting humanity, and why a kiss of love can overcome death, but the action is so rapid-fire and stunningly rendered, it does not ruin the film.The actors all do well, considering the real top billing goes to the special effects.  I thought Fishburne, Moss, and Agent Smith were most compelling, with Keanu playing well but with no surprises.The movie IS "eye candy", but that is not a bad thing.  It will be wonderful to compare the "The Matrix" to "Star Wars, Episode I".Overall:  Above-average.  Redefines the effects bar. Recommended.

I saw this movie yesterday on an advance screening. This movie really kicks ass, with some of the most awesome special effects to date. The mood of the picture is a lot like Blade - so if you loved that one, then there is no doubt that you are going to love this one! It's a techno sci-fi action/John Woo special effect sight and sound from start to finish There is only one downside that you already know about - I think?.Keanu will never be a great actor, but he is kind of cool when he is wearing those shades.

Review title: A great movie a true fight for the human mind
Review_body: This is one of the great movies I have seen. The special effects are state of the art and some the best I have seen. The story line is a real teaser and fun to see in action. It leaves a opening for another movie but this won't be an easy shoe to fill. The actors fill their parts and it looks as if they put a great deal of effort in to this movie. A must see for any science fiction or action fan.

Ok, first off, I am not a critic or reviewer by profession.  I'm just a regular science fiction fan just like any other.  I like my action fast and furious, my story-line engaging my characters detailed and believable and just as importantly my technology amazing (after all, isn't that what science fiction is about?).Unfortunately for the science fiction genre, movies that have all of these things are few and far between.  There have been decent entries such as (and some may disagree with me here) Starship Troopers and the Fifth Element as well as some movies that i found fun to watch but far from being able to be considered good sci-fi flicks (Wing commander and Johnny Mnemonic).So I was expecting to be fairly disappointed with The Matrix.Boy was I in for a shocker.  The best way to explain the first 5 minutes is by comparing it to the beginning of a roller coaster.  About 40 seconds setting up the scene and then a furious drop into white-knuckle grip action. The way that they show how much more powerful Trinity is than the police and then how much more powerful The Agents are to Trinity is awesome.While the plot may not be 100% original it is very well done and I found it very enjoyable.  The locations give a feeling of confinement even in open spaces which adds atmosphere that fits the story line perfectly.  I don't want to comment too much more here for fear of adding spoilers.The characters in the film are detailed and have quite a bit of depth. Even the minor supporting roles had enough detail to make them believable.  I especially loved Agent Smith.  I could almost watch an entire movie about him because his character and mannerisms were so engrossing.  The characters really draw you into this film.Now for the action and technology.  All I can say is damn.  The action sequences blew me away.  With each sequence better than the previous.  The directors use of 12,000(yes thats twelve thousand) FPS during key sequences provided some never-before-seen effects that made my jaw drop. Trust me, you have to see it to believe it.  And my personal fave as far as the technology is concerned is what I can only describe as an ELF (electron flux gun) that fires off blue-white bolts of lightning.  Incredible.Well that about wraps up my schpiel.  As you can tell I love this movie. Do your self a favor and go see it as soon as you can.

Let's see what can I say.  This is totally unbelievable , from the  moment I saw the first clip , I wanted to see it. Also I saw Letterman last night and saw a different clip on it which made me want to see it more. A fast paced movie with great effects, action and plot.  I was not disappointed. From the moment it started I was hooked. For action, guns and martial arts, always works for me.  Special effects were quite impressive and very elaborate. The film was equally put together, one aspect did not overwhelm any other. I do have have one slight dislike, and I guess that goes for all action lovers. They tried to add a little feelings to the movie. I'm just glad they kept it like they did.  Just enough to give a  different flavor not drown it out.  For me I will definitely see this one again.

This movie blew me away.  I loved how it started off slow.  It introduced you into the world, and gave a chance for the audience to understand and be in that world.  When the amazing action sequences came, they didn't seem as if they were the reason for the movie (which is what I feared).  Everyone always disses on Keanu, but he was alright in this movie.  Give the guy a break, he has that charasmatic hero appeal that made him popular in "Speed."  The Wachowski brothers have hit gold twice now (I loved "Bound" as well).  I urge everyone to go see it.

What is the Matrix?The Matrix is why everything tastes like chicken, why you get deja vu, and why you should ALWAYS disable those cutesy software agents in Microsoft Office.The Matrix is what happens when William Gibson, H.R. Gieger, Jean-Pierre Jeunet, and John Woo decide to make a movie, and it works. You've got to see this film on the big screen!

This is a must see movie.  I would not wait until it came out on video.  The effects are just to good.  If you see only two movies this year make The Matrix one of them.  Unique plot for a movie.  Great special effects.  The gun scenes are excellent. (Shades of John Woo).  There is humor, however, it is placed appropriately. Gives a breath of fresh air to the movie. Doubt anyone who goes to see this movie will come away disappointed. :)

This is easily the most stylish cyberpunk film I've ever seen. It kicks the snot out of Johnny Mnemonic and Strange Days. Yes, it's full of cyberpunk cliches, like black leather trenchcoats, martial arts, gunplay, etc, but that's exactly what I was looking for. The visual effects are stunning. The fight sequences are incredible. See this movie on the big screen now.

Well, what can I say. I read all the reviews that people wrote here, and I agree with them. I went to go see it yesterday and was just so surprised. This is an instant classic, and I intend to make the matrix section on my homepage, study the movie when it comes out as a video, ah dang, it's just such a great movie. John Woo isn't making good action movies anymore like HARD BOILED, the Matrix certainly filled my emptiness for some hardcore action movie, you know? I recently learned about this two directors. I enjoyed Bound very much and I enjoyed Assassins very much too. I certainly became a fan of this two directors,, and I thank them for making such a great movie when all the movies coming out these days suck so bad such as that trash movies Armaggedon. I hope I can make great movies like them in the future. The Matrix is the bomb, and if you watch it , you will know it totally. It kicks major a**, god damn it!

Review title: Great sci-fi, great moviemaking, great action, NOT a chick-flick
Review_body: Keanu was right to skip Speed 2.  This movie is immeasurably better.  The story is coherent, though complicated.  The effects are the best I have ever seen, and the acting is as cool as the entire movie.  I actually took KR seriously as a kung fu master.  Larry Fishburne was great, and the entire cast had a comic book reality quality that was completely appropriate to the film premise.This is the first movie since LA Confidential I plan to see again before it leaves the theater.  I may even buy the CD.

Let me break the bad news first.  Keanu Reeves has no martial arts skills. He's stiff as a board and he obviously didn't practice enough before the filming.  His attempts at trying to mimic the late and great Bruce Lee were very sad indeed.  They should have cast Jet Li instead.The fight scenes were an obvious attempt by the Wachowski brothers to grope Hong Kong martial arts films.  And they were sorely lacking in comparison to the truly skilled martial artists of Hong Kong cinema.Not only did the Wachowskis try to bite Hong Kong martial arts movies, they tried to imitate unsuccessfully John Woo's gunfights, two-handed pistol action and slow motion sequences.  Poor Mr. Reeves pales in comparison to the likes of Chow Yun Fat.Now, for the good news:  overall -- despite all the wannabe Hong Kong cinema elements prevalent in "The Matrix," the movie was visually stunning and fun to watch.  The special effects were top shelf, top of the line eye candy. If you can look past Mr. Reeves inadequacies when compared to the likes of Jet Li and Chow Yun Fat, the action was still top-notch.  The action and visuals are well worth the price of admission.Laurence Fishburne is great, as usual.  He plays the role of Morpheus with the kind of level-headed cool we've all come to expect.  The man commands respect whenever on the silver screen, and his performance in "The Matrix" is no exception.On one level, "The Matrix" does what "Dark City" tried to do, but only better.  The premise is somewhat similar, but I don't want to say too much, or else I'll spoil the film for all of you who haven't seen it yet.Watching "The Matrix," I was hoping for a "Twilight Zone" type of ending that was lacking in "Dark City."  That old television series was great in that the episodes would start off mind boggling, and end even more so because the endings weren't necessarily happy and quaint.  But I was disappointed at the rosey ending of "The Matrix."Nonetheless, "The Matrix" is a solid piece of entertainment, and is more than worthy of the price of admission.  It gets the thumbs up from this moviegoer.

Review title: What was good and bad about the Matrix
Review_body: The Matrix scored big points with its over the top special effects and action sequences.  Suprisingly, the script is very strong.  We get a good sense of who these people are, at least the main characters, and why they are doing what they are doing.  The dialogue is simple but not stupid, and realistic. Buzz words don't overwhelm this script.  However, the concept is nothing new.  Similar stories have been seen in "Dark City", "The Terminator"(series), "Total Recall", and even some elements of "Star Wars" show up in this film (as if there is a Sci-Fi film since that hasn't).  It is though, one of the best cyber-punk films to date.  The script is complicated, but well explained.  You won't be scratching your head in this one.  This role is tailor made for Keanu Reeves.  He fits perfectly in to the role of Neo. The film does run a little long, and dragged in some scenes.  The use of digital effects was superb and NOT too overdone.  Look for really cool digital reflections in Fishburne's sunglasses. The cinematography is top notch, especially the use of filters.  Editing is also very tight.  Possibly the best thing about this film is the fact that although there is tons of violence, there is not a lot of blood and language.  If you are wondering if it's ok for the kids to see this one, it would probably be okay if you parents went along.

Review title: Great story, great effects, great movie
Review_body: A great movie, with a great story.  There's never a dull moment and the computer effects are outstanding.  I will see it 2-3 more times in the theatre.

I thought the movie was just excellent. From the story line to the action sequences everything was just perfect. The sfx were very well done. I would say one of my favorite scenes in the movie was the "lobby". If you have no idea what I mean GO SEE THE MOVIE! Not much being said about the movie in the media now, but I hope this will change, because this is one movie that deserves all the publicity it can get. I think '99 is going to be the year of two great movies, The Matrix and... well you can guess what the other one is, right? All I can say in conclusion: GO SEE IT (I definitely am going to go again)

Review title: This is a MUST see movie.
Review_body: The Matrix is one of those films that sneaks up on you, and so totally pulls you into the story that you feel it, viscerally.The effects were seamless, the acting without peer.  The plot was well thought out.. I'm sitting here writing this 15 hours after seeing the movie, and my skin is still tingling.The pacing of the film is hot, and fast, and skin tight... The plot twists are nicely laid out... This is a movie that will provide a 'roller-coaster' type ride... lots of excellent visuals...

This is one of the best movies I have ever seen and I used to work at a movie theatre so I've seen a lot. The storyline is fantastic and I hardly noticed the movie was long.  You know a movie is good when you don't want it to end or hope it will last longer.

Review title: Dark, edgy, intense, and very good.
Review_body: This movie fits well into the cyberpunk genre--dark, edgy, intense, and very computer oriented.  If you don't much like cyberpunk, I can't imagine you'd much like this movie.  The plot's pretty iffy, but the action is great, the special effects are seamless, and all the lead characters excellent for their roles.

This is one of the best movies I have seen in a long time. From the beginning to the end, this movie oozes out w/ coolness: the soundtrack, the wardrobe, special effects, dark shades, etc.One of the movies I immediately thought of as I watched this was Ridley Scott's "Blade Runner". Both offer a dark view of the future that is realistic and interesting to watch. It also has a lot of guns ala John Woo.In "The Matrix", there are a few scenes that seem like a video game--some that are pretty amusing. But the special effects throughout are just fabulous. I'm looking forward to seeing it again!

Review title: Possibly The Greatest Sci-Fi Movie I've Seen.
Review_body: This movie delivered great acting, an enthralling storyline, action packed scenes,outstanding computer imaging, and the feeling of question that a good sci-fi movie should give you when you leave the theater.  I've seen this movie four times in the past 2 days... I hope to see it again soon. Reeves did a outstanding acting job in comparison to his other movies; he managed to keep the story surrounding him without sinking the plot.  Great performances were given from all of the actors in this movie.  See this film as soon as possible... and you will never again ask "What is the Matrix?"...

When I first heard about this movie I thought to myself, oh great another Johnny Mem movie. I read the plot along with seeing one image about 5 months ago and said, "Nah I'll pass." Last month I saw a preview in the theaters and said to myself, "Oh my god this may actually be good." Then I have to say that each time I saw the preview I started anticipating it more and more. It looks and feels exactly like a comic book story. The shots of the characters in a lot of the scenes feel just like something you would see in a comic book. The action once again follows the comic book theme as does the entire movie. I was well pleased with seeing this movie and will see it again to catch some of the subtle things that went on.If you are thinking about not going due to Reeves acting, just ignore your thoughts cause this movie will have you laughing and cheering and also saying "WOW!" all the way through it. GO SEE IT!!!

Review title: A Strong Contender for the Best Action Film of 1999
Review_body: 'The Matrix' is the best film that I have seen in quite some time. It manages to succeed where other films, such as 'Dark City,' failed. The action sequences are reminiscent of 'Blade,' which for many was the best US martial arts film of 1998.Like 'Blade,' I did not have high hopes for this film when I walked into the theater, but I was extremely happy and excited when I left. The fight sequences were performed by the actors who played the roles (Reeves, Fishburne) and were striking. Rarely have I heard an audience so impressed as after the classic lobby sequence.The film has a number of quirks that seem like flaws the first time around. The first is the stilted delivery of some of the characters early in the film. The second is the occasional feeling that something does not quite match up with earlier statements made in the film, and the third is that it seems to fall into the classic trap of giving a "love conquers all" ending to an otherwise tremendous film.However, when you see the film again, you will realize the genius of the writer/directors of this film. The seemingly stilted delivery in the early scenes of the film is actually just a pacing of the speeches, a novel way of breaking up the conversation, which otherwise would turn into an extremely boring lecture. There is a lot of data that needs to be shared, and it could drag the film down very quickly if it were not dealt with in this manner.When you see the film again, the second quirk is also soothed. There is no statement that directly conflicts with the later scenes in the film. The oracle speaks very accurately, and only makes the statements that need to be made. Other characters merely misconstrue her words.The third quirk can be viewed as a fulfillment of an earlier prophecy, and as such can be used to back up a messianic interpretation of the events of the film.Perhaps in a novel, the story would have ended differently, and the third issue would disappear (c.f. 'Blade Runner' v. 'Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep,' two totally different takes on a similar group of characters).The film is filled with little tidbits of information dropped into the story several minutes before a scene. This is neatly done, and sets up the audience to be ready for the high points of the film.The music in the film is also quite good, though for some reason the best material was not included on the soundtrack. It is to be hoped that they will release an album of music from the film at a later time.Overall, a great film, with interesting special effects, a believable future with rules that are meant to be broken, and great music. The direction of the film is top notch, with performances being tightly controlled to add a literary element to the film's conversations and little tidbits to keep the audience entertained. I anxiously await the next film by this writing and directing duo.

At first, I thought this would be Johnny Mnemonic II because of Mr. Speed's role.  After watching this movie on the official wide-release opening night (3/31/99),  I was proved wrong.  I believe some people are meant to enjoy certain types of movies, and some are not.  I was meant to enjoy this one. The cyberpunk, William Gibson-esque motif, the constant action sequences, and that lobby scene... Those who have seen the movie know exactly what I'm talking about.  I grew up reading Neuromancer, (I actually did a book report on it in 8th grade!)and I was hooked on the computer game of the same name. This movie has more style than any cyberpunk type movie in existence.  The only problem I had was that the movie ended too quickly, I wish that this movie was 3 hours long.  Any latin majors out there can correct my spelling but I think "Deus Ex Machina" applies to this movie. Regardless, I'm waiting for the DVD. . .  and the sequel!!! (hint, hint)

I've noticed that a lot of the critics out there have put-down the Matrix as incomprehensible or illogical but that's because they're idiots.  They simply don't understand the movie and went into critic attack mode by using artsy fartsy terms to try and hide their lack of technical sophistication. The Matrix's plot is entirely consistent internally and only requires some attention to follow.  I won't reveal the plot since part of the fun of the movie is figuring out what will develop.The action is startlingly fresh and energetic.  Of course the action isn't entirely original (it's not like there are that many kill people) but the way the effects, perspectives and different styles are put to use in this movie hasn't been done before.  Hong Kong wire fighting and John Woo style shoot-outs done in bullet-time with morphing thrown in are possible in the Matrix because the rules of that simulated world allow it (see critics what's so hard to understand about that?).  I won't say that the plot is wholly original but it helps explain the action and bring on the next fight sequence.  Besides, any script that finally provides a credible and funny explanation as to why so many things taste like chicken isn't all bad.The movie kicks ass (literally and figuratively); you'll enjoy it fully if if you aren't looking for something like the Piano or other art BS.  Don't let morons that don't get the movie tell you otherwise.

If you like the cyberpunk genre than this is the movie for you. It has been a long time sence there has been a good cyberpunk movie.  The last one being Bladerunner.  The effects combined with some good acting (Lawerence Fishburne mainly) made this movie one to see over and over.  I saw it wed. night and then went back on thurs. to catch all the things that I missed the night before. Big time sequel potential.  What is Zion?  Where is it?  Who lives there?  And what of all the people still plugged in? These are just some of the questions that I am sure everyone has.  So if you big Hollywood hotshots are reading this make the sequel.  If you don't I will.  I didn't think I was going to enjoy any movies until the new StarWars was released but I was wrong.  I am in no way comparing this film to the StarWars movies but it is now one of my favorites of all time.  Thank you for the chance to speak my mind.  Keep making movies we will Keep watching them.

This is one of the very first movies that actually made me think in the theater.  "The Matrix" had some very intriguing lines that made you ponder the most obvious things around us.  Such as when Morpheus (Fishburne) says to Neo (Reeves), "You believe it is the year 1999, when actually it is closer to 2199..." and he goes on to explain the down fall of our world as we know it to "AI" artificial intelligence and machines.  Also, when Morpheus confuses Neo by questioning his definition of "real":  "What is real?  How do you define real?  If to you real is what you can see or touch or smell, then it is simply electrical signals being sent to your brain."We are born into a world which we do not question or take a 2nd glance at. It is a world based on "rules".  It is given to us, therefore we accept it for what it is and nothing more. This is in fact the underlying theme of "The Matrix" and how we go on living our lives oblivious.  Making the Fishburne's quote  "Do you really think that's air your breathing right now?" very believable.With all this thinking going on, you are bound to miss some of the best martial arts fighting sequences I have seen to date.  Using slow motion to the fullest, the action sequences are given a type of grace, such as when Fishburne is floating in the air in the dojo sequence.  This uncut, kung fu style fighting is sure to leave the audience with a smile of pure enjoyment on their faces. In all, this is the best movie I have seen and must be seen more than once to appreciate the plot, the morals, the action, the camera angles, and excellent acting by all 4 main cast members.  I strongly recommend this movie to anyone who is willing to "free their mind".

Easily one of the best sci-fi movies ever. It is well-written and flows at a good pace and the amazingly few holes are easily overlooked. The set design, while not completely original, is still gorgeous and the cinematography is breathtaking (I have a new appreciation for the beauty of fire). I would go on but I don't want to give anything away, let's just leave it as a "must see."

Review title: Now that I finally know what the Matrix is...
Review_body: All I really can say about this movies is that it was awesome!! Not so much based on the acting but on the ideas behind the movie. It really is as original as they come. Also, action scenes don't get much better than this!! I thought that Mortal Kombat had good fights til I saw this! Special effects were great, but not distracting. Probably the best movie I've seen so far this year!

I loved this movie, I thought it was visually stunning. I sat with my mouth open most of the time, but then, I am a sucker for eye candy. The only real problem I had with this movie was the last 15 minutes or so, I honestly think that they didn't know how to end it.

I can't believe that anyone would seriously suggest that this film was even average!  It was worst film I have seen in a very long time.The movie had so little to offer, it is hard to only point to specific flaws:1) Keanu has to be one of the worst actors of our era.  He shows no signs of even moderate intelligence or talent, and as a hero, he comes across as flat and unispiring.  It is hard to believe that his character would have anything to offer that would distingish him from your average idiot.  And in action scenes, it was impossible to tell if he is *supposed* to look silly or if he can't help it.  No charisma, no flair, just pathetic.2) Very shallow and poor development of an unoriginal idea.  The idea that our reality is not real at all is hardly original.  It has been the subject of science fiction for decades, and a successful treatment of the subject should delve into some psychological depths.  We should be left wondering whether our world truly is real.  Or we should get a sense of how willing or unwilling we might be to face the fact that our world is an illusion.  We should wonder whether it matters if our world is an illusion, or whether reality is what we perceive as real.  Whatever the protrayal, we should leave the theater feeling intellectually moved.  While the film briefly brushed on some of these topics, it was so brief and shallow that no impression was left.  Instead, focus returned to martial arts which had no real purpose in terms of the plot.3) The story dragged as we were forced to sit through an explanation of the matrix that was completely obvious--a couple of visual effects would have gotten the point across in less than a minute with more effect.  While the characters beat the idea of the matrix to death in the dialogue, it did little to shed light into the hearts and minds of the characters.  What was their motivation, from where did they get their drive and courage?  Why were they able to sense the matrix?  None of the answers are even touched upon, and the characters are flat and unrealistic as a result.4) The idea of the matrix is very poorly thought out.  Instead of creating a believable world and believable rules for the matrix, the plot resorts to physical fighting, which makes no sense at all.  The film obviously had no intention of stretching the mind of the viewer, instead catering to an audience of mindless action-addicts. While action might have added to a well-thought out film, it cannot support a film where the premise is psychological or intellectual.5) No sense of despair, darkness, or power from the futuristic scenes. The future world is portrayed so little that we really don't even have a chance to be overwhelmed by how horrible it could be.  In an attempt to make a happy action film, the dark undertones were completely dropped.The very few redeeming values were: 1) Interesting use of slow-motion action 2) A few nice special effects (no more than an average action film these days) 3) A promising premise.  While not original, the idea has great potential. Several other films, such as Dark City have shown a bit of this potential, and there is a plethora of such plots in books.In short, any thoughtful, insightful, meaningful, or inspired treatment of a potentially interesting idea was completely dropped to show a few almost laughably out of place action scenes.  The fact that people rave about this movie shows that people are willing to swallow the mindless just for some cool effects.  How sad.

Only since the beginning of March 1999 had I become interested in this film. I downloaded the trailer from the film's web site, and I became obsessed. This film was going to rock!And that it did. Take the reality-is-not-what-it-seems element of Dark City, add the post-apocalyptic future of Terminator, and mix in the best action sequences I have EVER seen in an American movie (it tops even Face/Off), and you have The Matrix. And with special FX that have to be seen to be believed, I have found my favorite movie of 1999 (perhaps even more so than The Phantom Menace). It's about one more viewing away from becoming my favorite movie EVER.See this movie. Find a THX-enhanced theatre and RUN to see this movie. It's the best money I've spent at the theatre in a LONG time.

Review title: The best sci-fi movie I've seen since Stargate!
Review_body: This movie was the embodiment of sci-fi as it should be - it draws you in, scares you to death, gives you a LOT of eye candy, and leaves you dying to see it again.Some of the actors enlisted didn't make it look too promising, but the performances were easily the best seen from Keanu Reeves and Laurence Fishburne while Carrie-Anne Moss was the perfect choice for Trinity.The look of the scenes that were not based in the Matrix was similar to that of Alien Resurrection in some ways, and one cut of Keanu Reeves turning toward the camera with his black trenchcoat flapping in the breeze, raising 2 pistols up toward you looked like it could have come right out of a Nicolas Cage Face/Off scene.  The majority of the film, however, is very original.Finally an effects movie with a fantastic plot.

Review title: Edge of your seat, heart pumping action!!!!!!!!
Review_body: This movie was all that I expected and so much more, these days it's hard to find a movie with tons of action and special effects and still have a story line, this movie had both, I was kept on the edge of my seat the entire film and was always guessing what is going to happen next, see this movie, you won't be disappointed, then see it again, and again!!!Don't listen to the people who didn't like it because the story was too complex, it wasn't too hard to follow even my little brother understood what was going on, see this movie.

Review title: " Movies are freedom for the Soul "
Review_body: My palate for summer Sci-Fi movies is now Full. I hope that Star Wars Episode I can turn up the heat even hotter. After watching The Matrix all I can say is WOW !!!!! There have been many Sci-Fi movies in the past that have dealt with the same subject matter but none have so eloquently displayed the cinematography like the Matrix did.Hats Off !! To everyone that help bring this 136 min joy ride to the big screen.CrazyLion " Movies are freedom for the Soul " CrazyLion 1999

Everybody else has already said most everything positive I have to say about this movie.  Great action, kudos for actors doing their own kung-fu..et all. But. There is a huge downside to this movie that has seemingly escaped everyone else commenting here. These down sides don't keep The Matrix from being a decent guy movie, or a decent techno-geek movie, but they do keep it from being anything resembling a good cinematic movie:Foremost is the cliche'd and campy-as-hell dialog.  Lawrence Fishbourne is a fine actor, and I cringed for his sake every time he was forced to say inane things like "He is The One" with conviction every ten minutes.  Much of the rest of his dialogue is just as vague and pseudo-foreboding (The One, The Oracle, The Matrix, The Agents...the horror!  Come on, even mediocre sci-fi should be able to get beyond this).  I was doing my best to believe in a world to support the stunning action, but with each character spewing Total Recall-ish lines and bad Dark City outtake ideas, it was damned near impossible.  Half the lines are embarrassedly half-hearted attempts at lame self-realization, with metaphors like "the path" and "the door" overused to create an overriding question of destiny, a question which doesn't hold together well enough to ever be answered.  By the time The Matrix tries to answer it, we no longer care what it has to say.Then there's the vague excuse for a plot, the shining moments of which are buried under some truly awful scenes.  The truth behind The Matrix is vague and unexplained, and I got the impression that this was not because of some sly sleight-of-hand by the Wachowski brothers, but rather because they weren't ever able to create an insightful explanation that held together. In my book, any plot where the main character's resurrection is explained by "Well, he can't die, because I love him!" isn't any plot at all.Lastly, the plot has holes, chief among them the fact that a near-dead Morpheus does NOT have holes at all after sitting unmoving in the middle of a room that has just been chain-gunned halfway to hell.  I suppose Neo not only controls his aim with his world-bending powers, but also uses his power to make a notoriously inaccurate chaingun perfectly precise?  Also..when you're standing on top of a building, on the edge of the roof, and a terrific explosion happens right below you, the force is going to blow you the hell back, whether or not you're the hero in the movie.Despite all these attempts to make The Matrix just another crappy American action movie, it does stand out in a few ways.  Everything visual is amazing, from the fights to the futuristic scenes (the baby-harvesting scene is enough to make anybody's blood run cold) to the futuristic city set (watch for the black doorman in the tux by the elevator..a great touch.) The scene with The Oracle is also a cut above, with the waiting room and The Oracle herself far more original than the rest of The Matrix.  The spoon-bending kid is especially interesting, even if she is practising Buddhism without a license.On the whole..this movie is at most a 5 or a 6 out of 10, chiefly because of the action scenes.  The dialog is crap, the plot is half-assed, but this movie does a good job of being all about "guns. Lots of guns."  It's in the same vein as Total Recall, but better, but don't go expecting to see the next Blade Runner, or even the next Dark City.

Wow. I was on the edge of my seat for most of this film.  I still don't know what the Matrix is-  I definitely have to see this movie again.  Beautifully choreographed action sequences. The physicality of this cinema was amazing. The CGI work is some of the best I've seen recently. This movie was a great blend of man's struggle in the world of the "unreal", and ultimately within himself. Couple this with kung-fu,  extraordinary camera work, and actors who seemed to put everything into their roles, it's a must see!

Before I saw "The Matrix" I thought it was going to be like "Event Horizon", which is a good movie, if you've never seen a movie before.  Well, I was wrong.  "The Matrix" isn't an original idea, or even an original movie. Its originality lies in the fact that all these other films were so seamlessly tied together in the storyline of "The Matrix", which makes sense since that's what The Matrix is, or what you are lead to believe it is.The cast is weak.  Hopefully, someday, our wishes will be granted and Keanu will stop being the wooden puppet and turn into a real boy.  Laurence Fishburne can't even save this with his Obi-Wan Kanobi self.On the plus side, the special effects are really well done.  It is nice to finally see a movie where the special effects are part of the storyline and not just for show.  My recommendation: See this as a matinee, don't pay full price.  You'll feel much better about yourself only paying $4 for The Matrix, instead of $7.

I really enjoyed The Matrix.  This movie was gripping with slick special effects and cinematography.  The slow motion shots were wild and the fight scenes were incredible - I felt myself twitching along with the various martial arts movements, and wished I could jump along walls like they did! Everything looked smooth, slick and very real.Overall, I loved this movie, and my husband and I both plan on seeing it again.  I really liked the plot, the effects and the actors.  It's been a while since we've seen an action-packed movie that didn't insult our intelligence!

The Matrix has to be one of the most exciting movies I have seen in a while. The visual effects are stunning, the acting is very strong, and the plot is pure genius.  When I first saw the trailer I thought it would  be just another stupid sci-fi bomb.  But the Matrix is different.  It has what other sci-fi thrillers sometimes lack-potential reality.  It kind of makes you think,  maybe that's possible. It kind of makes you scared too.  YOU MUST SEE THIS MOVIE!

The Wachowski brothers took three difficult elements and made them work together: Keanu Reeves (let's face it, he's no Laurence Olivier); a science fiction plot that -does not- put you to sleep; and action, action, action. They made a realistic storyline that comes together beautifully, especially with the effects that are thrown in.  This is probably one of my favorite movies of all time, now.  A fantastic movie; I recommend that you see it.

Hey, ok I personally wasn't into seeing this movie but I went with my dad. And I was shocked by how great it was. Truly, the story, special effects and acting (yes, acting) made it a great flick. I definitely recommend this film, but don't miss it on the big screen! And by the way the gun fights are killer! So coming from me I give The Matrix a 8 out of 10.

Review title: WOW! Best movie I've seen in a LONG time.
Review_body: Just want to echo the majority here - go see it!  It is an excellent movie. I had NO idea what it was about - just the enigmatic trailers on TV.  I was guessing for the first 45 minutes of the movie! I loved the way it slowly revealed itself.  I just wish the movie could have been LONGER.  I was disappointed it ended so soon - I wanted more!

Review title: What is real and what is imagined
Review_body: I saw "The Matrix" on opening day and again three days later.  Any good movie, especially one as complex in message, plot and visuals, should be viewed more than once.I was intrigued by the previews for this film the first time I saw them. They filled me with a lot of questions, mainly, what in the world is this about?  All of my questions were answered."The Matrix" is one wild ride that makes a person question what is real and what is the intangible construct of our imagination.  How much of what we see and experience is the truth, and how much is only our perception of the data we are bombarded by and required to process every day?The script was beautifully constructed, the dialog just what was necessary to relay plot and character.  The performances were a joy to watch, easily allowing the viewer to suspend disbelief.  The baddies were spooky, evocative of the mysterious men in black characters traveling in threes that people into government/alien conspiracy claim really do exist in our world. The music was so well applied that I barely noticed it (as great soundtracks should be) as it wove its way though the visuals, underscoring the mood.I was floored when Mr. Smith (a baddie) commented about humans not fitting into their environment, being a cancer on the planet.  I've believed this for years.  Did the writers of this movie read my mind?And, how could I not comment specifically on Keanu Reeves' performance. I've enjoyed his work for quite some time.  In this movie, as in others, he is excellent at playing confused, misplaced and, in the end, victorious characters.  As Neo he struggles well with accepting his reality and his place in the scheme of things.  I'd give his performance in this, on a scale of one to ten (10 being the best), about an 8 1/2.Lawrence Fishburn was enthralling as the rather somber, patient, nurturing mentor, Morpheus.  Carrie-Anne Moss was wonderful as Trinity.  The rest of the supporting cast rounded out the film with style."The Matrix" reminded me of other films I enjoyed: "Johnny Mnemonic" (in which the main character was also 'plugged-in') and "Dark City".I truly enjoyed this movie, and when it's available on video I'll add it to my very selective collection of special movies to enjoy over and over.What is real and what is imagined?  Maybe this review only exists in my mind.  Maybe this movie is only a construct of my warped fantasies.  If that's the case, I invite you in to share it.

Review title: A cerebral movie that makes you want to re-read Alice in Wonderland
Review_body: Worth seeing for the conversation you have with your friends afterwards! Finally, a worthy realization of the concepts imagined in your favourite William Gibson (Neuromacer) novels.  The thoughtful use of special effects to convey a fresh story embellished this good storyline.  The fight scenes, performed by the actors themselves, are worth the price of admission (Jackie Chan fans will like them).  Comic relief throughout keeps you going when the story sags a little bit after the intro.  Spectacular ending.  Let's see more films, like this, that use cities other than NY & LA for backdrops!

Review title: Visually stunning, spectacular effects, intriguing plot, superb editing!
Review_body: I love good Sci-Fi. Trouble is, to be really good Sci-Fi, it has to be original...something to make you think. It should make you wonder, "Could this happen?" The Matrix is such a movie.All too often these days, directors rely on dazzling special effects to carry a plot with no interest to anyone. Well, this movie has all the dazzle, as well as sizzling performances by all the cast. But the highlight to me was the plot...slowly pulling you in, detail by detail, until you are totally consumed. Pure entertainment!If your a real Sci-Fi fan, you'll love "The Matrix". If not, you'll probably wonder what all the fuss is about.

Review title: Even Keanu Reeves can't derail this ride...
Review_body: Someone has finally found a forum for Mr. Reeves understated approach to the thespian craft: A great all around Sci-Fi/HK Action/SFX Tour de Force!What brought me to the film in the first place was the promise of a decent evening's diversion.  What kept me was a fine story, exceptional martial arts choreography, and stunning production value.Contributing to the viewer's pleasure is an intelligent sense of camp humor and tongue in cheek reference to time-honored film archetypes, providing a nice sense of balance with all of the over-the-top action.And as for Mr. Reeves, well, he grows on you - Finally!  Never thought that would happen...

Review title: Much more than I had expected - with intelligence even!
Review_body: I walked into this movie with one thing on my mind - "The special effects will be awesome, the movie will suck." Boy, was I wrong. I had what a lot of people had - "Johhny Mnemonic" flashbacks prior to walking in. I mean, let's face it - he's never done Sci-Fi well.Anyways, enough of expectations. From the moment Carrie-Ann Moss floated into the air and did her little Kung Fu maneuvers, I knew the special effects were going to be killer and I was hooked if for no other reason just to see more of that.What I got was not only a special effects ride, but an engaging plot. Laurence Fishburne and his Obi-Wan like character fit him more nicely than I had thought it would. He was quite convincing as the man who has been "searching for the one". Keanu Reeves is not a fantastic actor, but he held his own here. He actually had me convinced that he was the "one".The plot was incredibly intelligent even if it isn't new - it's the question philosophers have been battling for years - "What is reality?" The Wachowski brothers handled this question with incredible skill, however. They took a tired idea and repackaged it for today's vision of tomorrow's technology - the ultimate VR experience.

Review title: The Best Movie of the Decade...if not of All Time
Review_body: This movie is riveting from beginning to end.  The action scenes are great. The special effects, fantastic.  The story line, credible. The acting superb!!  This is the type of movie that you must see for yourself...or as Morpheus says: "Unfortunately, no one can be told what the Matrix is.  You have to see it for yourself."  Open your mind...(another Morpheus request to Neo) and you will enjoy this movie immensely.

Review title: This film is not your average special-effects-minus-plot movie.
Review_body: I was expecting The Matrix to be a two hour special effects show, something I wasn't exactly opposed to (I love special effects).  But I found it instead to be an excellently put-together intellectual film, with plenty of twists to keep your mind whirling.  I truly enjoyed it, and I'll be sure to see it again!

First of all...wow!  This movie just absolutely blew me away. It has everything a good science fiction movie needs and more. The fight scenes were great, especially when combined with special effects that set a whole new standard for action movies everywhere.  The way the Wachowski bros. wove together parts from different movies, books--even the bible!--was terrific. They really did an amazing job.  The acting was terrific.  Keanu Reeves made up for all the crap he's done since Speed, and I have forgiven Carrie-Anne Moss for Models, inc.  The directors really sucked every last bit of talent they could from the cast and crew.  Finally, the camera work was fantastic--slow motion fight scenes usually drive me nuts, but in this case I absolutely loved it.  And the way they would rotate the camera angles...kind of like those annoying gap commercials only way more cool. The dipping, rotating shot of Keanu dodging bullets on the roof in slow motion was the best. Anyway, I definitely recommend this movie for anyone.

Review title: Complex, innovative, and a lot to think about
Review_body: I could say a billion things about this movie that made it excellent to watch.......  First of all when I was driving home that night after watching the movie I started to think, boy what if all this was an actual occurrence in our natural, everyday, boring, yet sophisticated life?  I don't know about you, but when I watch a movie and it makes me think the way I did that night, I knew that that was an excellent movie! Watch this movie, if you like stright forward movies, unlike titles like "The Devils Advocate," in which Al Pacino really screws with your head, then watch this movie.  Think for a moment that you are just a figment of a computers hard drive, and that your whole existence is fake, and your only source of confort in the end is that you might die some day. Wow, this movie has turned me into some buddist monk contemplating different scenarios with alternate possibilities. Watch this movie, you won't regret it.
Matrix was extremely entertaining, good graphics. It was around 2 hrs, and 20 minutes..But I was so caught up in the movie that I didn't notice the time. A great flick, a definite must see.

Review title: Metaphor of humanity's past and future
Review_body: Great metaphoric view of future society, with hints of millennia past. Reminds me of Star Wars I (IV) and the transforming possibilities of humanity.  Excellent concept, great acting and awesome special effects action scenes.  Appropriate character names Trinity, Neo, et al.

Review title: Excellent use of anime-style action sequences, good plot. Made it to my purchasing list (and I never purchase flicks.)
Review_body: This is the sort of flick I would produce if I produced flicks.  Keanu, building on his cyberpunk image from "Johnny Mnemonic" brought in his usual mix of the styled computer geek with a dash of Japanese-anime style drama which may very well become the hallmark of this genre to come. Perhaps what I like best about these "types" of movies is the constant dichotomy of gritty, run down holes where the heroes play and the sterile, fortress-like office environments (not wholly unlike the hole I find myself in from 9-5.) where the enemy lay. Finally, this movie may mean the most to you if you've ever buried your head in a Gibson novel or spent hours of your life digging around the underpinnings of our beloved Internet.  These movies forspeak a day when the gearheads of the net become warriors of corporate interest (or worse,) or rats, scurrying about the sewers under the streets, subverting the establishment in pursuit of some crusade.Hey, I liked it, and Ms. Moss' wardrobe crew deserves props for the ultra-spiff outfits. -Bill.  See you on the net. :)

Easily the best movie I've seen in the past 5 years. As I was going in, all the comments from the audience were along the line of "even Keanu can't screw up this movie too badly". I think even I was shocked to see him turn in a performance where his usual weaknesses turned into strengths. Wow. I can't say enough good things. The story and plotline are kind of similar to Dark City, but the execution and the little details are 100x better. Even John Woo would be impressed by the gunplay here and the martial arts sequences are wonderfully over the top. To top it all off you've got the best bad guy in recent memory: an indestructible government agent that holds all the cards. If this movie has a flaw it's that the beginning hour moves a little slowly. It never gets uninteresting, just a little slow and it makes up for that in the end. As well, some people may think that the ending is just tacked on as a Hollywood afterthought. Personally I thought it was consistent with the film's ideas on fate and prophecy. When it came time to leave the theater I felt like I'd been put through a 50 mile marathon. Now that's good film!

The Matrix is glossy & exciting, with just the right mix to make it successful - even if the plot weren't as good as it is. But, anyone who sees The Matrix as just another "action movie" is missing the point. I dug the whole revolutionary, theological subtext. At a critical point, Laurence Fishburne's character tells Keanu Reeves' that the Matrix is everywhere, and that the "agents" could be anyone. You could easily dismiss this as the paranoid rantings of a man who's been running too long. But, when he complains that it's hard to save the regular folks because so many of them are totally dependent on the Matrix, I had flashbacks to Malcolm X, Marcus Garvey, W.E.B. DuBois... Whatever the arena, the revolutionary's main problem is always the same. Not how to fight the system, but how to wake up the people.I am Muslim, but we share a belief in the return of Jesus (peace be upon him), so I also dug the Revelations references sprinkled throughout. From the names - Trinity... to the gestures (look for the "Last Supper" on a tray)... to the longing for "Zion"... to the moment of doubt (on a ledge this time), it was movie-making at it's best. Poetically referential, this is the kind of movie you have to see more than once. And, each time, you'll pick up a different layer.If all that's too deep for you, you'll still cheer for the special effects, and the tight plot deserves an Oscar for Best Original Screenplay (ala "The Usual Suspects"). The kung fu is "all that" and the directing is sweet, with a little flavor from Bruce Lee, Al Capone, John Wayne, Arnold Schwarzenegger - and a dash of Muhammad Ali (check out Laurence's moves when he spars with Keanu).Loved it. Loved it. Loved it.

Review title: not an action movie buff, but...
Review_body: Wow.  Just striking, in every way.  Saw it in a dolby digital theatre and was blown away by the sounds and images.  An original vision.

Review title: A new high-water mark in special effects.
Review_body: Yes, it's derivative of much better science fiction. And yes, it really has nothing new to say. And o.k., the script is lousy, occasionally ludicrous. But fergetaboutit. This film has the best visuals, the best special effects, the best techno-fight scenes of any movie ever made. As big a step beyond as the original Star Wars was in its time. Had the plot, script and pacing been as fine we would be talking All Time Classic. Instead, it is merely spectacular.

The Matrix is a feast for the eyes, and don't blink!  It is exciting, scary, funny, and I can't imagine anyone else in the role of Neo than Keanu Reeves. The action sequences have to be seen to be believed, and the knowledge that Keanu, Laurence, Carrie and Hugo were actually doing most of their fight scenes themselves made my jaw drop.This goes on my list of favorite science fiction films of all time, up there with Bladerunner and Star Wars.

Review title: Impressive acting performance and special effects with interesting story line
Review_body: I saw the Matrix and I was completely blown away from it. The special effects were very impressive and well performed. They did not take over the story but worked with it beautifully. It had potential of becoming a bit pretentious but managed to stay away from it.The actors really were amazing and the mix between special effects, martial arts and philosophy worked together fabuously. I will go and see it again and I recommend others to do the same.

Wow, This movie is awesome. I particularly like the long action scenes that included Neo kicking some butt martial arts style!! In fact , a little bit of the fighting scenes reminded me of the old martial arts films that featured Bruce Lee!! Like the thumbing of the nose, the slow motion of the waving arms, a lot of it reminded me of Bruce. I must add that this film is the turning point of what we will expect from Hollywood because of its dynamic special effects. I have only seen these effects of the stopping of time and the camera circling around the action in a couple of commercials and I was waiting till a movie would include these effects in their movie!! well, The Matrix has definitely used all of those special effects..... Bravo!!!

Review title: My comments are very positive on this movie.
Review_body: The movie was superb! It kept you on the end of seat with non-stop action! Keanu Reeves did a great job playing Neo! I give it two thumbs up!

Review title: THE BEST MOVIE IN THE 20th CENTURY
Review_body: "The Matrix" is absolutely the best film of the century.  It has the best story, the best actors, and the best directors.  I was amazed how all the pieces were put up together.  It comes out the only film that is worthwhile watching over and over.  I will keep it in my DVD collections and watch the movie AT LEAST one more time.  If you miss watching this film, I would have suggested you not to be born.  GO SEE IT!!!
kick ass movie kick ass concept kick ass effects you can sit for days and think about the concept cant get any better

Review title: A high-powered super slick sci-fi action thriller with everything a good film needs.
Review_body: A high-powered, super slick sci-fi action thriller!  This movie has some of the best fight scenes and action sequences I have ever seen.  All superbly shot with cutting-edge cinematography and well-integrated into a plot that could have been a tired revisitation of archetypal themes, yet instead put a slick, lively, and extremely exciting spin on a fascinating theme of "what-is-reality?"  Great performances by all actors, (particularly by Hugo Weaving and including Keanu Reeves for a change) combined with intense martial arts study added to the film's credibility and well-executed suspension-of-disbelief.  An extremely enjoyable and technically masterful film that I highly recommend.

Well, what can I say but this was a wild movie. I saw it today for the first time and am wondering how much more I will like it when I see it again. Good movie with great effects and a very interesting plot.

This movie separated all of the action movies to date. You don't usually see Keanu Reeves in such a film, but I enjoyed this movie more than any Bruce Willis, or Arnold Schwarzanegger flick, because this movie actually had a plot. Set in a futuristic mode, Reeves finds himself as a hacker, named Neo. The movie is fast paced, and a little technical, but not too technical for those watching. Filmed in Australia with contributions from Hugo Weaving as well as Matt Doran who plays Mouse, shows the world at another angle. The Matrix, lets us see the truth, but leaves us hanging for more. Definitely the best movie I have seen all year.

Review title: Keanu Reeves finally found a role that suits him perfectly
Review_body: The Matrix is not only an action movie, but a movie that is intelligent as well.  Intelligence in movies today is rare, but The Matrix is a movie that holds you to the edge of your seat, and also makes you think about your own existence. These types of movies are a dime a dozen.  If you just want action, see this movie.  If you want to challenge your mind, and I mean challenge the thoughts of your own existence, you must see this movie.  Keanu may not be classified as an Oscar caliber actor, but in this movie, he not only shows that he can act, but that he can challenge the realm of our reality.

Review title: The Matrix is the perfect blend of a great plot and tons of eye-candy..
Review_body: A lot of action movies failed to make it big in the box offices, because they were lacking one thing: a plot.  They would spend all of their money on eye-candy, less care is given to the script or story-line.  The Matrix is the perfect blend of a great plot and tons of eye-candy.  If you are waiting for The Phantom Menace, The Matrix should tie you over for a while.

I was pleasantly surprised by this movie.  Going in I was afraid it would be little more than a vehicle for computer-animated special effects.  The story held my interest, though.I thought the pacing and acting were both good.  The fight scenes were fun and well choreographed.  Laurence Fishburne was very good as usual.  Keanu Reeves has never really impressed me with his acting, but he was good here.Worthy of a trip to see it on a big screen.

This movie is the most intense sci fi movie I watched since "Dark City". Powerful and original in use of special effect, W brothers directed this film in top notch.  The casting of the film seems rather perfect.  Keanu Reeves acting as little as possible purposely of course.  The new face "The Trinity" character is amazing.  Her act in the film is dynamic and the stunts are superb.  However, the plot of the movie could have been better.. If it is the question that drives them than should have left question lead the plot rather than the special effect.  There is a faint hope of Oscars ( it's that good )  Overall, The Matrix is well worth investment of $60 million dollars for Warner Bro.  I wouldn't be surprised to see The Matrix beat the sales of coming sequel of Star Wars.  I already purchased another ticket for coming Friday.  Hey!!  Can't miss out on such a movie playing on theaters. I have friends going for third time now.  :)

Well gee.  I'm not really a fickle person.  I like most of the movies that I see, and I actually enjoy most movies with Keanu Reeves (woah, it's true). Still, I was somewhat more excited to see this film more than others.  And what can I say, two days later, I saw it again.See this film.  Please?It was great.  I can't help but tell everyone that I know that they just have to see this film!  It was more than just a movie.  It really captured my imagination, and made me THINK about it over and over until I had no choice but to see it again just to feed my aching cerebrum.The acting was great.  Reeves and Fishburne made an amazing duo, and all of the other characters really helped to bring it together, as well.  The choreography was top notch - those fighting scenes are breathtaking, especially since you can see that the actors themselves are the ones doing all the insane punching and kicking.The special effects... whew.  Being someone who wants to go into sfx for a career, I will usually see any sfx enhanced movie just for that (I actually enjoyed Godzilla... albeit mildly, and Lost in Space made me drool, as much as other people seemed to not like it).  The Matrix new exactly what was needed.  That "time slice" effect seems to be highly overdone as of late, and whoever invented it is rolling in the dough, but it was really well used here, and I think added to the story.   I feel that the characters' abilities to warp reality were shown this way.  The effect made it seem as though they moved so fast that time had to be slowed so the audience could see what was happening, or sometimes that the characters could actually slow time in order to do some of their stunts.  Whatever the case - I thought it worked.The story was so neat!  When I think about this film in hindsight, it's as if this film was a REALLY good comic book that was turned into a REALLY good film.  I could visualize every single scene being re-done into a Todd McFarlane epic.  I'll bet that something not far from that actually happens.In the end, if other people react as I do to this film, it will be a big money maker, probably spawn lots of paraphernalia, goods, more movies, WHO KNOWS?  It may not top Star Wars (that's a movie that I will camp out to see), but it sure kept my mouth watering and will keep my brain at ease as I wait for May 19th.

Review title: What's real and what's not.... I dunno ?
Review_body: A fantastic movie, with not only great effects but a really intense story. The kind of movie that leaves you asking more questions going out of the theatre than going in. Brilliant nonetheless - Go See it!

This is THE movie to see.  This may be the best Sci-Fi/ action movie since Terminator 2, it might even be better.  Not wanting to give away the plot, this movie shows what could happen if we don't watch ourselves.  Fishburn is AMAZING!!! The graphics are the best I have seen!!!!  If you are going to the movies between now and May 19th (Starwars)  then you have to see The Matrix, and even after May 19th, see it,  " because you have to see it to understand it, I can't describe it "

Review title: Creative Camera/Effects Work, plot drags a bit
Review_body: I had read the April issue of American Cinematographer prior to seeing this movie, so I had a good idea of how the effects and camera work in The Matrix were going to look.  Even so, I was truly blown away by the seamless integration of slow-motion, fast-motion, real time, and CGI work in this picture.  The camera and effects crews did a great job.  They picked the perfect pacing to match the intricate kung-fu and gun fight scenes.  They made my heart slow down, speed up, and stop right along with the action, which was amazing.  The action scenes in The Matrix are top notch, and make the movie worth seeing just be themselves.The story on the other hand could have used some work.  I was let down by the weak ending, and the plot tended to drag in places.  There was a lot of background information that needed to be relayed to the audience, and this is where the movie tended to crawl.  The dialogue was uninventive in its attempt to be pithy, and the over-the-top acting of Laurence Fishburne was a bit much.  Keanu Reeves does put in a terrific performance, one of the better performances of his I've seen in an action film, maybe only topped by Speed.  This film works in the same genre as Johnny Mnemonic, and Reeves' performance is ten times better in The Matrix.  The rest of the supporting cast played their roles, but nothing to write home about.  The character of Agent Smith was played well by Hugo Weaving, but again, the dialogue he was given tended to get in the way of that.Overall, The Matrix is well worth the money to see.  The action scenes are top-notch and breakthrough, and the holes in the plot are easily forgotten in light of the effects.  I recommend seeing it in a THX theater, it will definitely heighten the experience.

Review title: A must-see in the theatre; don't wait for video.
Review_body: By far the sweetest action/sci-fi/special effects flick I've seen in a good,long time.  The acting is superb (especially by the ever-under-appreciated Laurence Fishburne) and the special effects are... Well you saw the trailers, right? Despite the title, fans of William Gibson and Shadowrun won't be nearly as impressed/inspired by this one as players of White Wolf's "Mage" role-playing game.  But if you have any love of science fiction at all, go watch this one.  I'm gonna buy it when it comes out.

Wow. This movie really makes you think. Extremely entertaining, amazing special effects, and the music is great. I hope this movie starts a whole new way of making movies. The Matrix is "Most Excellent"!

Review title: Spectacular, surprising sci-fi action with a dark edge...
Review_body: Very few contemporary science fiction movies truly capture my imagination anymore. One too many Starship Troopers and Aliens 19 ("Momma Gets Menopause") paste-together computer graphics extravaganzas have been shoved down my throat for me to readily suspend disbelief and, for a short ninety minutes, "witness the future". The Matrix has renewed my faith in a genre that seemed to be, at best, treading water waiting for Master Lucas to save the decade.To begin, the action --as you probably would expect from the previews-- is steely, breakneck, and plausible (given the premise of The Matrix... which I won't give away!). What makes it all the more enjoyable is seeing the actors handling the high-kicking, twirling, leaping duties themselves --a lot of individual work and dedication has gone into this movie. And here I though Keanu Reeves was only barely agile enough to surf (see Point Break)....Next, the special effects were... well, special. I don't think it will be a major spoiler to tell you that the freeze-frame panning effect made famous by a certain chinos ad is put to good --but not gratuitous-- use. When the time comes to break out the Silicon Graphics workstations' goodies, they are seamlessly integrated into the plot rather than thrust before us as if to apologize for the steep ticket prices in today's theaters.Ah, but then comes the good stuff: the Matrix itself. The plot's core premise HAS been done before, but not, in my recollection, to such striking effect and with such clever evasiveness during the build-up to disclosure. I am an old-school sci-fi buff; I thought, smugly, that I knew what was going on after the first thirty minutes... perhaps the greatest delight of The Matrix was my being proved wrong! I will come as close to a spoiler as I can by saying "cyberpunk" was NEVER so dark as this story!In closing, The Matrix is a well-crafted, gripping story starring two easily-disregarded principles who go far to prove that "they're not just for breakfast anymore". It comes alive through stunning visuals, a surprising premise, and a fast-paced ride to its conclusion. The only thing driving me to give it a 9 instead of a 10 is that NO ONE should be called "The Chosen One" in anymore movies, stories, novellas, epic poems, religious tracts, or political pamphlets! Ever again! PLEASE!The Mad Czar Fnord

Review title: An amazing film with something for any movie watcher...
Review_body: If you like a shoot-'em-up film with amazing martial arts and constant action, then "The Matrix" is for you. If you're looking for an edge-of-your-seat techo-thriller, bursting at the seams with the latest special effects, then "The Matrix" is for you. I recommend the third-row. And if you're in that small (but proud) group that wants something to get the old brain saying "What if...?" then "The Matrix" is definitely for you. "The Matrix" is deep enough for Descartes, but chock-full of enough brain-candy to keep even the most distractible viewer glued to his seat. Whatever your interests, "The Matrix" will having you talking and wondering all the way home. A mix of new technology, old philosophy, and awesome special effects makes "The Matrix" the best film I've seen in years!
