The Matrix represents the vision of so-called Generation X. We twenty and thirty-somethings have, each one of us, walked the Cyper-path in its earliest dust-covered incarnations, (even if that means we only dabbled with hallucinogens and techno-music), always dreaming of the time when technology would provide the world with the capability of *becoming* the video game. This movie is Virtual Reality as Descartes and other 'brain in a vat' enthusiasts would have it.  And the eye candy in this film puts Titanic to shame.

Review title: Appalling rubbish - apart from the special fx
Review_body: This film is abolutely awful. My girlfriend and I would have left the cinema half-way through if we knew that we both felt the same about it at the time! Apart from the special effects, the film suffers from WOODEN ACTING (There goes Keanu again!) and ridiculous storyline. The special fx are amazing though - apart from that it is a total waste of time. However - we seem to stand alone on this one, as the rest of the world seems to think this is the most amazing film ever made. Oh well.

Better than T2, as good as Apocalypse Now, better than Dark City.  I have now seen it twice and will surely see it again in the theatre at least one more time.  I was fully entertained, no boring parts.  The music was perfectly selected.  This movie makes my top 10 list easily.  The effects, while cutting-edge, are not superior to the plot, the style, the cinematography, or the action scenes. Oodles of scenes that will make you say "How the hell did they film THAT!?"  If you like martial arts, this is simply tantalizing.  If you like existentialism, this movie will more than satisfy.  If you are into hard-core whoop-a** action, few better movies exist.  This movie is so well made, I felt that my ticket price was so cheap, I would pay to see it 5 more times and feel like I got a bargain. The few conceptual flaws, which I root out of every movie, are inconsequential and detract nothing from the flick.  Keanu's agent should get a huge raise, for he could have done nothing better to redeem Keanu's reputation.  Keanu's typical dead-pan and poor acting are actually ideal for this role.  If there is one non-X-rated movie I would have liked to be a part of, this is it.  Go and see this with a diaper on!

This is a well-rounded movie. It has ground breaking special effects that do not appear to be forced into the plot just because they are cool. It has an intelligent plot that has you thinking throughout the story. It has action to rival all the formula Hollywood 'chase scenes.' It's a movie you'll want on DVD. Fast action, mental concepts, high tech. No gore. No nudity. How did this get through Hollywood. Way to go Warner.

Review title: "A tremendous thanks to the Wachowski brothers for shedding a bit of light on the truth behind reality."
Review_body: This film is absolutely fantastic.  There isn't a single shot that is lacking in perfection.  Every angle, every captivating scene carries with it a powerful sense of wisdom and spiritual enlightenment.  I commend each and every actor for working to bring forth such a beautiful performance. Their hard work and dedication to this project has paid off, without a doubt. The witty dialogue and nearly flawless storyline, the magnificently executed fight scenes, the awe-inspiring implementation of the latest visual effects technology -- all of these elements join forces, blasting the minds of the viewers with a powerful wake up call.  The world is YOURS.  The choice is ALWAYS yours.  You will see exactly what you believe, for all of eternity. Thank you, Larry and Andy Wachowski.

Review title: visually a geiger-esque modern day Blade Runner..and far more
Review_body: The Matrix portrays a futuristic concept that forces its audience to question his/her reality. It doesn't serve up a mere effect ridden action flick on a platter but rather brings the audience on a fantastic ride that leaves the special effects coming in second to a profound storyline that will leave you breathless. It's always nice to see a movie that isn't predictable but instead offers suspense and anticipation.
Great FX with story line that keeps you involved.  Pulse pounding action and music with KUNGFU fighting-what more could you want??  See this one on the big screen, don't wait for video!

I just saw the Matrix, and well yes it was a good movie no doubt, but the plot was given away in the first 9 minutes... and well I was expecting a little bit more out of a sci-fi movie. And the end is a little disappointing. But other than that it was a damn fine movie to watch... the effects were great, the cast fought nice with other profiles.

Review title: Really well executed, just all-around kickass movie!!
Review_body: The Matrix : 1 Part Dark City 2 Parts (place Hong Kong action movie here) 1 Part Terminator Mix well.This movie was such a pleasant surprise.  The trailer did a really good job of not giving away ANYTHING about the movie, which is why I was really skeptical about seeing it... it looked like a bunch of random fight scenes with some f/x thrown in.  But it was really cool, even though the plot was very inspired.  It's one of those movies that you can watch again and again and notice new stuff each time.  Definitely a must-see (and must-buy when it comes out on DVD, which it will, since it's a WB movie)....

Review title: The Matrix, Still amazing the fifth time.
Review_body: It is a 10!   This movie touches on many issues that are predominant the world over.  With amazing special effects and a sound track that still has me reeling this film is top quality.  The costumes were especially well done and the characters had a sence of realism to them that is not commonly found in films today.   Small things hidden in the movie make return visits even more entertaining as the viewer catches something new each visit.   On my list of movies The Matrix takes a close second to Braveheart.   A must see.
The Matrix is so Awesome!!! For those of you who haven't seen it hurry up! The special effects kicks a** and so do the actors! You have to see it to believe it! Prepare to get blown away!

As was written previously, this movie borrows a bit. HOWEVER, the package this movie wraps everything together in is phenomenal. The music, the action, and most definitely the thought provoking plot of this movie make it worth seeing multiple times. I have had dreams that were probably some of the most bizarre that have ever been dreamed, but this went well beyond those. Also, there are aspects in this movie other than the plot that require thought. Some of the names and symbology have an underlying theme. Bravo to a movie for thinking people who like a little KILLER action and visual stimulation on the side!

Review title: A truly amazing movie you will remember...
Review_body: What the Matrix is I cannot tell.. but what I can tell you is that this movie is truly amazing. Brilliant actors, spectacular effects and a great story to go with that. The movie is so smart and well done it will hook you from the very beginning and make you want to watch it over and over again. Don't miss out this one or you'll miss something I assure you.. Classic already?

So this is about the first movie I've seen in a good long time in which Keanu didn't manage to totally hose it up. The effects were impeccable, and the feel was a lot like I felt Dark City was trying to approach. All in all, worth the seven and a half bucks.

Review title: The Matrix, a damn fine movie, everything a movie should be.
Review_body: I just have to comment on my favorite movie ever, in my opinion anyways. All the good comments about the films special effects and story have already been spoken for, so I'll just agree with that and have no need to add further on that. I also really enjoyed the directing of the movie by those Wachowski brothers. The way the soundtrack and film goes together, it's done so well, that sometimes you don't notice the sound, but its keeping you with the scene so well. I don't know if what I said makes sense, I just woke up and I'm not very alive right now. But The Matrix kicks A$$ in my book, i've seen it 6 times now in the past week, i'll make 8 today. And i don't ever see movies in this frequency.

Review title: Did I mention that I like this movie?
Review_body: This movie kicks backside. I love this movie. Previously my favorite movie of the 90's was Dark City, but I enjoyed The Matrix alot more than DC. The special effects are fantastic, and it will be interesting to see how they line up against Star Wars  special effects. And an Aussie gets to play a big role in the movie!

Some Sci-Fi purists may claim that there is nothing new to the concept of "The Matrix", that it can be synopsised as a derivative of previous works... While this may be strictly true (I'm not such an avid sci-fi junkie to qualatively say either way) the reason for this comment's prevalence in reviews is, in my opinion, because the film has no other negative aspect. The plot has an astounding scope, the cinematography and imagery is top-notch, the special effects and CGI seamless to the point where after the first 30min, you fail to notice them at all...  And the direction is outstanding.  This is a well paced, albeit slightly long masterpiece of modern day science fiction that I'd recommend to anyone as one of the top 5 movies to see this year.

Review title: At last, BLADE RUNNER has a good cyberpunk movie companion!
Review_body: This movie will change Sci-Fi as we know it. Ironic that its released in the same year as PHANTOM MENACE, by two relative unknowns, Los Bros. Wachowski. But despite Episode One, I still think this is the movie that is sparking the most word-of-mouth around the water cooler.  Never before seen, inventive FX, strong themes, some say rehashed, but still made fresh and different.  Exciting leads, perfect casting (Fishburne, as always, magnetic; Moss was icy cool, strong;your villain defines your heroes, and Weaving was superbly evil, but also defined himself and why Agents do what they do;lastly, Reeves always handled the physical roles well, but he also emoted, showed a little of himself in scenes, something we hadn't seen in a while.  Good films and good directing brings out the best in you.  In the words of Morpheus, "You must experience the MATRIX for yourself!".

The Matrix is one of the best movies ever made. It combines incredibly involved and intriguing script with outstanding visual effects. The Matrix makes you stop and think about your own life and questions that bother all of us "what is real?" The martial arts scenes are probably the best ever done by western actors--Bravo! Keanu Reeves (and I am not even a fan). They can be comparable only to Bruce Lee and Jackie Chan. I guarantee that it will become one of your favorite movies

The Matrix is by far the best science fiction movie I have ever seen. I usually don't like them, but this movie was the best. The graphics were great, the soundtrack rocks (literally), and anyone who hasn't seen it, should.

Review title: "...You have to see it for yourself."
Review_body: Wow.  This is definitely my new all-time favorite film.  It's the fantasy of "The Never-Ending Story" mixed with the techno-thrills aspects of "Hackers," the hair-raising science-fiction qualities of "2001: A Space Odyssey" that made us really made us wonder whether computers could be our evolutionary successors, the special effects that made "Independence Day" and "Star Wars" so intriguing, the combat that leaves us in awe of people like Jackie Chan, the dark elements of "The Crow," and Lawrence Fishburne's sheer talent of being the ultimate "badass."  As others have said, this is a movie that needs to be seen at least twice to appreciate not only the immediately apparent qualities, but also the inherent complexities, hints, and foreshadowing that were all missed the first time as you were trying to figure things out.   Thought-provoking, indeed.  "Episode I" better be at least this good.

Review title: Indeed the best movie I've seen this year.
Review_body: Although the first hour was rather boring, the following hour of the movie was action packed, it makes up for all the action (or lack of) in the first part. This is a top movie. Great special effects, and great cast, make this movie a must see.Great if you love Sci-Fi movies, I do. 10/10 from me.

Review title: One of the worst of the year
Review_body: "Boring" and "who cares" about sums up my feelings of this movie. Boring-I slept through some of it and I was awakened by the buzz of audience chatter through out the movie.  Everyone talks about it being derivative-Really- let me count the ways- Terminator II which I liked a lot- These guys must have seen Disney movies a hundred times each i.e. Alice, Cinderella, sleeping beauty, plus a lot of Roadrunner cartoons- and a lot of people are mentioning a Gap commercial! give me a break-please- Bombarding the senses does not make a great movie.Who cares-There was no characters I cared about or even knew anything about- no plot-no story-no nothing- an extremely clever cartoon-only- that's all folks.
To borrow a single word from the movie and using it with the same emotion, "Whoaa..."

Not many films have impressed me lately, but this one really did. It was the best film so far this year. However, I do believe star wars - the phantom menace will beat it when it gets out. Meanwhile, I think I'm going to go watch this movie again. God it was good.

Besides The Matrix, I haven't seen a movie that does a good job of "waking you up".  The Matrix offers an answer in the form of an analogy to the question:  Is there more to this life than the eye can see?  Besides being dazzled by special fx and thrilled by funky-tune slow-motion action, I was challenged by being asked where I stood on this planet.  Am I looking for the truth and fighting to inform others about it, or am I indulging myself and pretending that there may be nothing more than what I've been told. This movie explores many things:  Belief, fate, faith, hope, fear, power, etc.  It's all good stuff.  All these things were sort of brought together and, at least for me were, one by one, made sense of.

Review title: 'The Matrix'; a new name for logical thinking
Review_body: A viewer looks for a good plot, good graphics, good acting, and overall a good show. Although 'The Matrix' does not entirely cover new ground, it gives it audience a tremendous plot, explosive graphics, award winning acting, and freakin' good show. It also gives you something to think about after the movie. 'The Matrix' asks us what we truly believe and what makes these beliefs true. 'It' is truly everywhere and in everyone. 'The Matrix' is the question that asks "how real is what we deem real". Only one person knows. And that person is...YOU; you are your own CHOSEN ONE.

When I saw this movie, the words HOLY COW came to mind.  The mind blowing action, the intense ideas thrown at you, and the sets aren't to shabby either.  This is a must see for everyone that has eyes to see it, and even then, have someone with eyes explain what is going on!  This is one of the best movies (and well acted) of Keanu Reeves since his run-in with a bus. And I don't think I've ever seen Laurence Fishburne this good.  I have never seen the beautiful Carrie-Anne Moss either until this, but she be fine by me. With an exciting cast of those above and a plethora of others, this is a movie that you should see even if you have to take off of school or work. See it more then once actually, I have (twice in three days actually). And when it comes out, I recommend that you buy it on laserdisk or DVD, because you will wear down the tape in a matter of days.

This movie was excellent. Andy Wachowski and Larry Wachowski are two of the greatest writers and directors I've seen in a long time. The shots were the best, the special effects were trippy, and mind-blowing, and the writing was intriguing and pure brilliance. Go see this movie. If you already have, go again.

Let me just say, I don't care if you are a person who doesn't like Sci-Fi or Action or Cyberspace because everyone MUST see this movie.  Forget everything you have ever seen before.  When I walked out of this movie I felt like I had just seen the invention of "film".  It is probably my new favorite movie.Granted every movie has it's little flaws, but in this one, the flaws are so minute that it's hardly even noticeable.    You MUST see this movie.  If you don't see it, you will be missing out on a masterpiece.  Make sure you see it in the theater first because if you didn't, it would be like wanting to get on a roller coaster, but instead of going to Disneyland, you get in your car and drive around really fast.  In other words, the Theater is the best venue to see this film (if your city has an IMAX and it is showing there, even better).

With all the Star Wars hype, this movie may be overlooked. I feel that it has an amazingly intricate plot, wonderful effects, and solid importance. I left the theatre with a glowing feeling after seeing a great hero emerge (Neo.) I never thought I would say that about Mr. Reeves in a film.This movie is amazing and well deserves its success.ET
It was a very good movie. At the beginning we understand nothing, like the main character, and while the movie plays we begin to understand. It was so good that I want to buy it.Go see it!!!

Review title: AI meets Nostradamus and the second coming.
Review_body: Very cool story line.  Not being a religious person I was impressed by the "Coming of the savior" aspect of the story.  The prophecy of the "Chosen One" that would come to be born and would save all of mankind.This movie rocked!

Review title: Beautifully filmed, with an actual thinking plot, with excellent cinematography.
Review_body: For the first time in a long while a movie was made with thought.  A movie that made you think, and having to see it twice to get the whole picture.The special effects were outstanding, along with the cinematography and direction.  This movie was made with care...a 2.5 hour sci fi, kung fu, love story, that had everything for everyone.I am so glad someone is making real movies out there again, not like "Armageddon"...a movie for the "short attention span-mtv video edit generation".My score a 10 out of 10. Awesome!

Review title: Absolutely, positively, definitely the best movie ever!
Review_body: The Matrix has the best blend of sci-fi and action that I've seen in a long time. I am big sci-fi and action movie fan and an even bigger martial arts fan. The Matrix superbly mixes Star Wars and Mortal Kombat, adding in some Bruce Lee and Bruce Willis, topping it off with a little love interest. The special effects are so phenomenal they make Jurassic Park look prehistoric. The soundtrack rocks! Laurence Fishburne and Keanu Reeves are excellent in their respective teacher/apprentice roles. I almost never watch the same movie twice on it's original release, but I've already seen it twice! My eternal thanks goes out to The Wachowski Brothers as well as the rest of the cast and crew for reviving my movie going experience.

Review title: The Matrix, one of the greatest movies ever!
Review_body: The special effects have been getting all the publicity about this film.  I feel that that was only one of the things that made this movie great. Granted with out them the movie would not be doing as well as it is but the story line is what really grabbed me.  It was a movie that made me think and not just sit there.  For a sci-fi movie to do that is amazing.  On top of that this is a movie that takes the terminator series to another level. This is a story line that could be true.  Every bit of it could be true.  I would encourage anyone to go and view this movie.

Review title: A good video game commercial disguised as a terrible movie
Review_body: I'm not sure why so many people were so impressed by this movie.  Story? Perhaps if you've never thought about realistic virtual reality, or dreamed you were a butterfly and wondered if you were a butterfly dreaming you were a man.  Then you might be blinded to the huge plot holes. But the script will fit wonderfully to its obvious destination: a video game surely on its way to stores right now.Perhaps the action sequences, if you're the type who likes violence video games so much you'd be happy to sit and watch someone else play one... over and over and over.  The camera tricks and effects were interesting once, but we've all seen them on TV already -- the commercial, in fact, is better than the movie.Certainly it wasn't the characters.  Only Morpheus had any kind of personality, which saved us from having to find out what the other actors might have been like if they'd been called on to act.  Keanu got two scenes that required acting (the kiss of life, and the epiphany), but he missed on both and just laid or stood there.  The rest of the movie, Neo was called The One, but he might have been The Zero -- other than a token reference to him having the trouble with authority figures all action heros are required by Hollywood Law to have (subtlely portrayed by having someone tell him "you have trouble with authority figures, don't you?") he had no character, making Keanu a great fit for him.William Gibson, save us!

Although the story is little cliched and the premise a tad dodgy, this movie is a stunning visual rollercoster ride. The direction and style are so compelling that any defects in the story are quickly swept aside.One of the most enjoyable films Ive seen.

the matrix is the most amazing movie i had ever seen in my entire life because its not a simple action movie (like the mummy) it got a complicated story base and a lot of great characters. keanu reeves is playing his best role yet and laurence fishborne is the greatest actor in the movie performing great actor skill he brought with him from the theater. carrie ane moss is as sexy as ever and hugo weaving is the ultimate bad guy. finally i recomended this film very much just go see it!!!!!!!!

Review title: One of the best movies I have ever seen
Review_body: Absolutely excellent special effects.  The story keeps you in the movie and makes you think to yourself that it could all really happen.  Great movie.

First I was going to watch Twin Dragon, but the theathre which played the movie wasn't playing any movies and the time. And so I decide to watch The Matrix, And I am very glad that I didn't see Twin Dragon, because Matrix was so awesome,and the fighting scene is just wicked. I saw the movie like 12 times, and I will never get tired of it.

The Matrix is one of the BEST science fiction movies ever made. The acting at times is just...acceptable and the story/plot has many elements that have been borrowed from other films, but, the Matrix executes the ideas in a far superior fashion. This movie is eye candy at its best. Every special effect will make your jaw hit the floor. The costumes are extremely stylish--I especially like the fact that the character "Switch" wears an all-white leather ensemble as opposed to the all-black outfits all the other characters wear. She stands out. Even Keanu Reeves couldn't sink this one. The action sequences are un-surpassed...the kung-fu is only out-done by perhaps some of Jackie Chan or Jet Li's work... There are some plot holes. But, the movie makes a great deal more sense the second or more times through, but you'll want to see it again for the visual effects. I love this movie. 10/10. Although I admit nothing is perfect, the sheer awe-inspiring effects have influenced my vote.

Incredible reality-bending effects, a Geiger-nightmare world and the ongoing human struggle to convince ourselves we are not slaves to our own creations, orchestrated to incredible industrial and drum and base and dressed in vinyl trench coats and steel toed stomping boots......cyber-industrial-paranoia-from hell.....I haven't had to scrape my jaw from the theatre floor like this since Dark City.......ddddddaaaammmnnnnnnnn!!!!!And one  more thing....I am very happy that Mr.Reeves has finally been able to break out of the Bill & Ted typecast....you go boy!!!!!!!

It has to be the best sci-fi movie out there. Maybe even better then Star Wars. "The Matrix" has to at least beat "Titantic" in the box office. There is no movie out there that could outdo it. The plot and characters were perfect. The plot is very complicated and to me unpredictable. When I went to see this movie I thought,"well another predictable action movie without a plot." But then afterwards I was so impressed that I was in awe of it for over an hour. I couldn't believe it! Somebody actually made a movie that literally made Star Wars look like a little kids movie.

Review title: A sci-fi with many astonishing special effects scenes and an original plot
Review_body: This is surely the sci-fi action thriller of the year. The superb acting skills of Keanu Reeves and Laurence Fishburne, combined with the fresh original plot created by Andy Wachowski and Larry Wachowski and the seam less special effects scenes created in Australia! Have united to form a movie to entertain all thrill seekers.

Never have I seen such a visually astounding movie.  The Wachowski brothers have found the perfect balance of special effects, action, and plot.  Each cast member brought a unique personality to the movie and cannot be replaced by anyone.  Keanu Reeves brings his dark sexy intelligent look, Carrie-Anne Moss shows us that a woman can definitely kick some butt and still be feminine, and Laurence Fishburne brings god-like wisdom.  If you have not seen this movie, I suggest you leave NOW, and The Matrix will have you too. Can't wait for the sequels.

What first appeared to be a "I'll wait till it comes out on video" turned out to be the best sci-fi action flik since Terminator 2.. bar none.  The trailers simply don't do it justice.  Perhaps enhancing the trailers would have given the storyline away so I can see where they were coming from. This is definitely a word of mouth film.This movie immerses you into a plot that would otherwise be hard to swallow, even with an open mind.  The screenplay is simply brilliant, and the special effects, well, it's just never been done before.With it's techno-pop soundtrack, intense action and cool shades you can't miss with this one.  See it on the big screen before it's too late!

Whether you are a computer buff or not the special effects of this movie will blow you away and leave you dazed.  The plot of this movie will actually make you think of your own life and your surroundings.  A must must see.

Ok, this is the best movie I've ever seen.  Its story really does make you wonder(and I know you have all wondered things like this before the movie) if something like the Matrix is real!  The whole movie is amazing, from the story straight down to the solid acting performance(especially my fav actress miss Carrie-Anne Moss[she's my favorite for a long time now]).  I like the special effects, especially the "Bullet Time" that John Gaeta did! I'll have seen it three times once Thurday comes around cause I'm seeing it again on Wednesday!!  Tremendous!

This was the movie I'd always imagined; creepy, drippy, malevolent sets like City of Lost Children & Aliens, interesting plot idea (Is it REAL?), literally unreal graphics, stunning imagery. Ever played a cyberpunk-RPG? See this movie. Ideas galore! Dialogue to die for! Derivative? Arguably? Sparse? Possibly. Better than the sum of its borrowed parts?  You Betcha. Gonna see it again without a doubt.

I had very high expectations going into this film,  The Matrix blew them away!  It's as if they knew exactly what I would think was cool and made a film for MY viewing pleasure! I loved nearly every aspect of this film!  The Kung Fu fight scenes were some of the best I've ever seen (and I've seen a lot)!  Beautiful use of slow motion and sound effects.  Fantastic cinematography!  I can't wait to see what the Wachowski brothers next project will be.  A thoroughly enjoyable movie experience!

Review title: The Answer is out there, It's the Question that drives us.
Review_body: Another plus for Keanu. Loving Carie-Anne and Lawrence . At first, I didn't really care about seeing the movie, I could've waited till it came out on video. But my dad suggested it, we saw it, and I was blown away. It's now my fav movie, I've seen it 4 whole times and 2 half times. I know almost every line and have two copies of the soundtrack. Unfortunatly no one can be told what the matrix is, you have to see it for yourself. So get out there and see it, you'll fall in love with all the characters.( and the fight scenes )

Review title: A very insightful and entertaining cinematic adventure.
Review_body: A welcome balance of talent and execution.  The story, acting, special effects and the music are well integrated; the pace of the film kept me engaged from beginning to end.  I've seen the movie twice with my husband and our 17 year old son.  This is a cyberspace version of Orwell's 1984, Animal Farm and much, much more.  I loved every minute of it.

Review title: Excellent Movie, virtually no foul language, no nudity, just good violence!!
Review_body: Reeves, and Fishburne, make a fantastic duo in this high packed action film. This film raises many interesting questions, that require the movie to be seen over and over again to before finally getting an acceptable answer to them.Not since Johnny Mnemonic has Reeves been this good.  The movie give an interesting twist to what people perceive as life.

Review title: I just don't get the hype.
Review_body: While the individual pieces of this movie were well constructed, they weren't particularly well assembled.  The Matrix tried to be a deep, philosophical work, a techno-thriller and a Hong Kong action movie all in one.  The blend just didn't work for me.And the whole "hovercraft" flying around the undercity portion was completely gratuitous.

I really liked the storyline. Unfortunately, they could have done a lot more with it.  I felt like I was looking at a mixture of Jackie Chan and Chow Yung Fat (Replacement Killers) with a bit of True Lies and Sleeping Beauty added for good measure.  I don't mind violent movies, but this one was pushing violence for violence sake.  Special effects were technically good, but totally un-original (Look at the Replacement Killers for the bullets bouncing off the floor and True Lies for firing at a building floor from an airplane (Harrier jet for True Lies, helicopter for the Matrix...same difference (I preferred the Harrier).  This movie should have a rating between 6.1 and 6.5

There's nothing I could say about this movie that could fully explain how awesome this movie was.  The visual effects made this more of an experience than a movie and I highly recommend it to everyone for it will totally change your perception on reality.

Review title: Cool, awesome, terrific, cool, "The best movie I have ever seen... ever"
Review_body: Not much to say really, Great F/X. Great acting from Laurence Fishburne. Too bad Keanu Reeves had to be in it though, but he does it ok really. I guess it is just those of us who still remember him ruining a perfectly good short story like Johnny Nmemonic. Damn I don't like that guy. But the movie is the greatest. And the story... Talk about the perfect plot.

Review title: Cyber lovers with a rebel attitude, you'll love this...
Review_body: So finally another movie about the wonders of computers. Add that up with super special effects of the next millenium, combat and shut-em-up scenes Woo-Style, and a plot that i'm still trying to work out - and you've got a nice matrix of what is my choice for the best of intertainment in 1999. Keanu Reeves is doing pretty well in this, his baffled look is appropriate for the character of NEO (a.k.a. The ONE). After 45 min. you may find the movie slightly boring, and wonder where all the promised action is, but the last hour will pull you hair back if you're a cyberaction fan. I have only 4 words to say to you right now: GO SEE THIS MOVIE !...it is not real - that's just the way it is...

When I went to see The Matrix, I thought it was just going to be another effects movie.  I was right, and I was wrong:  this was THE effects movie! At least around here effects movies are not expected to have much in the way of story or characters, but the Matrix avoided both by introducing an edgy plot and some pretty decent characters.  I agree that while Keanu is not an incredible actor, he does have a good look and style, which actually worked well.  Laurence Fishburne was excellent, as always, and well casted.  Last comment:  I took my girlfriend to see this movie, and she actually got motion sick!  says something about the effects, in my opinion.

Yes, as it has been said, the special effects were wonderful in this movie. But also it must be said that this isn't just a treat for the eye to see; The Matrix, the first of an intended trilogy, is a potential concept that messes with your mind in a way no other movie has yet, in my opinion, been capable of.  The scientific possibilities presented in Jurassic Park, for example, are nothing compared with this, and the dark future lying in wait for the human race could be out there.  I shudder to think of it, as this brilliant movie makes it so real in its presentation of our blinded world. It's as Morpheus says:  "No one can be told what the Matrix is; you have to see it for yourself."

Everyone has basically said all the good stuff about this film already and I agree totally with them.  I don't know what's wrong with some of the people who say the plot's too "confusing" to understand as I enjoyed it very much. The action scenes literally blew me away and fitted right into the whole story line.  Virtually everything was good about this film.  But enough talking... GO OUT AND SEE THIS WICKED MOVIE!!You'll be sorry if you don't!

Cool stuff!  Pooh on all those that say "Bah Humbug" and find fault.  The Matrix rrrrrocked!!! They should have stayed home.  Go rent "Room with a View" or some other such tripe if you can't allow yourself to be sucked into another reality.  The rest of you, you'll come out of this movie wanting to run up the walls and wonder if the only reason you can't is because you didn't know that you could.  Make sense?  No?  Go see it............ because there is no spoon.

Review title: See it... but make sure you have the attention span
Review_body: The Matrix isn't for everyone, granted - the plot takes a long and winding road to its resolution.  If you're the kind of person who can't sit and pay attention to something for two hours, then The Matrix isn't for you.  Go watch a commercial.Just because it makes heavy use of special effects doesn't automatically make it an "effects film" - to the contrary, The Matrix is one of the few films that incorporates an intelligent plot with excellent special effects.

Once in a while, an SF movie comes along that is so beautifully crafted and conceived that it sets the mark against which others are judged. Star Wars was one such movie. And I believe the Matrix is another.The special effects blew me away. And it's got all the elements that makes it a superbly enjoyable movie: action, a hero everyone wants to identify with, and romance.This one's going to be a classic.

Review title: The coolest movie I have seen in a long time.
Review_body: This movie is the best combination of storyline and special efects I have seen in a long time.  The only thing that was missing was true character development.  It was so fast paced, it seemed like the whole movie took place in a couple of real time days. Time only enough to get a glimpse of each character. 2 1/2 hours seemed like 45 minute rollercoster ride. I am looking foward to the sequels.

This is probably the most disappointed I've been about a movie in some time. I don't know what I actually expected, but I was surprised by what I saw. To be perfectly honest, the effects didn't save the movie.  They weren't even as good as I had expected.  Maybe I'm being picky, but eye candy isn't enough when it's unsweetened and bitter tasting.

Finally, here is a movie that doesn't take for granted the intelligence of the audience.  "The Matrix" is not only a pulse-pounding sci-fi action film but it is also one that stimulates the mind.  With ingenious plot, multi-dimensional characters, as well as intense symbolism and socio-philosophy the movie not only keeps you on the edge of disbelief but it also rocks your mind and soul.  12 out of 10.  Let's see if the Phantom Menace can top this.

The best of the genre so far.  Aside from some plot holes big enough for a truck, this is a wonderful special effects romp.  The acting is perfect (low key) for the film, too. Sit back and take the ride.  You won't feel ripped off for paying $8.50 or whatever.  Cheaper than Disneyland.

Keanu Reeves could have been replaced, but the supporting cast was awesome. The camera work was second to none.  The grafix, lets just say, too bad it had to come out the same year as Phantom Menace.  The music was surprisingly fitting.  The idea behind the "Matrix" being a dream world, yadda yadda yadda was imaginative, but the story line to the movie didn't go anywhere. Seeing the second and third time, I actually noticed more and more, and it actually adds more to the movie.  For anyone who's seen it once and enjoyed it, I recommend watching it a second time.  Third?  I dont know about that one, but only rent/buy it if you have a nice home system.
really good movie - with an original idea and high professional/technological realization, but... the unreal/not logical happy end makes you (almost) forget about all the good sides of that movie...

Review title: The Matrix is a good film that prompts important questions about the role of computers in our lives.
Review_body: The Matrix is a very entertaining, thought-provoking film that combined great camera work with a bold storyline.  It takes place about 200 years from today, in a world ruled by computers.  Man programmed them to learn and evolve and is now reaping the punishment for that.  Humans are slaves to the machines, living out their whole lives in cocoons where their biochemical energy is "farmed" to power the computers.  While their bodies are trapped in these cocoons, their minds are trapped in "The Matrix," a hideously complex computer simulation of late 20th Century.  The humans live happy lives in this imagined world, ignorant of the true reality.But there are a handful of humans who live outside the Matrix.  These computer "hackers" who live on the run from the computers know how to tap into the Matrix.  They can observe those trapped in the program.  They can even help them escape.  But they are first looking for the man who will fulfill the Oracle's prophecy: the man who has the ability to "change things" inside the Matrix.  The man who will be able to free humankind from bondage.

I'm not a sci fi lover and am not really sure what I expected from this movie. Maybe this is why the story seemed so original to me and many others, the most original story I've seen in many years.Was blown away by the special effects but also connected to the movie on a spiritual level - probably the stuff folks found really trite and silly caused me to think about how I move through this world/life.Anyone who has experienced a spiritual "rebirth" will find much food for thought here.My friend and I walked out of the theatre and immediatley purchased a ticket for the next show. I think I've seen it 6 times.

This movie is Awesome.   You have to see this movie before you die preferably while it's still in Theaters.  This movie describes a world that we are in but don't realize it.  To describe this movie is extremely hard. to Quote Morphius ( Lawrence Fishburn)," to describe the Matrix is impossible.   You have to see to believe it."

If you can imagine combining John Woo's cinematography, Jackie Chan's choreography, and New Age epistemology you have The Matrix.  Neo, played by the surprisingly fitting Keanu Reeves, is about to discover the world in which he lives is a lot less than it seems.  Chosen by Morpheus (Lawrence Fishburne) he joins a group of rebels who know the truth and are beginning to crack the code of our universe.  Dazzling effects, incredible camera angles and slow motion shots depict these renegades as they learn how to alter the physical parameters of the world around us.  A killer soundtrack compliments the stunning visuals of this high energy techno thriller.

Review title: My favorite sci-fi film of all time.
Review_body: This movie suprised me.  I was shocked to really fall in love with this movie.  This has become my favorite sci-fi film of current time.  I just really got attached to the film.  I thought the character interaction was really great.  This was the first film I have ever saw at the theater more than once.  I understand that Keenu Reeves is not the best actor but he was pretty good in the film.  They maybe could have picked someone better but I really think he fit in just right.  I really liked Lawrence as Morpheus. I have never heard of him until this film.  He was great with his acting. He is one who mostly carried the film.  Carrie as Trinity was also very impressive.  She did a wonderful job.  This movie not only had great special effects but a wonderful plot.  It was a good idea it makes you think that this could really happen.  I have seen Bound another Wachowski brother's film and loved it too.  These directors are beginning to be some of my all time favorites.  I am very anxious for a sequel but hope they will not screw it up as other sequels ruin the franchise like Batman & Robin.

Review title: It is the best movie of the year I have seen
Review_body: I think that movie will be a revolution in the movie market. It is a revolutionary idea and very interesting.I recommend not to forget to see it!.

You must see The Matrix if you enjoy movies.  It's a very creative vision that provides the viewer with a unique worldview as well as sensory stimulation. Some people don't like the movie, but there is no need to dwell on individual things that you wouldn't like.  As a whole the movie is just plain exciting!  Even if you don't like Keanu, just picture someone else playing his role.  Unique twists, intentionally vague concepts and creative writing backup the awesome special effects.  The soundtrack rocks, too. Although I would have preferred a little less Metal and a little more variance.

Review title: Somewhat flawed scientifically, but intriguing ideas
Review_body: "Matrix" was definitely thought-provoking.  I've been a hard-core science fiction fan since I was in my early teens, and am always glad to see a film which draws on some of the more complex ideas of the written genre, as opposed to stereotypical space operas.I did find a few faults with the underlying rationale for the AI exploitation of the human race, however.  Supposedly the machines had been almost entirely reliant on solar power (which I found a dubious premise to begin with), and then we're told that the perpetual smog has blocked out that power source, necessitating using people as living electrical generators/batteries.  The problem with that idea is that a human being (and indeed any form of biological life) requires energy input, and where are all those calories coming from?  There was mention of recycling the dead people and feeding them to the live ones, but even assuming 100% energy recapture efficiency (a practical impossibility), no more can be gotten out of the people than is being put in, and the machines' use of that power represents an external drain on the biological system.  Also, I'm afraid it's absurd to postulate (as the movie did) that Earth's interior could cool significantly over the course of a couple of hundred years in the absence of sunlight -- it would probably take closer to a couple of billion years.  After all, it's almost as hot down below nowadays as it was a couple of billion years ago, and the slow rate of heat loss by radiation into space has had a lot more to do with that than the influx of sunlight.These flaws didn't ruin the movie for me, because I could think of at least one better reason for the machines to be exploiting the human race in an even more horrific fashion.  For instance, the human brain is a much better computer in some ways than anything we're ever likely to build, and I can see how a new breed of artificial intelligences might want to use that processing power for its own purposes.  And since very little of our brain capacity is directly involved in conscious thought, I can see how the AIs might be content to use only the unconscious parts, or possibly every conscious effort by a human in the virtual world could actually be a processing activity for the benefit of the machines in a disguised, symbolic form.  Thus, rather than providing us with a virtual reality merely to keep us biologically functional, the VR could be part of the exploitation itself.For whatever purpose it might be done, the images of people being raised from birth obliviously socketed in endless hardware arrays will be with me for a long time.Of all the ideas presented in the movie, the one I found most intriguing in an intellectual sense was that even if we could be presented with a perfect, utopian virtual reality, our brains would reject it because the element of struggle against adversity would be missing.  And I wonder how at the end, the movie's hero could ever be sure that all his trials and seeming successes within the virtual world, and even the supposedly real external world, hadn't merely taken place in an even larger virtual reality.  How could he ever know that his "real" body wasn't still plugged in somewhere? For that matter, how can any of us ever know that ours aren't?  Descartes, who mused several hundred years ago about the dilemma of a person trapped by an "evil genius" in an imaginary world indistinguishable from a real one, would've appreciated "Matrix," I'm sure.

This movie is great, from the opening scene to the ending where he flies above the city. My favorite scene is the fight between Neo and Agent Smith on the roof of the building. In short, this movie is really cool.

The Matrix is visually stunning.  The special effects just blew me away. This movie really made me think about similar movies, such as Dark City, The Crow, even Batman.  I love this style of movie, and wish more would be made like it.  Although I'm not a big Keanu Reeves fan, he sort of pulls it off in this movie.  The story, although slightly confusing at first, really came together, even though the ending came a little too quick and left me sitting there waiting for a more complete finish.  I would love to see a sequel because I am interested in how this story would turn out...and they could do just about anything because it is, of course, set in the future.  All in all, a great movie.

This is one of the most entertaining movies I´ve seen this year. It´s visually stunning and and the martial arts direction by Woo-Ping Yuen are amazing. All in all a great movie everybody should check out.

Review title: A Hong Kong, Japanimation, Comic Book Acton flick
Review_body: This movie Takes the best of Hong Kong action films, Comic Book artwork and Japanese animation and bank rolls it w/ American special effects to make a killer sci-fi movie....give me more!!

Review title: maybe we are in a matrix after all!
Review_body: I went to see this movie with my two kids (13,10) and three other grown ups, we had a great time! The audience was mostly mature and we surely laugh a lot. The following week my kids asked if we could see it again, so we went, seeing the movie for the second time made me realise the hidden subtleties; this time it was a very young audience at the theatre and they did not laugh much, for them it seems to be a more serious affair. To observe this was very interesting.What I like about the movie apart from the cast and the effects is the fact that the heroes look like everyday people, there is no glamour in them, they are good looking people, but normal; their clothes aren't very good, the buildings where they do their dealings don't look like mansions. I like the fact that the top guy is a black man, and that the tough guy is a girl, and that the hero is a bit dumb, and that the main computer/driver/operator looks very Latino!In general I don't like violent movies, with lots of guns and stuff like that; however, this movie blows the usage of those artifacts to such a level that cannot be viewed seriously.The story line reminds me of Teachings of Don Juan and all those books (Carlos Castaneda), which made me like the movie even more.Where is everything? And if everything is there where is there? And apparently through quantum physics we are becoming more aware of NOTHING and the POWER of NOTHINGNESS, and the more we look into tiny matter the more this matter seems to not be there, maybe we are in a matrix after all!

The Matrix has to be one of the best films I have seen for a long time. It is the first film that I have bothered to go and see at the cinema for a long time. It is not just the stunning visual effects, but the casting, the acting, the directing, everything was spot on. The music also fit in as if it had been made just for the film. The Wachowski Brothers should be next on the list for a knighthood.

Review title: One of the best movies out there.
Review_body: One thing I've noticed is that people either love or hate this movie intensely.  I fall into the former category.What is there to hate about this movie?  Nothing save for the acting on some parts (you know who.  He's taken flak in every review).The story:  InnovativeThe plot:  Very well executed, but the ending seems rushed.The effects:  Absolutely bitchin'!  They will blow you away!  This the first true "how did they do that" movie since Terminator 2.This may be pre-emptive, but look for this movie to be the big one of 1999.

So I must say I was shocked. I don't think I am too much of an easy guy to impress. I usually am very critical about movies, I've read a bunch of SciFi novels (from Asimov to Gibson through P.K.Dick ...). But this movie got me really shocked. At the end of it I had to stay sit for a while and thing about it, and most probably I'll go back to see it in the next days. I don't want to say the film is perfect, no way (anyway what does perfect means) but it's very well done, it's a great synthesis of both sci-fi state of the art, movie special effects, and oneiric view of reality. Well acted (no doubt about Keanu and Fishburne). So that's all. Maybe after I've seen it another time I will post some more.

Okay, most movies with Keanu have to provide a limited acting spectrum for the guy, from the Bill and Ted light brain to the edge of enlightenment in Little Bhudda. This movie set him up just right, and used that presence that always comes across as "Uh, gee, could someone tell me what's going on around here?", and made it work in a big way!The Matrix made it's next perfect move by coming out BEFORE the Star Wars prequel, which according to some friends who saw the sneak peak, isn't all that wonderful. No matter how good or bad SWs is, The Matrix would've lost a lot of steam following it and The Mummy. As it is, now, I'm fully willing to go to the theater and take advantage of the long lines piling up behind those two theaters in order to squeeze through and put my bucks into seeing The Matrix a second time, something I haven't done since '77 for the original Star Wars film.If you've not seen it, DO IT! The Matrix is the perfect Sci-Fi/Dream-Reality movie. It's what almost any Movie or Sci-Fi fan would put together if they had the money, the time, and knew an actor who's strongest point will always be looking totally lost, even if he's read the script and should know what's happening ;-)

I'm appalled to see that this movie has such a high rating! I saw this movie a few weeks ago and I'm STILL confused. Possibly one of the most unbelievable and stupid movies of our time. The whole plot was beyond comprehension and not very well organized to say the least. The only way to tell what world they were in was Keanu's hair. Yeah, that's creative. I would rather eat nails than see this horrid excuse for a movie again.

What a thrill ride!Like a Playstation game on amphetamine, a science-fiction fashion shoot, and a 101 Philosophy lesson at MIT.Keanu is Neo - the hacker.  He's a much more believable hero - average, not clever, not sure of himself, but determined and honest.Strong and appropriately tight-lipped supporting cast, but what really shines are the effects.  Originally, throbbing and left-field - this stuff could only have come out of the minds of the Southern Hemisphere. Hollywood heads are bone-dry.Stupid dialogue, but who needs it - this is the real world, where people ain't clever but they care.  Cool concept portrayed with fun, flair and style.Stomping!

Review title: This is a great example of why movies were invented
Review_body: This is one of those films that break the mold and define a new school of film making. Think "2001", "Star Wars", "Blade Runner", "Alien". The story is pretty familiar to most SF aficionados but we'll be seeing this style of film making well into the next decade.The story, though recycled, has a very savy post 90's spin to it that makes it entertaining as hell to most computer cognisati. Among other things it rationalizes deja vu as an online program change and reveals the darker side of intelligent "agents". Though it seems to have been dipped once too often in the Zen reflecting pool and been filtered through the crash course of "The Hero with a Thousand Faces" the story is still entertaining as well as worth listening to.So in synopsis, a really cool story with some of the finest film making art to come down the pike in a long stretch.

Review title: What an awesome perspective on life...
Review_body: The Matrix was an excellent movie that provided an alternative perspective on life and how we, as humans, observe it.  It really makes you think about the insignificance of the individual in comparison to the accomplishments of the world, the world & it's people, and what technology is bringing us closer to.

Review title: This movie made me stay up all night
Review_body: For the first time in years, a movie made me sleepless the entire night. The matrix. I know, it's just a film... or do I?

Review title: Boring, predictable movie which I walked out of
Review_body: I found this movie too boring and predictable. The plot dragged and I don't think developed enough.I didn't find the special effects that great (I was forced to see it a second time to catch the end - but I didn't pay) and I believe that all these effects have been done before in a more convincing way with better timing. The effects (which _IS the movie) were very few and far between and the characters not developed a great deal to their potential.... I must say when neo was being towed by the helicopter, that looked very cheap indeed!The slow motion looked very familiar - lock stock and two smoking barrels band waggon! and the story (as I said) predictable and unconvincing!

Review title: brilliant with personal warning message to everyone...
Review_body: Take a very big pot, add in 2 litres of new (I mean really new!!!) idea, a couple of good actors, excellent camera - cook it  on very very good storyline, add amazing SFX (they are amazing when You can't tell the difference between real and not real - and by the way this is actually the point of the movie /the difference not the SFX...) and when is just about ready add a spicy alert message and You got a delicious soup I and You've been waiting so so long... The "Agent Smith" description of our "human" species is god damn true!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!Eat when is still hot - If You wait a second it's all gone...

Review title: ok but shame about the dialogue ...
Review_body: The Matrix is a 'good' action / sci-fi thriller though it is let down by the psuedo-philosophical-self-important script with laughable self agrandising and dignifying comments - 'nobody can know the path you have to ...' & 'you are the one'. I had the feeling a boy had read some philosophy primer and decided to make some actors reel off this funny script. It was so silly after a while and spoiled an excellent action movie - stick to action talk!

I thought that this movie was SUPER!Why? Well, first of all, Keanu Reeves is HOT!!! :) I'm not kidding, he's a TOTAL babe! Plus, a super actor. Laurence Fishburne and Carrie-Anne Moss are great too, and did a brillant job of making their characters interesting and appealing.But, aside of that, the most important thing is that there was a PLOT. And we're not just talking about any old piece of junk, the plot was GOOD.Why do I find this amazing, you ask? Well, in most of the action movies I've seen, the plot, if there WAS one, sucked (to put it VERY bluntly).Now, perhaps I'm being a bit demanding here, but I like movies to have good plots. That way you can really get INTO the story.The best movies are the ones in which you feel as though you are THERE, with the characters, experiencing all that's happening. The Matrix did all this, and managed to have TONS of action and mind-numbing graphics too.I was amazed that it was possible to cram all this into one movie. It was SUPER!So, putting together the good plot, loads of action, super graphics, and an AMAZING cast (and I'm taklking about the WHOLE cast here, not just Keanu :) I think we've got a winner!

OH MY GOD! Could there be a cooler film ever made in the entirety of this solar system. This film is 'da bomb'! Nothing could ever beat this film.How mind expanding, how thrilling. (anyway enough about me)This film was not only effective in its delivery of the story line but extremely tension and suspense creating in its camera shots. Technically this film was superb. The action shots were as clear as crystal. You know that sometimes, actually quite frequently in action films, the camera is always cutting the actor out of the frame slightly as the camera is trying to keep up with the actor? It didn't happen at all in this film. I would love to know how this flawless effect was achieved, so that i could interpret this effect into my film.I was very surprised to see Keanu Reeves again, i thought that the moment he said that he wanted to devote his time, no longer to film, but to his band Dogstar i gave up all hope of seeing him on the big screen again.Well that's what i think of the film 'The Matrix' forgive the childishness of my language, but i feel very strongly about this film.It brings up the question, "What if this is actually the 'reality' that we are missing and maybe some of us will wake up in embryonic casings?'Thanks for reading - i'm a very lonely soul as you can tell.

Review title: Comic Book action on the Big Screen
Review_body: This movie was a total surprise for me and my friends.  Being comic book fans we noticed immediately that the plot and action were written in a mature adaptation of the comic book genre.  We were very pleased with the overall plot layout and premise as well as the extraordinary visuals and effects.  One of the best movies i have ever seen.

This film has everything. Special effect, action, everything and the film has a thing controlling about the facts of real life. For me It's the best film of 1999. Star wars is good, but this is.........WOW beyond.

Review title: A great movie,cool effects,nice dresses and a lot more
Review_body: The Matrix, It's a reality but not real.This is one of my favorites because it got everything,Cool effects,Great actors .If you hadn't seen it yet, go to the nearest theater and it will be worth it.(I think I want to go in the Matrix just to know what it feels like being someone who has the power to do everything at will)

Review title: The absolute best file I have seen in years
Review_body: I liked just about everything about this film, it was beautifully paced and the plot unfolded in a really graceful manner. the action was good and the fight scenes excellent. It is intelligently written and really well made.

Review title: Very intelligently done. It gets you from beginning to the end!
Review_body: It could be a bit confusing sometimes, but once you figure it out, it's pure fun. Even if you don't understand the plot, it's still fun! A plot, which by the way, is wonderfully created. What a great story that is! The movie is full of special efects and action, there's no way you can go wrong on this one! It has a good cast and the directors... no comments! It's also worthwhile checking out "The Bond" thriller from the two brothers directors.

Review title: The magic world of visual effects !!!
Review_body: When i first looked at the campaign of this movie , i thought it was just another one that spend a lot of money to impress the public. But after a few opinions from my close friends i also temptated to see the movie.The beginning nail me down ! I wasn't expecting the adventure to begin so soon. Carrie-Anne Moss (Trinity) fitted in her role exactly. The roof chasing and the quality of the effects with a very good sound dressing , made this and all the actions scenes very realistic. At first i had the impression that we were in video game. Soon i realize the magic touch of the special effect team work. It was outstanding!!! Everything seemed so real, you could believe you were playing a part in this play. Laurence Fishburne (Morpheus) was imposing.He gives you the sense of safety and thrill at the same time.By far he was the key character of the movie. Keanu Reeves (Thomas A. Anderson/Neo)saw us for another time how promising actor can be ( that cold look in his eyes !). The Wachowski's gave us a new idea of the world to be (machines gathering energy from the people...).They saw us something new and possible to happen. Who knows... All the above points to one thing only: DON'T MISS THAT MOVIE, YOU WILL REGRET IT FOR YOUR REST OF YOUR LIFE.

". . . the unconscious, the matrix of dreams, has an independent function." -- C.G. Jung. We could comfortably answer the question, "What is the Matrix?" by saying, "The Matrix is the unconscious."  Several times in his book, Dreams, Carl Jung refers to the unconscious as the matrix or the birthplace of dreams. The movie "The Matrix" is actually about Jung's idea of the collective unconscious, and there are many references to dreams in the movie which correlate directly with Jung's written material.Sigmund Freud said that the unconscious is a storehouse filled with repressed desires and fears, and that our unconscious dictates our behavior in ways of which we are unaware. However, Jung believed that, not only do we each have a personal unconscious, but we share in a collective unconscious, which is an ocean of cross-cultural archetypes (snakes, mother, Judas). He states that when we dream, our unconscious uses symbols both from everyday life and the archetypes to give us information about ourselves and our situations.  According to Jung, we must learn this symbolic language of dreams in order to decipher their meanings.When Morpheus offers Neo a choice between two pills, he holds one in each hand. The left side has, for thousands of years, symbolized evil while the right represented good.  Jung believed something different, he says that ".leftward movement is equivalent to a movement in the direction of the unconscious, whereas a movement to the right is 'correct' and aims at consciousness."  He declares that the collective unconscious "lies at a deeper level and is further removed from the conscious than the personal unconscious."It is not a coincidence that Morpheus holds the blue pill in his left hand and the red pill in his right hand. He tells Neo, "You take the blue pill and the story ends. You wake in your bed and you believe whatever you want to believe."  What he is stating is, "Take the left path and you will remain ignorant of the unconscious and its contents." Then he explains that if Neo takes the red pill, he will stay in wonderland and be shown how "deep the rabbit hole goes." He actually means that if Neo follows the "right" path, he will become aware of his own personal unconscious as well as the deeper collective (rabbit hole).

The first time I saw The Matrix, on opening night, I entered the theater with no expectations.  I had seen its commercial during the Superbowl, and all I knew was that it starred Keanu Reeves and some really cool-looking effects.  Even though the people behind me were having a loud, in-depth conversation, it didn't bother me.  I thought, "I came here to watch some cool effects, not listen to the story."  I was not disappointed.  I was so dazzled by the look of the movie, that I didn't even notice that it actually had a story.  I came home and told my friends, "Sure, it has no plot, but it's definitely worth seeing."  I was unenlightened.Over the next few days, my husband kept bringing up ideas that were explored in the movie, biblical, literary, and cinematic references, etc, and I realized that I needed to see it again.  The second time, I experienced it, rather than just watched it.  I was enthralled.  Now I feel compelled to see it again about once a week, saying, "I've got to see it one more time before it leaves the theaters for good!"  I'm up to 4 viewings now, seeing something new every time.

Review title: A SciFi/Action Thriller. GREAT visuals, effects & choreography!
Review_body: This is one good movie! From the beginning the visuals and effects amaze you, and the story and choreography makes it all even better! When the action starts, you just can't move your eyes away from the screen!

Review title: I know what the Matrix is...
Review_body: When I learned about "The Matrix" and first saw the trailer I was very suspicious and didn't know what to expect of the movie. I mean, I love Keanu Reeves but he screwed up more than one movie (including his other Cyberpunk-Thriller "Johnny Mnemonic"). I also saw "Assassins" and "Bound" by the Wachowski Brothers ("Bound" is a strange movie - while watching it I changed my mind few times - Do I like it or not?). In the end I wasn't sure if they could do this. But now I know... "The Matrix" is definitely the best Cyberpunk-Movie so far and for me one of the best Sci-Fi & Overall movies of all time. For a reallive-movie it also comes closest to an japanese Manga comic as possible. I really loves the Bullet-Time-Scenes. So now I know what the Matrix is - but how can one destroy it? Let's hope for a sequel...

Review title: The Best Sci-Fi Action Kung-Fu Philosophical Allegory Out There (And It Stars Keanu Reeves (!))
Review_body: In Hollywood, you get used to a certain way of things - the serious, critic-dependent movies are the ones that will make you think about key issues of our lives, while the shoot-em-up action flicks are supposedly there only for our entertainment.  This flick is the rarest of all birds - a movie that combines revolutionary special effects and the most incredible action sequences ever shot on film, with a strong plot about humanity's dependence on machines becoming reversed, the nature of reality, and the need for rebellion.The Matrix's strength above all is its refusal to talk down to its audience - it assumes you know a little about technology and/or philosophy before you walk in the door.  It is the thinking man's action movie - one that pulls you into a world remarkably like our own, then peels it back, layer after layer, showing you the world of the Matrix.The special effects are fantastic, both in their execution and their restraint - they are used only to undercut the intensity of one scene, or to showcase the otherworldly nature of the three main stars.Speaking of which, the stars of the show do their jobs exceedingly well. Laurence Fishburne plays the role of Morpheus with a type of detached calm, as one would expect from someone whom knows that what they see isn't real. Carrie-Anne Moss is the heart of the movie as Trinity, Morpheus's right-hand woman and a martial arts powerhouse to boot.  Hugo Weaving as Agent Smith does a perfect job as the villain - you hate him completly by the end of the movie, but love him for being so evil.  And questions about Keanu Reeve's worth as any kind of star are put to rest - he seems born to play the role of Neo, a man whom loses everything he ever had, and must relearn everything he's ever known.The Matrix is a movie I wouldn't hesitate to recommend to anyone.  It's a movie anyone can grasp, even if they only appreciate the action sequences, which don't seem shot on film so much as they seem painted (possibly due to the storyboards, which were drafted by comic book professionals - a trend I hope will continue.)  And for those who look deeper, there's a wealth of subtle shading to the story, which fleshes it out - and rewards repeat viewing by hiding many subtle details that you'd miss on the first go-around.  It's the type of movie that restores your faith in movies - that yes, you can combine great action with a great story, and that yes, you don't need to have name directors or actors to make it all fly.

See this movie and wonder if it's real.  Is our world real or a dream? Look at the sky and wonder, "Is that blue?  Or is what I consider to be blue seen by someone else as red?  How would I know if they refer to my red as blue?". See the movie and they're the sorts of things you begin to wonder.  You may not know what existentialism is, but you'll be thinking existentially.Religious reality?  See "The Matrix" and draw the parallels between Neo and the Buddha, or Neo and Jesus Christ.  "You are my saviour", says one character in the film.Andy and Larry Wachowski will make you think with this intriguing science "fiction" movie and mix it up perfectly with some of the most mind-shattering action sequences computer animation will as yet allow. The slowest slow-motion; the most fascinating movie.

This is what a movie is meant to be, intelligent, driven, action-packed, but not cheesy and over done.  Perfect combination of suspended disbelief and realistic philosophy.  Just when your brain is about to explode from trying to completely grasp the concept, a helicopter crashes into a building and there is fire and death and chaos.  This movie is a "10" in everything from Screenplay to Special Effects to Kung Fu-ism.  A definite box-office must see.

Review title: It's going to be the "Blade Runner" of the 'nineties
Review_body: A superb movie. I don't think it's going to be the new Star Wars, for its impact on the sci-fi scene, but for sure we have the new "Blade Runner".A truly cyberpunk flick, maybe the only one worth of note, along with Salvatores' "Nirvana", and easily the best. A contamination of western visions and Jon Woo filming techniques, it will mark the road for future productions.

Review title: Does it really get any better than this?
Review_body: Would you take the red pill or the blue pill? Such a question of unknown life-changing capability has changed the lives, or the views of their lives of many individuals.A film with such mind-blowing power and complete and utter sense of rocking your every day normal lives needs a lot of explaining, so get this: What if our every day normal lives were really just a dream, and we are used as mere battery packs for the machine world. What if we were stored in gloop-filled incubators with long tubes down our heads? What if. that was the real world (whoa! as Keanu neatly puts it).Such an inventive masterpiece would have to come from the Australian's Wachowski Brothers (Andy and Larry), who co-wrote the screenplay for 'Assassins' in '95 and are responsible for nearly everything on 'The Matrix'. Not often does everything fit in, with an excellent cast and crew. Keanu Reeves' acting skills goes from wooden to quite flexible! Laurence Fishburne certainly proves he's still got it, and Carrie-Anne Moss plays a vital, convincing role as a leather-wearing cyber-space assistant.Thomas 'Neo' Anderson (Keanu Reeves), exec by day, hacker by night, gets contacted by a mysterious Morpheous (Laurence Fishburne) who wants to meet.One red tablet later, and he is in a dark, nuclear-filled sky planet, filled with E.M.P. scared creatures and unbelievable special effects.That's when the fascinating Chinese art of 'flo-mo' (when the camera freezes and spins around) kicks in. But that's not all they have to worry about. Agent Smith (fellow oz, Hugo Weaver) and other agents have the same ability as Neo and the gang and are very hostile.Add a million special effects, each superb and original in it's own way, excellent acting from the whole cast (especially Reeves and Fishburne), and definite room for a sequel or even a prequel.

Review title: Your mind is in for a rollacoaster ride. Watch out Star Wars!
Review_body: Over here in little old England, something of a storm is brewing. The streets have seemed strangely deserted of late, and people have a eerie expectancy about them. No, it's not 'That Film' (Star Wars Episode I doesn't come out over here until July 1999) - in fact, most people are watching the Matrix, which could be the biggest surprise smash of the year. Already proven its worth in the US box office, it had got myself and a few friends whipped up into something of a sci-fi frenzy with trailers spouting unprecedented camerawork and visual effects. We managed to get ourselves into a preview showing a day before the opening weekend. It cost a little more, but, oh boy. Was it worth it.The Matrix stars Keanu Reeves as Neo, a small-time software programmer by day, and a solitary computer-cracking software pirate by night. Apart from the occasional nightmare, nothing troubles Neo until a strange encounter with a woman (Trinity), and a nasty run-in with FBI-style agents force him to start asking questions - are his dreams real? Who is Morpheus? And just what is the Matrix? Confused yet? More I cannot say (you find out about 30 minutes in), except this: if this film is a rollacoaster, this far is the gentle climb up the first ramp to the top. Get ready for a whirlwind ride.Many people will go to see this film because of the gun-toting, spine-tingling effects shots. The camerawork is ground-breaking and un-surpassed. The 'Flo-mo' technology, used for clever spinning slow-motion shots, is surely set to be a regular feature on our movie screens due to the huge fat atmosphere it gives to stunts and explosion scenes. Others will love the superb kung-fu action scenes, practiced for months by the cast with a technique known as 'wire-fighting'. These scenes (I am assured by my Tae-Kwon-Do toting friend) are all genuinely performed and accurate to the art. Others will love the potent plot which, while admittedly recycled from hard-core sci-fi, is given a firm twist of freshness and is guaranteed to turn your head inside out at least twice during the film.For myself, I simply loved The Matrix because, well, it was so darn cool. From the the fantastic camera work and the impeccable fashion sense to the fresh, exciting plot, it looks set to be at least as popular over in the UK as it proved to be in the US. The faults were few and far between - an awkward romance and some slightly wooden "Keanu moments" being the only ones I can remember.But the minor niggles don't begin to mar the quality of the film. I came out of the theatre feeling at least a half foot taller for knowing something just about no-one else did - what the Matrix actually was. But, in the words of Morpheus: "Unfortunately, no-one can be told what the Matrix actually is. You have to see it for yourself."

Damn, I just hate the "The Matrix"! The only good visual effects are already shown in the trailer. The remaining 2 hours really aren't worth seeing. Boring, pseudo-intellectual dialogues, the worst computer effects since "Blade" and an ending, which only could get a laughter out of me!

If you ever wanted to know, what Zen, Chan, Tao, Dau or however you call it wants us to know, watch The Matrix. This film is pure Zen. - Don't try to understand this. It's as it is.For me, The Matrix is the Film of the decade. Maybe the last real great masterpiece of art built in this millennium. I've been waiting so long for this film .. since I've seen Blade Runner when it came into the theatres for the first time (o.k., Luc Beson's Leon helped me a lot while waiting..)

For whoever put together the trailer - good job. It showed enough to intrigue while revealing little.To everyone involved in the creation of this film - thank you. Thank you for not aiming for the "lowest common denominator" audience. I have rarely been this impressed with the art of movie-making.To Mr. Reeves, kudos for a strong performance. NEO's quiet depression (near suicidal, I thought) in the early scenes are affective without being obvious. The subtle nuances are fascinating - during NEO's boss' lecture (one can see suspicion of his surroundings even then) and also when being interrogated by the AGENTS. Particularly satisfying is the reaction to being exposed to a horrific reality, and the wondrous serenity at the moment when NEO finally, truly, believes. As for the physical training, it paid off; the fight sequences look fabulous.I wanted entertainment - I got it in a big way.

Review title: But for Episode 1 this would be the film of 1999
Review_body: Excellent Sci-fi for the thinking man (or woman). A good story with decent characterisation, Keanu Reeves best role for some time. Good supporting cast in particular the Men in Black lookalikes.Very atmospheric with good use of dark and light, reminded me of the pilot of Max Headroom.The effects need to be seen to be believed, but they do not steal the show like so many other films. The story can be a bit difficult to follow but perseverance is rewarded in the end.At 130+ mins it is a long film, be sure to visit a comfortable venue, but a good pace on the action and story telling holds the viewer from start to finish.10 out of 10 for an original slant on the "computers take over the world" theme.Will there be a sequel.......... I hope so.

Review title: A good slice of the cherry-pie of entertainment...
Review_body: A very enjoyable feast for the eyes, and to a lesser extent, the old grey matter...Reeves is as strong as he'll ever be in a role, but is supported very well by everyone else, including Fishburne and Weaving.The effects are stunning, all nicely wrapped up in a good story.Could have been better, but could have been a lot worse!

Review title: A Fun Film, but certainly not top 250
Review_body: Matrix was a fun film with lots of cool action.  The premise of the film - a variation on Pascal's Methodological Solipsism - was interesting, if one didn't look at the details too closely.The film's premise that the machines needed to keep human beings around to generate heat was simply ludicrous.Terminator One also dealt with man vs. machine and did so much more credibly.Still, despite the shaky premises upon which it was based it was still worth seeing on the big screen.

Review title: A light at the end of the tunnel ...
Review_body: ... finally a great SF movie, which can offer Special Effects AND a good story: In the tradition of Lem and Dick - and even a bit of "Dune". Go and watch it ...

Review title: Get into a new concept of the world
