Review_body: When you first see The Matrix, you find yourself in front of whole new concept of the world. You realize that maybe things are not the way they appear to you, but they can be part of someone's else dream, for example.This vision of reality, in addition to great action scenes and comic-like costumes, scenography, dialogues and shots makes this movie one of the greatest in its genre.

Review title: I think it's a great film, and a great concept.
Review_body: This is a movie that does contain some religious allegory, but it is not overt, and I don't feel that it intrudes on my own beliefs.  The basic idea of humans forced into an inhuman existence by their own creations is not a new one. (remember Terminator?)  Matrix just puts a more creative slant on the idea.  What makes this movie work for me is the basic idea that human beings can still triumph against inhuman/machine creations despite overwhelming odds and a deceptive reality.  The main character is young, handsome, and intelligent. This introduces an element of romance into the story, and that makes it even more exciting. I like the fact that he is willing to be a part of a team, even though he obviously is "The One" . Also, the comic book aspect of the movie enables you to suspend reality and emerse yourself in the story.  Lastly, I like the technical slant.  The idea of someone being able to manipulate a program with their mind is irresistible!

Review title: The sci-fi/thriller 'Big Brother paranoia' theme as visual ballet
Review_body: A visually stunning romp around a virtual reality 1999 juxtaposed into a post-apocalyptic 23C controlled by artificial intelligence and their 'agents' and machines.Not an original story and one that is traditionally hard to maintain a sufficient suspension of disbelief but in The Matrix it is superbly done by letting you hover on the edge of surrealism before smacking you in the eyes with superb special effects.One of the most appealing things to me was the virtual wardrobes!

Review title: Excellent sci-fi kung fu action movie
Review_body: brilliant acting by Hugo Weaving - very stylish - very artistic - cool kung fu moves - subtext is sound, ie philosophy of reality, neurology - cool sunglasses - nice wardrobe

10 out of 10. I've seen it four times. I'm buying it on DVD. Amazing. I loved it. As a hard SF reader, I'll admit that the story is neither truly original or mindblasting, but it hardly matters. It does make you think. A little. But most of all - it's pure visual pleasure. Keanu Reeves looks GREAT. In that wonderful black outfit of his, mmm, drooling garanteed. The fact that he doesn't make the most convincing hacker ever doesn't matter much AT ALL. And the special effects - wow. Trinity flying through the air, looking very, very cool. And the kungfu. Okay, Keanu does some stuff that would have sent you rolling on the floor if he didn't look so good, but on the whole, I thought the martial arts were great. And there's guns. Really cool people firing really big guns. Cool music, too. Go see it. Maybe not four times (like me!) but at least once.
__plot: very interesting and original __actors: simply the best __characters: fantastic __characters' sun glasses: fantastic++ __special effects: in two hours I' ve never closed my eyes

I just have to say that the special effects in this film are incredible. The one thing that made this film so cool is that they took slow motion to the extreme and you saw bullets flying throught the air, but the camera still seemed to move or rotate around the subject at a regular speed.  They did this with not one, but many dozens of cameras.  Because each frame was from a stationary camera, there was no blurring.  Anyway, if you haven't seen this film then rent it when it comes out, but you really had to have seen it widescreen, in a theater, to get the whole heartpounding effect.  As for the people who didn't like it...

At last an original idea.Did you ever imagine that we would see the likes of this from Hollywood? A clever, witty, ORIGINAL script.Yes the effects are dazzling, yes it is a VERY cool film (go and buy the long coats and sunglasses now!), but overall this is just a damn clever film. It never takes itself too seriously, and twists and turns unexpectedly, haven't had so much fun since the Usual Suspects or...ohhh.... Vertigo?All the characters are wonderfully underplayed (whether on purpose or not), the visual effects will astound, the plot will turn your brain inside out, and the script will have you thinking for weeks...Destined to be placed high in future Top 100s lists, see this film in the cinema while you can. Whether you are an effects fan, you appreciate a well written storyline, or want to ponder the giddy heights of Zen philosophy, use which ever guise you wish to see this film, but DO see it.

Ok, maybe the argument is weak... The possibilities of a world in suspension, can be more than the story tell us...But the sequence of images, the "flow" between one scene and other, the visual possibility of be there, like an omnipotent witness, who can´t stop the time and accelerates it it´s, for me, the best of this motion picture...The great mix of images, music and performances give us great action scenes (maybe not the better ones in the history, but...) that make you ask... "Real... What is real, Neo????"Control of the reality... the dream of all human been.. This picture give the impression to be the push of a new generation of "virtual" dreamers (hackers)... They believe in freedom beyond the system... This motion picture, will be the emblematic of them... A colt has born!!!!!

Review title: My oh my... That WAS a good one!!! Morpheus.. I'm ready!
Review_body: Okay..  Let's see..  First time I've tried to write anything like this..The Matrix.. "what is the Matrix?" In the movie, the answer given is along the lines of: "No one can be TOLD what the matrix is..  It has to be seen for yourself.."  Well..  its about as true IN the movie, as about it. It's a brilliant story about a man awakening into a world much different from, yet still the same as, what he is used to... It's a movie with Special F/X to make your mind bulge... It's a nightmare neatly wrapped up in a dream...What can I say? - Morpheus! I'm ready! Hit me with that jellybean of yours!!

Review title: A movie for people who love to read sci-fi....
Review_body: The beauty of sci-fi is in the details....When writing, an author has fairly limitless license to fire the reader's imagination with such amplification. A movie has not such luxury. There are time contstraints, dangers of trying to do too much. The writers of 'The Matrix' do an outstanding job of tantalizing the imagination without burdening it with superfluous information. The visual effects are unparalleled in anything I've seen recently (sorry George--there was simply too much to see in TPM), and the presence of humor rounded out this film's combustibility. In addition, the blending of drag-down, knockout, kung-foo commando is very well-done. My one reservation (and the reason why I only gave the film a 9) is the non-conformity of the romance. It was gauche and heavy-handed.  The writers didn't need to dumb things down so much for the viewer. There were several intimations of what the Oracle had told Trinity, and they could have left things less implicit in the end...But in a movie where everything else is done so well, why complain? When all is said and done, I'd equate 'The Matrix' to the 'Ender's Game' of sci-fi novels.

Review title: Keanu Reeves doesn't completely ruin the movie.
Review_body: There have been, in the past, films from the science fiction genre that were brilliant & innovative, i.e. 2001 or Blade Runner. The Matrix, however, is more of an action flick than anything else.While it starts with an interesting storyline premise, the story and character development start to disappear about 30 minutes into the movie in favor of the more visually-appealing action scenes. While the eye candy is technically very well done, the actual content of the film slides into the background and eventually fades completely from sight. The one exception to this is Keanu Reeves' glaringly bad portrayal of the hero. His one-liner delivery and annoying poses made me groan in disgust several times. I would think that by now American audiences would have shunned him like the no-talent hack he is. Other performances range from pretty good (Hugo Weaving) to so-so (Carrie-Anne Moss) generally, but Laurence Fishburne's respectable ability is squandered in a role that is not worthy of him.In summary, if you like eye candy -and even I sometimes do- you may be able to enjoy The Matrix, if you completely ignore the main character. But if you're a sci-fi fan waiting for an intelligent, watchable film, you will just have to keep waiting.

I found this movie intriguing from the start.  Spectacular effects, especially in fight scenes, and outstanding story line that kept me thinking about conversations I had in college about "one consciousness".  Not a ten due to the over the top harvesting footage and I still find myself waiting for an "Excellent" to be uttered by Reeves.

The first hour was pretty good. But then the next hour, it got a bit too complicated and a bit boring. BUT, the last 45 minutes or something, was great! There was one shooting scene, which was the most awesome scene I have ever seen. Those two minutes was almost worth the ticket alone! If you like action great special effects, you have to see this movie.

Review title: The Matrix is an un-stoppable roller-coaster ride from start to finish; full of twists, revelations and amazing action sequences.
Review_body: I have not been able to say this about a film for a long time, but The Matrix (1999) is a wonderful film.  From the first frame of film to the last scene where Reeves flies upwards into the sky you will find your self hooked.Every minute seems to bring a new revelation as Neo (Reeves) is plunged head-first (literally at one point) into the real world.  Other reviewers have compared The Matrix with Alice in Wonderland, and this analogy couldn't be more true.  Reeves plays the Alice charactor admirably well; as he discovers, in the most stylish way possible, that the world is not all it seems and that mankind is nothing more than a living battery to power our future computer controlled nemesis.The scary thing is that this could all be true.  The world as we know it could be nothing more than an illusion to keep us under control.  An excellent supporting cast of Carrie-Anne Moss and Laurence Fishburne help make the illusion seem real.  All in all a fantastic movie, the highlight of the year.

The Matrix is one of the most stimulating and well executed movies I have seen in quite awhile. I simply cannot understand how anyone would not like this movie! The visual effects are simply awesome and immaculately done. There is not one moment when you feel that none of this could be happening. This is a movie with action, special effects up the wazoo, and, unlike most action films, it has a superb and enveloping story. The story is somewhat far from everyday life, but that aspect is what makes this film so mystical and intriguing. The concept of the Matrix really makes you wonder if this could be a possibility. All in all, I would say this movie is definitely worth the trip and the money. Unlike other huge disappointments (Star Wars, The Mummy), The Matrix is "The One."

Wow, what a movie. When I left the cinema, I thought, The Matrix was ok not very good. Then I got a deja-vu feeling when I saw the commercials on the tv, and thought what a Movie.The story was great and very originally, I like it ! And the special effects made Titanic(and Leonardo Di Caprio) sink to the bottom of the Atlantic Ocean. I think I'm going to see the movie again.

The bottom line is that I give this movie "two thumbs up" and a solid 10. It rocks! In fact, I enjoyed it so much that I've already been to see it twice and -- yeah, I'm a square -- I've never done that before. Unless you're old and crusty, and/or terminally unhip, you'll love this movie.The central theme revolves around the state of human existence: reality, dream or -- for today's technologically fearless audiences -- virtual reality? A dream within a dream? And, if so, how do we break out? Is this deeply philosophical, hugely meaningful, or merely trite? We're in plot cliche territory. Now add a heavy "good vs evil" line and a biblical allegory on death and redemption -- not to mention "the one" -- and some love interest and... danger, danger Will Robinson. Sounds way hokey, right?Well, it ain't. I don't know how they pulled it off, but these Wachowski brothers have taken this basic concept and produced a stunning movie: a plot that is coherent, involving, and emotionally moving; a cool script; LOUD soundtrack; loads of great fight scenes; supercool special effects; and good acting (especially Hugo Weaving as Agent Smith, Laurence Fishburne as Morpheus, and -- surprise, surprise -- Keanu Reeves as Neo).This film is LONG, nearly 2 and a quarter hours, but I sat there and enjoyed every minute. This was as close to cinematic perfection as I think I'll ever get.

The special effects creates a plausible situations where reality is not what it seems...although the special effects are many and creative, this movie does not venture beyond the limits of our time and thus becomes awe inspiring.

I think I know the reason why so many people liked so much The Matrix. It brought science fiction to the masses. I mean real science fiction, not ID4 or whatever. The regular movie goer does not have a mind open enough for the possibilities and unconventional thinking that science fiction provokes. But if it is dressed up with cool special effects and wardrobe and the plot is naive and well explained enough to be understood by all, then everyone will think that the movie has changed the way they think about the world, and all that nonsense. That's about all I have to say about The Matrix.

this movie is terrific! I guess it will become one of the biggest cult sci-fi movies ever made. The computer effects have been used very wisely... Although there were no "new" ideas in the film, it has a wide variety of used goodies - fine martial arts, astounding digital effects and a very cool Keanu Reeves. Great stuff...

Granted, I am predisposed towards the genre but, having said that, I like to say that this movie is currently my all time favorite. It excelled in atmosphere, due to superior storyline, special effects and one of the best sound tracks I have ever heard.

This is a film for people who, like me, absolutely love artistically made high speed action movies. The Matrix includes the most stunning combat scenes I have ever seen. So if thought Face Off was a good one, go see this. Now.

Wow, the work and detail they put into this movie was extravagant. The name of each main character in a story represented their attitude and outlook and foreshadowed what would become of them. The animation and graphics were awesome. Nice frames and use of camera tricks creating the illusions of different special effects. The basic outline and plot of the story was amazing in itself. It grabs you from the beginning and takes your mind on a wild ride of "what if's." Not only is it great entertainment, but you'll never look at life the same way again. All in all, -wonderful- movie. A definite 'gotta see.'

Review title: Unexpectedly excellent cyberpunk-philosophic movie with a twist.
Review_body: As one of the movies that suffered most from the suffocating PR from the makers of "the phantom menace", "the Matrix" wipes the competition clean. On the opposite of Mr Lucas, the makers of "the Matrix" succeeds in making a high tech future-vision that, in its obscureness, seems plausible. With very little publicity, it really got to me as fresh, new and smart, through all the computers and cyberpunk. It kept surprising me, and it grew on me for an hour after it was over. Seen it, loved it, bought the OST, recommending it.

Review title: One of the most extreme movies for a long time
Review_body: I really liked this movie. The special effects is really something else and the script is good too. The only downside of the movie is the ending and that there where just a little to much talk about what the matrix was (is? :). Besides the small glitches from perfection it's a really great movie.

Review title: Best Film I Have Ever Seen In This Categories (Sci-Fi & Action)
Review_body: This is the best film i have ever seen!!!! The idea is original and the movie is just perfect! I voted 10 for this movie, and you will do that too when you have seen it! This is really great work by Andy & Larry Wachowski!! Tnx for a trilling movie! Just can't wait to see your next one... hope it's SOOOON!!!

This movie rocks.  Never have I've been so entrance by a movie since The Crow.  I've seen this movie countless times and I just don't get tired of it.  Carie Anne Moss was great for this role. She started the movie on such a fast pace I was amazed.  The audiance also agreed with there ooos and awes.  The story line was also great.  Those who think it was weak and had no point are those who view life in certain boundarys.  They limit their imagination and don't realize how complex the story truly is.  The story kept me interested and the special effects blow me away.  I recommend it to anyone and everyone.  Although, those who think within the borders must step in the theaters and have an open mind.  It's one hell of a movie to watch.

I consider, that the Matrix is one of the most important movies in the late 90's. I did really enjoy the story and the visuality. I don't usually like martial arts in the movies, but this time they were put together with talent, so they weren't boring. The movie really got the grip over me in the first minute and held tight till the very last picture. And as a final pick, the sound track was fabulous!!!! I'm only afraid, that parts II and III won't be that spectacular.......

Review title: A picture to see and analyse.
Review_body: This is a very nice picture. A point of view of a not so far future. It's very difficult that it will happen, but ... who know. The computers/machines evolution grows in exponential mode. 30 years ago the man step on the moon. What we can do in 30 more?The film remember some things of the picture Brazil. Some ideas in the film "the matrix" about the reality were commented by a lot of people. I.E.: "Is real the reality", a book of Paul Watslawick.My impression of the film is the nice way that is interpreted the idea of the reality, and how that idea is communicated to the spectator. Many things are perfect, like the oracle, the matrix itself, the "deja vu", the name of the ship and in general all the names, the training programs and a lot more.I think:  Why they can't use cordless telephones to run out the matrix?This is a picture to see several times and to analyse a lot of things of it.Pd: Sorry by my poor english.

Review title: OH WOW, neat effects, best movie I seen this year, just awesome, breathtaking
Review_body: I got tickets from a contest I won, it was the very first show in Holland. I heard some things about the Matrix, but didn't have a clue that is was this great. I really like the story line, it lets you think about it for sure. Anyway its really rocks, im sure this movie will win the special effects Oscar. I'll keep it short because you have to watch it!
very interesting non-stop speed for me go for it it is a PCgame, isn't it?

Review title: The best action movie I have seen in a very long time
Review_body: The matrix is by far the greatest action movie that I have seen in a very long time.  I love the fact that its purpose was purely to search and destroy, as so many action movies are.  I like the fact that it has a philosophical side to it that leaves it's viewers with something to think about besides people getting blown away, and buildings destroyed.  Also that in the end all we know is that the "good guys" were a step ahead, but there was no guarentee that they would win, so to speak.

First of all I liked the movie very much. Why? For several reasons. First, I generally like this kind of movies. Second, I personally enjoyed to 'catch out' subtleties and associations concerning other movies or books. Third, I liked the philosophy in the film, more even than the action scenes. And, fourth of the reasons is that I understand quite well the problems Mr. Anderson dealt with in his regular job :) The thing most amazing was that in this movie it was almost impossible to tell what is going to happen in the next minute... Some movies are perfectly predictable - this one is not. Almost. I would also make the end slightly different, but this one was also thrilling. Hugo Weaving is perfect in his role. The Wachowski team did some really good work. I feel afraid to wait for Matrix II - somehow I don't believe it is going to be as good as this one is. I hope, however, that I'm wrong.

Review title: What makes 'The Matrix' the film of the decade
Review_body: WARNING: CONTAINS SPOILERSForget about the screenplay, it's all about the effects`, they said. When I went to see the film at an exclusive midnight premiere I didn't know anything about the film. 136 minutes later I decided to never go to an exclusive midnight premiere again. The punishment was the knowledge that I would not be able to see the film again until its official screening one full week later. Somehow I survived. The story is mind-blowing and discusses a lot of essential questions about reality, everyday life, who each one of us is and who decided it that way.The protagonist, Thomas Andersen, not really satisfied with his existence as an average employee, finally gets the contact he had always been seeking. A group of matrix-resistant individuals share their knowledge about the matrix with him and furthermore tell him that he was chosen to put an end to that fake reality and free humankind from slavery by the machines. The exposition of the story and the characters is great. The film starts within the very first second but still leaves the viewer unsure about what really is going on. Is Thomas A. Anderson only dreaming? Or is he really Neo? Is Neo more than just a night-life name? Is Neo Thomas A. Andersons true identity? The way the story unfolds is thrilling and the turning points come with good timing. One of two weak points in the story comes when the writers-directors must get Neo to confront his antagonist. Trinity at that point has to play the poor part of bringing on the delay. The way we got to know her throughout the film makes it anything but convincing that she would start long talks at that rather delicate moment. Whoever wants to criticize Keanu Reeves for his acting probably has a problem with actors that don't show that they are acting while they are acting. He's not in flirtation with the audience or the critics while he's performing. He's too busy doing a great and extremely convincing job. I have never been a fan or something so please consider me as neutral. Lawrence Fishburne is the most charismatic Morpheus I could ever imagine, and the rest of the cast is the perfect choice also. Carrie-Anne Moss handles the extremes between the cool matrix-trinity and the sensitive reality-trinity impressively well. Stock music rarely works in movies but when Rage Against The Machine hit it after Neo flies away in the end, something just works. The Wachowski Brothers got me. I want to see their next movie. Right now.I don't see The Matrix as bringing on  easy answers. Every answer is followed by a question, and the one in the end only becomes the one because he chose himself to become the one. Nothing more, nothing less. While the matrix is all clean and colorful, reality is dirty and cold. The parts of the dialogue who deal with essential questions (like what is the matrix`) are brilliantly written. (There's just that other  thing that irritates me: when Morpheus tells Neo about how the machines got the power over humankind, he says humans darkened the sky so that the machines would stop working while the humans themselves  depended on the machines and therefore caused their own misery.  I always raise my left eyebrow when I see this part of the movie. Wouldn't it make more sense to say the irony comes from the fact that humans depend on the  sunlight and that way caused their own misery by darkening the sky? That analogy would work well with a lot of short-sighted actions humans have come up with over the centuries.) It's surprising to see subjects like this being discussed in a mainstream hollywood movie especially at that length. Since the Wachowski Brothers had troubles to get the project financed, it might not be that mainstream anyway. In fact, at least the outlook of the film is avant-garde. Ground-breaking camera-technology and breathtaking choreography of the fighting scenes team up with innovative direction. Neo's wake-up scene in the incubator, the showdown or the white room won't be forgotten so fast.Since the first human being was walking the planet, there have been speculations about what is real, if or how that might be proven, and what kind of consequences that might have. Therefore not too many themes could be more classical than the one of The Matrix. But it's not only classical, to some it might be scary: it invites us to see parallels in our world, igniting questions about who based on what kind of legitimacy- makes all the rules and how much power each of us has in that game. The choice of the theme and the way the theme is presented is what truly makes this film the first film of the next millennium. It already has entered movie history.

Review title: A fine, well done movie, but lacking in areas
Review_body: There has been a substantial buzz about this movie, and with good reason. The Matrix does an excellent job of wiring the audience into the movie, and then leading them on a thrill ride.  Allowing the audience to identify with the main character in all his glory and power, and to desire and lust after the Trinity character, athletic, intelligent, and attractive.  However, I believe the adrenaline generated by this movie (which was a great deal) shrouds some of the other issues.  Neo saved by the kiss of true love (trite and over used in the movie business).  Hitting the audience over the head with the implications instead of allowing the audience to come to the conclusion by themselves.  My friend accurately summed the movies popularity, in my opinion, by saying "Every class of person loves to be cast as the hero" and Neo appeals to the young tech heads of today along with the young athletes and rebels.  I believe the special effects were superb, but I believe the unveiling of the plot was a little brutal and lacking trust that the audience would be intelligent enough to draw it's own conclusions. Enjoy the movie, for it is truly a wonderful exhibition of the action/sci fi genre.

"Why is it 26th and not 1st?" is a question I would like to ask. I think that The matrix is the best movie I have ever seen combining Sci-fi, action, drama and thriller. I liked the idea of computers taking over the world 'cause it's basically what is happening. The special effects and cinematography was excellent and, I think that , that is what  made The Matrix so special.

Bad, too bad film. The idea is good, but then the film is an "stars & stripes"  film, without fantasy, only special effects, and bad actors, the usual story, with the good man and the bad man. No news under the sunAdalberto

As a computer programmer I was pleased with the way certain aspects of computer programming was represented.  I especially liked the way that the "code" was visualized.  I would recommend this movie to anyone who enjoys computers, altered aspects of reality, and a good conspiracy.

Review title: Mytho-poetic and cyber-punk in one vinyl clad package!
Review_body: The Matrix is the most entertaining film I've ever seen.  The action and special effects are without rival.  But, in addition, the plot of the film and the philosophical issues raised are extremely interesting and well done. In short, this film is very nutritious - lots of eye-candy, but with equal servings of character and story.  Unreserved 2 thumbs up.

Review title: The BEST movie I have ever seen
Review_body: The MATRIX was a movie that had it all.  Anyone who has enjoyed the Terminator films (sci-fi, back-in-time) and Jackie Chan films (choreographed fight scenes) will LOVE and CHERISH this film !! All performances were convincing, the action non-stop, and the plot was solid and had many varying levels of symbolism, meaning, and relevance. I could go on, but I must be going now, I am about to see the movie for the sixth time !!

Review title: Great plot, too bad that the actors are not up to it!
Review_body: Watching this movie felt like reading a 60's sci-fi book (probably where they got the idea), the ones that makes you think and feel different after reading.This movie can be compared with todays world of technology and computer viruses...  except that the roles are switched...The negative things: The plot could have been a little more worked out. And please, please, please change the actors (this is not an option ;-)

Review title: one of Keanus finest yet , he was in rare form
Review_body: the matrix was by far one of Keanu Reeves finest movies yet it makes one wonder what if we really were living in nothing but a matrix ?????  I was taken aback by the special effects , and sometimes it is nice to associate with one character.  It is not hard to see how presistence and discipline can pay off in a movie.  NO wonder ,  look at all of the movies that are trying to copy off the text of it .  I wish them good luck, but they will not even come close

When I initially saw this film I new nothing about the plot, let alone the matrix. I was asking myself the same questions as Neo was, "What is the matrix". This kept the film alive for me. Thats maybe why I gave it a 10 out of 10. The film reminds me of "Dark Cities", where everything is not what it seems, It also relates to how my brain works.

What is the Matrix?"The Matrix" is a movie that is not a movie. It is a special effect and an action showcase extravaganza of splintered, all-be-it cool, scenes of martial arts, chases and digital effects. In short, it's a roller coaster. All I truly needed to make this movie a ride was a hydraulic roller coaster simulator in my couch.Unfortunately as a movie, "The Matrix" falls apart. The script is plagued by cheesy one-liners ("Kansas is going bye-bye"? Puh-leeze!), plot discontinuity (such as why didn't the bad guys use powers they use later in the film at the very beginning of the movie which easily could have caught Trinity? The plot has quite a few big holes, but no plot spoilers here...) and a severe lack of characterization (as in, non-existent). The actors are miscast, especially the villains, who while look the part, deliver lines as if they were constipated monkeys. The directing, besides having the actors refrain from doing any acting, is basically sound, although they over did it on the slow motion a bit. The plot is supposed to be centered on Neo, a hacker trying to find out what is dream and what is reality. However, the character doesn't even practically exist. We have no back-story on him and no reason for his exploits except for the shallow explanation that he "feels something that's not right with the world." Except in the movie, Neo doesn't appear to feel anything. He seems nothing like the insomniac hacker risking all to search for the meaning of life that he's supposed to be.The sad part of it all is this thrill ride had so much potential as a movie. The ideas behind its premise are well thought out, and had the Wachowski bros. bothered taken the time, "The Matrix" could have pushed the bounds between fantasy and reality, man and machine, future and past. Instead, with its poorly written script, miscast actors who ruin any dialogue that actually had potential, and complete lack of characterization, this movie is good only for its special effects.

I think The Matrix is a great movie. It shows great special effects, a great plot, and has great stars. It shows great detail and they use special effects wisely. It's based on a computer hacker that finds out he doesn't really live in 1999, but around 2199. The world is really rubbish. The Matrix is all of the people in separate tanks. The people are really asleep in a kind of virtual reality, that simulates they are in 1999. Watch the movie to find out what it's like.

Review title: Matrix is a splendid reflection on "reality"
Review_body: Reality in the "real" world seems to be just as uncertain and confusing as The Matrix.  It was a movie that made me think of how closed one's eyes could be to the stuff that goes on behind the scenes.  We are often so content living in our comfortable little lives, that we seldom take note of the little things that are quite out of place.  And when these "anomalies" do cross our paths, we tend to either ignore it or write it off as mistaken perception.  The Matrix reminded me that I too would rather take the Red capsule and open my eyes to a world that seems so impossible, yet is the truth of what is out there, and more often than not, in here...

Review title: A deep message in a really great film!
Review_body: (Warning: light spoilers inside). I do love this film: action, plot and besides everything a story rich of wisdom.In fact it is a clear example of what is human being.  "Man lives in jail" says Morpheus to Neo.Man thinks to be integer and unique, but he is just MANY modules, MANY programs. Remember the fight between Morpheus and Neo or when Trinity learns to drive the helicopter. In those moments Neo and Trinity could use their mind, but usually what happens outside loads in our mind another program and we start acting according to that new program, and we think to be that new program: that is the jail.The Wachowski brothers show that there is the possibility to escape from the jail.There is the possibility to awake, to stop sleeping! (following a master - Morpheus -; inside a group - all the others -; through continuous training - like Neo in Nebuchadnezzar -; using the mind and not being used - like Morpheus when jumps over the skyscraper or like the baby with the spoon).And to succeed is necessary to die - and in fact Neo dies -; only after, he clearly sees "The Matrix" and starts to be free from it.The Matrix is a great film, and because of the deep message it has inside, that many people vibrate watching it.

Review title: Very good, but had some flaws
Review_body: First of all I want to disagree with some other people's reviews on IMDb. One person said that this movie had bad acting and bad special effects. Bad special effects!? I'm not a giant fan of this CGI stuff but if you think the effects in this movie are bad you're blind (see the bullet-time scene again). The acting was great except for Keanu Reeves, but give him a break - he tried his best.The flaws I saw were not that important to other people, but almost ruined it for me. The violence was totally unrealistic. When people get shot they bleed, and out of the all the people that are shot in this movie I only saw one person bleed. Now I'm not all into seeing people getting mutilated when they get shot in movies, but I thought that needed to be shown. The only other thing was the characters always spoke in metaphors which can get VERY annoying after a while. Other than that you have a high quality movie with great action sequences, good acting, excellent special effects, and a great (but unoriginal) plot. You'll have a great time watching this movie.My rating: ***1/2 stars out of ****

Review title: The technicalities of a film make it a brilliant film.
Review_body: I only got to see "the matrix" once at the cinema, and how I regret it. I am going to get this the minute it is released, the action sequences and special effects are breath taking. The whole idea of the movie is brilliant, combined with the script and the immaculate detail make "The matrix" easily one of the best movies ever made. It is absolutly stunning, and anyone who writes it off should be put in a straight jacket and stuck in a mental home. Stunningly amazing is an understatement.

Caution: If you haven't seen this movie, don't read my review, it'll only create conflict in your mind when you view it...
With that said... The Matrix provides one of the most powerful symbols of Christ's return in a futuristic setting.  Writers of the matrix felt that to aid the the common movie goer, they would name one of the characters "trinity."  How convienient = )Such an odd name, but not out of context.  It becomes obvious that Keanu Reeves is the modern day Jesus Christ as he defies the laws of gravity, physics, and eventually reality.  As he gains support and training from his apostles, he becomes a powerful fighter in the attempt to free mankind from ultimate slavery.  He is the "chosen one" that will deliver us from slavery. He is saved by Trinity, who proves that love is the only power greater than all mankind.Consider how you view his actions carefully though.  As Keanu Reeves slaughters mindless SWAT agents he drives farther and farther from what one might consider to be the teachings of Jesus.  But, movies need audiences, and what could be better than the Son of God returning to a computerized world, freeing slaves and kicking some major booty.As an action flick The Matrix is unsurpassed... we get explosions, hand to hand combat, helicopters, and of course, guns, lots of guns.The only city left protected from the mechanical death... Zion... of course, just a tidbitI suggest that you go and watch The Matrix again, i've seen it about 9 times, and look for the symbolism involved.  Its pretty interesting when you do...

Review title: Conceivably the Best Action/Sci-Fi Movie Ever
Review_body: Using futuristic ideas that stretch the limits of imagination and sensibility, The Matrix climbs near the top on my all time favorite movies. If you're looking for action and the first good Keanu Reeves movie then check it out.  But I would suggest a good surround sound system for the movie.

In brief, this is one of the best, if not the best, film ever made.  This film has action, special effects and an excellent sound track; brilliant! I can not wait for the sequels;  this trilogy should kick the s**t out of the barely average Star-Wars Trilogy to come (ie. extremely poor acting, plot and some of the most unrealistic special effects since Buck Rogers!)

Review title: What else was there besides special effects?
Review_body: OK, so the special effects were really good, and the gun battle scenes were cool. But as for the story line, it was a good concept, but in my opinion they failed to make it even half as good as they could have...I was rather disappointed after all the hype. I'm glad I saw it at a friend's on DVD instead of paying for it at the theater
The greatest story I have ever seen in american movie...

My favorite of all time. In my case that means the best film of the past 4/5 years. Ofcourse I have seen movies from before that. But the past 4 to 5 years i went to about every movie thats worth seeing. And altough I'm not a die-hard sci-fi freak this is certainly the best movie I have ever seen. The atmosphere around it just sucks you in and doesn't let you go untill the credits appear. I've got only one remark: The soundtrack sucks, maybe it's fits in the movie but it's just not my style (don't pay any attention to my terrible english--> I'm from Holland (you know... Amsterdam!!) so... )

When I visited this site the first time I read some comments about 'the Matrix'. I was shocked. People that claim to have some movie-knowledge portrayed 'the Matrix' as an immature martial arts movie without any depth or philosophy. I am not claiming that I have a lot of movie-knowledge, but the concept, the styling, the special effects, everything. I have never seen a movie like this. I can say that a baby is born. This movie could change the way of making movies for the future. So...Andy...Larry...thank you for that.

Many see The Matrix as simply a rush of mind-bending special effects, but that is just an added bonus to the plot and cast.  This movie brings together action and science-fiction in a well blended mixture sure to send your senses into overdrive.  Keanu Reeves and Laurence Fishburne give terrific performances as Neo and Morpheus, respectfully.  Carrie-Anne Moss does an excellent job playing Trinity, and she will become invaluable to Hollywood to years to come.  Hopefully all three will reappear for the announced sequels to this 1999 blockbuster.

Review title: A well put together movie, but I do have some beefs
Review_body: I've heard people saying this was "such an original story".  It wasn't Other than that, I would have to say I enjoyed this movie from start to finish.  Keanu Reeves is great, and the effects and camera direction were very well done.  I would suggest this to any Sci-Fi fan, but I would also add a recommendation for Ghost in the Shell.

Amazing and almost original movie (anybody saw Dark City) The guns scenes were the best match to my favourite director John Woo. The Combat scenes were shot like the old Martial Arts movies. The dramatical performance was moving. And that space/time stoppage while dodging bullets KICKED BUTT! :POverall, this movie shows that America still has hope for movies that can use the best elements to put together a film. I hope to see more Wachoski Bros.P.S. (Try a Mexican standoff two guys shooting and dodging scene, that'll kick!)

Review title: Don't believe the hype, The Matrix is horrible.
Review_body: Whoah!  That was a really awful excuse for a movie.  Horrible acting and a horrible script is what you get with this one, but I expected these things to be bad.  What I didn't expect was that the SFX were horrible too.  I can't believe people think that they are good.  Good special effects make you forget that you are seeing special effects, and you can believe that they are real.  In The Matrix, you never forget.  They are way overdone and end up looking very childish, and we've seen these cheezy effects done a million times in commercials even though people may not realize it.All I've heard about this movie is how the effects are amazing, but I say if that is what you are looking for watch The Phantom Menace or The Mummy.  If you want to see a good virtual reality movie watch eXistenZ or even The Thirteenth Floor was better than The Matrix.

Review title: Neo's coming out an whiping the matrix
Review_body: The Matrix was the most action packed sci-fi movie of the decade. I had never been a Keanu Reeves fan before this movie. Reeves and Fishburne are a great dual.  The story of the Matrix was awesome.  I recommend watching the flic twice to fully understand the story.  The suspence in the last 25 minutes of the movie was very intense. The action scenes were by far the best ever.  I would recommend this movie to any sci-fi, action lover out there.

Review title: a cult movie that may announce the discovery of the next century : virtual reality
Review_body: Excellent acting by Keanu Reeves and Laurence Fishburne.  This movie brings a relation with Jesus-Christ; Some people in our world dream to become the chosen one after the Apocalypse.  The special effects are very good.  Lot of action too.  It's a good movie with a good scenario.  Enjoyable.

How could a revolution be in technology age. It could be individual of course. The one who access the reality will be enlightened and guide him (or her)self. Rising to air without a machine? Why not if intended to do so. This film has a genuine revolutionary, anarchist theme. The government, police and the whole system with all the human beings are condemned. Especially the humans who obey and do their individual affairs are primary enemies. This film makes us think about many things about our civiization.

Review title: Excellent film, makes my top 5 modern films
Review_body: Right there with Seven and Silence of the Lambs for me.  I love this film, and rate it a notch above some of the other great action films of our time (i.e., Terminator, Predator) because it has a really well thought out (although moderately unbelievable) story line.  A lot of thought provoking material, and some interesting subtleties. I've seen it 10 times (I don't usually watch a movie more than once), and I'll watch it a few more. Enjoy!

Review title: It is a modern day classic
Review_body: This film is by far the best film of 99. Anyone who thinks otherwise is wrong. Keanu Reeves delivers his best performance yet with the possible exception of Speed. I hear that a lot of people have been comparing this film to Bladerunner which, in my opinion, is a consistently overrated film. I believe that The Matrix will be hailed as a classic well into the new Millenium.

The Wachosky brothers bring us the Blade runner of the 90's . Actionpacked Philosofickly full and special effects wide . Keanou reaves more than makes up for the weak Johny Mnemonic .If you are openminded , be prepared for loads of entertainment . Thinkers might adore the first part of the movei and FX fans the battles will keep you more than stunded . Everybody get ready for a total mindteaser . The success of this filf is good acting , great storyline but also greatlly detailed special fx . The only problem is that it still cant get off certain cliches . E.g the hero is killed but because of a kiss he is brought back to life . Still this is one of the best movies of the decade . View or Die :)

this movie is the most revolutionary ever, i watched it, i watched it and i watched over and over again and it's always interesting to find out something new. the story is just unimaginable and it's perfect, that's the only word that can resume it: PERFECT...

Review title: Is life, as we know it, just a curtain to hide the truth?
Review_body: This theory about life, has made such an impact, that it looks it could easily be the truth. The special effects are perfect for the story. The story line pulls you from frame 0 till the last frame. A classic!

This movie kept me on the edge of my seat!  I'm not a Sci-Fi buff but this movie is worth seeing.  Keanu Reeves was great. I can't believe that he only took 9 months of martial arts for this movie. He looked like he had studied for years.  I rate this movie a 11.

For those of you who think that the story line for The Matrix is totally original, then allow me to enlighten you. The script is a 'wrapped up' version of Buddhist philosophy.In Buddhist philosophy, the world as we perceive it through our senses is merely an illusion. Nothing really exists as we perceive things to be. This is synonymous to 'The Matrix'. Neo who is 'The One' is synonymous to the The Buddha who has discovered the way to see things as they really are.'The Truth' is the truth of seeing things as they really are. 'The Training' is Vipassana or Insight Meditation whereby the mind is concentrated and trained to penetrate reality into its constituent components. 'The One', comes into his own when he experiences the constituents. That is when Neo sees the reality behind the facade.The scary thing is that we are living in a 'Matrix' (samsara). It is not in the future but has been with us since the dawn of time. However, there is light at the end of the tunnel as there is a way out.Nevertheless, it is a good film.

Reeves and Fishburne takes this film to another level, not yet achieved by another movie. I will say that Matrix will live for many years as one of the greatest movies ever. When I saw it the first time I was paralyzed by the stunning effects and excellent acting. I wouldn't rate this film as a 10 but more like 12 or 13."Do you dare believe it's true?"

Martial art is not only a set of limb motion. Behind it there is an intergrated philosophy, dealing with the relation between human and nature, between mind and body, between the contrast and switchness of positive and negative, hardness and suppleness, exterial strength and internal potential. To be a real Kung Fu master, you have to be a philosopher.As a Chinese guy, I grow up with Hong Kong Kung Fu movie. Only a few of them reach this depth. So I had suspected any western director can perceive it. I was wrong. 'Matrix' do it, and do it brilliantly, though through a different way.

The Matrix belongs definitely to my top 10 of all movies. Technically it's awesome, but effects do not take the main role. The story is completely logical, there's no reason why it could not be real. There's nothing disturbingly wrong, watching it is pure enjoyment. Every time I watch it I find more interesting details about it. Brilliant piece of art! Can't wait to see the other two episodes of the trilogy. 99 out of 100 points.

I thought that "The Matrix" was an amazing movie.  It was well balanced in that it had something for almost every person.  It had enough action to keep someone who likes action fixed on the screen.  It was a science fiction but it had it's moments where you wondered if what they were saying applied to real life.  All around I thought this movie was very well rounded and appealed to many people.

Review title: beautiful-an incredible rollercoaster of kung-fu and philosophy
Review_body: when i first saw this movie i was spellbound. i had never seen a movie like it before and probably won't until the sequel arrives at my local movie theater. the wachowski brothers, two filmmakers unknown to me before this film, soar into my favourites list. this move has it all. great story, great action, good acting (especially from Hugo Weaving and Laurence Fishburne) and great special effects and photography.

Review title: A New Race of sci-fi film....
Review_body: One question that will you will be asking yourselves throughout the movie will be: What is the Matrix? I'm not here to tell you exactly what it is (so I don't know, but hey!) but I can tell you about what I mean by a "New Race of sci-fi film."First of all, let's talk about the beginning of the film. The chase scenes in the beginning (Trinity, the police and the Agent) are worth paying for the cinema ticket alone. The special "Bullet Time" effects could be the very tip of the iceberg which can unleash a whole new way of filming and camera angles.The government Lobby scene and the Kung-Fu scene unite Western and Eastern filming; all four leading characters (Neo, Trinity, Morpheus and Agent Smith) trained for 5 months with a group of Hong Kong martial arts trainers and wirestunt-stunt men to allow them to attain the "natural" grace and ability of Kung-Fu. It's not about how well the actor/ress APPEARS to fight, it's about how well the actor/ress KNOWS how to fight. The Matrix could be just the start of combining the talents of both Western and Eastern filming tactics to make the perfect movie. And The Matrix is just that.

Review title: Best film I've seen for a while
Review_body: I didn't know quite what to expect with this film after having heard mixed reviews. I have to say that this is one of the best films that I have watched for a long time. The camera work and the bullet-time special effects are excellent. Definately one to buy if you haven't already. I'll be watching this again for sure!

Review title: Neo hacks the Matrix, has the Agents try to kick his but..
Review_body: An excellent and surreal movie. Strong movie, good performances... excelent..They all have an important part in the movie, as the story goes on and the technologie makes its point,,. Portugal also rules..

This has got to be one of the best sci-fi movies ever made. The special effects are unbelievable.. Loved the scene where Keanue is dodging those bullets... it was so cool. And who knew Keanu Reeves could kung fu fight like that???  :) He could give Jackie Chan a run for his money..:) Who knows, maybe we will see them teamed up together in a kung fu movie  :) Wouldn't that be somewhat unexpected, even funny.. :) I just love a great movie..

Review title: Something for everybody in this wild ride...
Review_body: The Matrix is the rare combination of plot, acting, special effects, and action that appealed to me on a lot of different levels:  the whole concept of the "Matrix" made my head spin but didn't lose me, and the action sequences were well executed and built on each other nicely.Lawrence Fishburn is warmly enigmatic, Kneau Reeves presents a nice combination of confusion and cockiness, and I could have happily watched Carrie-Anne Moss walk back and forth across the screen in her black outfit for two hours.
one of the best movies I've ever seen. the special effects are awesome, and the way they've used slowmotion is wonderful. it's the movie of the millenium

Went to see this with my girlfriend and we both spent the last hour just waiting for it to be over.  If I wanted to see pretty effects, I'd watch a PC, I go the cinema to see films.  Some half-a**ed ideas but thats all they were, half-a**ed.  Dialogue was sometimes funnily bad but mostly just excruciating.  I do not understand why this film has the status it does - it says very little for our culture that something so shallow and stupid can be held up as being somehow sublime.

There ain't any other movie which can beat this in "imagined realism". This can be true. Haven't yet found any idioms or fatal errors in it's logic. Just great... This really is an easy movie to like. After watching this movie you really know if your mind is wide enough to understand the frightening possibility of "dea ex machina" (the machine god) and the control of big brother. If you miss the link, you live in the Matrix... deeply, sadly and forever...

The Matrix is a movie that combines a combonation of great actors and special effects. The directors are brilliant in this film, i had to see the movie twice because the rush was so great, the sound track is excellent the storyline leaves you thinking of all the possibilites of the scenes. Their are hidden messages inside of the movie hinting at how Neo could be the one. The music whats on T.V. what the advertisements are in the backgrounds, everything. The movie has the best special effects i have ever seen, the best music, and some of the best acting. This movie rates a 10 on my list, please watch this movie more than once to pick up all the little things in the movie, enjoy it once more. See the world that you are living in The Matrix.

If you haven`t seen The Matrix your missing something. It has become the new revolution in action/sci-fi thriller. A new born classic. See it and live it! If you`ve liked Hacker you will love The Matrix. Not quite in same branch but you recognize the computer gender of the movie.

I loved this film. I think I can watch it every week. No. Everyday. It's great. The plot is rather ordinary, but the MOVIE is just splendid. Effects - there were lot of words here about that. I enjoyed the soundtrack. I chose rob d "clubbed to death" for my exam at model studio, and got excellent mark by the way:-))) Then. "There's no spoon". I tell it to myself and to my friends before any kind of crazy action. And it WORKS!!! No spoon - no fear! 8-))))At last, about Keanu Reeves. Really cute:))) I've noticed one thing - as he gets older he looks better! So... Kisses and hugs from Russia!!!

Super visuals and a plot like no other make this one of the finest sci-fi's ever! This film will spawn at least two follow ups and both will be hard pressed to beat this. However, the very idea of more of the same should make anybodys mouth water.

Review title: This is the best film from the last Millennium
Review_body: The Matrix is the best movie I ever seen, because who knows that this film is not the reality??? The actors are wonderful especially Keanu Reeves. I love this man, that is also a reason why I love this film!!! If you don`t watch this film yet just go to the next Videostore and look out for it!!!

The film had very breath-taking graphics.  For instance, the scene where Morpheus is rescued and Neo dodges bullets is inexplicably choreographed perfectly.  Most of the action films that I see are unrealistic.  It doesn't seem like it could happen, but this film is different, somehow.  I can't explain it.  Also, the idea that the movie presents is shockingly plausible. Although, I doubt it, I'm always on the lookout for agents.  If you don't gather anything from the movie, at least get this.  Do not try and bend the spoon. That's impossible. Instead... only try to realize the truth.  There is no spoon.  Then you'll see, that it is not the spoon that bends, it is only yourself.  ~Oracle~

Review title: A little of my overall opinion on the movie
Review_body: By far, The Matrix has been the most creative and outstanding movie I have ever seen.  The plot was hard to follow at first but the special effects made up for it.  I would gladly watch it over and over again.  Reeves did a wonderful job portraying Neo, it fitted him well.  I can see why the DVD is always out of stock. . . Five stars!

When I first saw this film I came out ecstatic. I've seen the film dozens of times since then and my original impression remains.  The film operates on so many levels and is so intricately woven that it withstands such scrutiny. Of course it has its faults, but like its merits, they are entirely dependent on the viewer's point of view.  I kept my mouth shut upon exiting the theatre for the first time, and sure enough, all of my companions praised it, but each for different reasons.  The film acts very much like a mirror in that way: each viewer seems to pick up on the themes that resonate with them the most.  I, for one, relate to the notion that reality is entirely subjective... the world IS as we think it is.  (that, and Carrie-Anne Moss rocks...)

Well to talk about Matrix,its really difficult.I guess there are so many dimensions in the film that its really hard to figure what the movie was all about.I think this is a masterpiece,the dialogues are excellent but might be too hard for ordinary people to understand.The acting performnce is very good specially by Lawrance fishbourne and keanu reeves in fact the whole crew has done a great job. There are so many aspects in the movie one of which I think is the awareness of what is our innerself and God.The movie changes its dimension when neo meets morpheous and the turn is so fantasised that people would think,whats going on?I think the movie is very much a must see and those who havent seen it so far I think they have missed one of the great masterpieces of the century.

Review title: Redesigned story with over-the-top special effects
Review_body: The Matrix was a movie I was a bit skeptical about when I first heard about it.  The idea of it sounded a bit like 'Dark City'.  But it is nothing like it.  The Matrix isn't as dark as 'Dark City', and really can't be compared to it.  The story of The Matrix was not very original, but bent so it feels like something new.  Anyone who has seen Dark City will probably be interested in seeing The Matrix.  The acting was good.  The Wachowski brothers has the talent that John Woo has...They can make anyone look cool, and the outcome is evident in 'The Matrix'.The special effects are you best I've seen.  'Bullet Time', as what the directors call it, is very impressive.  There is nothing like bullet time. The only thing I can think of is in 'Lost in Space', where they use their hyper-drive.The Matrix needs to be seen by any action fanatic.

Review title: Everything you wanted it to be and more.
Review_body: I must admit that this was one great movie.So great was this flik that I saw it 3 times in the theatre and 5 times on video. The movie is good, not only for it's exellent special effects but for it's very original story line aswel.I was pleasently surprised...Great action sequences.

Review title: A perfect combination of story, effects and music
Review_body: This is truly a great movie. Not only is the script faultless and well thought-out, also the effects are superb and in perfect harmony with the fine modern musical performance. For me it's one of those films that are able to set a new standard or move a beacon, if you like. Looking forward to Matrix 2001

I see posters. TV commercials. Comments. Magazines. Newspapers. Rankings. Awards. Lots of Wow! expressions. Then...I rent the movie (I thank God I've never seen it on theaters) and I say...'Well, it seems that this is THE MOVIE'. Then I press the play button. And get sleep. Bored, slow, extremely bad acted, unbelievable. And incredible bad movie. Maybe a nice story...If somebody tells it good. Seeya, Matrix. I give a '1'. And I think I'm generous. Bye Scar

This was one of the best sci-fi movies I have ever seen! I mean the storyline and plot was really complicated but the special effects were awesome.  It had action from beginning to end.  It also had everything in it.  It had love, some parts were funny, action, and violence.  And that is what makes a movie great.  I cannot wait until part 2 comes out.

I went into the theater not knowing what to expect.  I left the theater thinking about nothing but the movie.  I haven't been that impressed with a film in far too long.  Most action films have to be given a bit of...what is it called...suspension of disbelief, in order to be enjoyable.  This film snatched my mental portion of suspended disbelief and took me for quite a ride.  The simple betrayal and "saved by a woman's love" cliches aside, it was as near-perfect a thing as I've seen on screen in way too long.

The Matrix had everything, including the most beautiful action i have ever seen in my life. One thing most people dont catch about this movie, is that there is alot of christian symbolism in this movie. of course neo is a jesus figure, and im not going to bore you going into the details but the movie was released on easter, think about that, and then watch it again.

As many may know already, this movie is absolutely incredible. Sure the special effects are great, the sound track rocks, and the martial arts are the best, but what really sets this movie apart is the plot. I'm a practitioner of Buddhist meditation and this movie is like a metaphor for life. In a way, we are all asleep in the matrix of our own minds. Few actually wake up to 'reality'. The 'reality' of the matrix is a dark one, compared to the brilliance of the buddhist path to 'reality'. Nonetheless, this movie is the best movie I have seen since Baraka.

Review title: Top 3 on my list if i had a list.
Review_body: If anyone ever reads this I say hello to you.  I will now babble for a while about my experience with this movie.  Endure if you can.The first time I saw this was with my girlfriend and I was very sleepy at the time but I had to see this movie.  I did nod off a few times throughout the experience and still thought that I had come away with the story.  My first impression was that the special effects were really good and the acting was equally good.  The plot, uh, whatever was my opinion.  Another impression was that the combination of the soundtrack with the action scenes of the movie were especially impressive.My second and third times watching the movie left me with so much more.  I found the plot to be very thought provoking and the characters to be even more likeable than the previous time I saw The Matrix.  All, and I mean all of the actors in this movie contribute the artistic success of this movie. My overall impression is that I'm sure that this is one of the best movies made.  Ever.Lastly, I've noticed a lot of the negative comments I've read about The Matrix are very similar to my first viewing of this film, that its only quality was the special effects.  If the special effects are all you got from this movie then take it from someone who knows.  You need to see this movie again.  And don't sell yourself short for not getting the meaning of this story the first time around.  It's ok, sometimes we get tired.

WARNING - SPOILERSThe Matrix is the best example of people ripping off the ideas of others and getting credit for it. The Wachowski Brothers did nothing more than take the basic plotline of the first "The Invisibles" comics, written by Grant Morrison, and splice it with the Japanese classic "Ghost in the Shell".Watch and read the above, and you'll get more satisfaction than watching this lousily un-original film.Also, just to point out a massive error, how could Cypher have met with the Agent at the restaurant when Tank had to plug people in and out of the Matrix. I'm thinking he would have seen him, no?

Review title: Excellent, must see! A real hit!
Review_body: The Matrix is a movie of utter brilliance. The storyline hits you like a blow to the head... could this world ever form into reality, a real eye opener. The Wachowski brothers with the aid of phenomenal visual effects create a movie which will revolutionize the sci-fi movie industry, a must see movie!Laurence Fishburne(Morpheus) plays his character to a tee. The cool, aggressive and serious leader of the resistance has us at one moment at a sense of ease, the next, a rush of sheer fast flowing adrenaline streams our bodies.

The Matrix is the greatest movie ever! If you haven't seen the movie yet, and you like computers, technology, and science fiction, then BUY this movie today! Though at the moment this movie is science fiction, some of you might agree with me that it may not be in a few years! "I want guns, lots of guns".The Matrix also has a huge amount of symbolism. The first few times you watch it you may only notice some of it if any, but after lots of times of watching it you'll start to notice more and more, but don't expect to ever notice it all, for you never will. I can't wait for 2 and 3 to come out! I hope they're as good or better than this one! I wonder if Neo will ever succeed. I hope he does. NEO IS THE ONE. OF COURSE HE WILL SUCCEED.
I enjoy the movie, Special Effects, history, Concepts. Its a new form to make movies. It's a New Classic! I love this movie

This really bothers me that people actually consider this movie one of the top 50 of all time???   Really, people, think about the plot of this movie and the acting...I am the first to acknowledge that the special effects are unlike no other...but how beyond stupid can a plot be?  I ask that if everyone can really look at what this movie is, and they still enjoy it, more power to you.  I do think that once you look at this movie beyond the special effects, you'll be extremely embarrassed that you at one point said you "liked" this movie.

Review title: How do we know it's not true
Review_body: It seems that the Matrix is uneasy about independent thinking. I look at the Matrix as uncle sam looks at the people of the U.S. The population is considered useful to the machine as long as it can produce power ( work )for the system. After, if re-election was not a problem we to would be discarded and used for fertilizer to help feed the productive people that blindly work for the machine. If you really want to put some thought into this movie, compare the Matrix with the U.S. Government.

I must admit, I was disappointed. After all I read, it was an action film that was visually stunning. I wanted more. I wanted characters I cared about, and to be honest I didn't care if they died. All in all an above average movie, but good action film.

This is the most thought provoking and still exciting movie ever made!  So much thought has gone into it's production that I find myself believing in the Matrix.  It is so improbable, yet it could be true without us knowing! Keanu Reeves at his best, with Laurence Fishburne & Carrie-Anne Moss both giving excellent performances as Morpheus & Trinity.Well done to the Wachowski brothers!

Review title: There is no spoon(and by spoon I mean plot)
Review_body:
This movie SUCKED. Okay I have to admit that the stunts and special effects were cool. But the script was stupid and very predictable. And there was typical 1-D shallow performance from Keanu Reeves. And what is up with it being so high on the top 250 list. COME ON PEOPLE you leave Midnight Cowboy and Gone With the Wind out of the top 100, but manage to put this Gap commercial with special effects at #30.
3out of 10 stars.

I never got into special effects movies, but this one changed my mind.  This is the coolest movie I have ever seen!  The action sequences were amazing. The effects did not take on that truly fake quality, and it made you think. I Loved every second of it. Impressive.

I worked 4 1/2 years in a video store and saw an amazing number of movies and the Matrix is the movie in it's genre that I'll never get tired of watching. All the elements are there, the action scenes, the plot, the amazing soundtrack, the special effects, the chemestry of the cast... I could go on and on and on. Simply a master piece, instant classic in my book.

Review title: A mindblowing film full of spectacular special effects.
Review_body: The Matrix is one of them films that you can watch over and over again but the first time is always the best. When i first watched this at the cinema i was amazed at the fight scenes and how they were so brilliantly choreographed. The Matrix is a mindblowing film full of spectacular special effects that can only be best watched on DVD or at the cinema. It is a must see film for everyone whether they like sci-fi films or not.The reason why the matrix is such a fantastic film is not just the action with its special effects but also the brilliant casting. Keanu Reeves is amazing as Neo, this is probably his best film by far. Carrie Ann Moss is also incredible as Trinity and Laurence Fishburne is outstanding as the most dangerous man alive, Morphius. Without them it would not make the film as popular as it is. If you have not seen this yet you are in for a treat as you will be blown away. Make sure you see it i highly recommend it. 10 out of 10.

Review title: A strong contender for the best Science fiction movie ever made...
Review_body: The Matrix is not just merely a movie but more of an awe-inspiring audio-visual experience that has to be seen to be believed. It focuses on the character of Thomas Anderson (played by Keanu Reeves, in his best role since Speed) who begins to question the nature of the world around him, thus leading him to a mysterious figure named Morpheus, who holds the answer to the question: "What is the Matrix?". Boasting mind-boggling special effects, some of the most adrenaline-pumping action sequences ever committed to film and an ingenious storyline, The Matrix is arguably one of the best Science Fiction movies ever made. It stands up to multiple viewings, and has to be seen at least a second time to be fully appreciated. Strong support from an excellent cast- most notably Laurence Fishbourne as Morpheus further add to the quality of this modern classic. Millions of fans around the world now await the coming Matrix sequels with great anticipation...

Review title: It could be much more better, but in comparison with the rest it's a 10.
Review_body: It' could be a much better film . The idea it's arquetipical , powerful, the music is exceptional , there have been a lot of inspiration on this film, ... but .. the directors made a mediocre work ,Keanu Reeves it's not an actor ( but this time the "force" has been with him).IT COULD BE A MUCH BETTER FILM , BUT COMPARED WITH THE HOLLYWOOD PRODUCTION IT'S THE BEST .I voted 10 for this film .P.D: This film suggest WHAT it's NOT REAL ,but ...... don't say nothing about WHAT IT'S REAL !.Negate the existence it's a typical satanic idea .... .Superate this existence it's a religious fact.

Review title: without the special effects a predictable sci fi b movie
Review_body: the matrix is a simple conspiracy/messiah story with stunning special effects.the acting was wooden and the lack of any real twists or surprises left it to the effects to keep my attention.
The Matrix is just a very cool movie! The acting is very good, the special effects are really cool and the actors are very cool!

Review title: The Matrix, what a waste of time
Review_body: Wow. After all that this movie was hyped up, I was greatly disappointed. But what did I expect.This movie is typical of the garbage Hollywood churns out, and how typical of the blind masses to eat it all up. There are massive plot loopholes one could drive a truck through (Someone please explain to me, when in this "virtual world", why do they need a phone to get out? That's like saying "Quick, we need to touch a dog to get out of the matrix!)I have never once in my life seen so many good looking computer geeks. All so stylishly dressed as well, but then again, this is a definite "style over content" movie, with black clothes being so popular, it's no wonder the producer wanted people decked out head to toe in trenchcoats. After all, why bother to write a decent storyline when you can just fake it, put in lots of "great" special effects, trendy costumes, "l33t computer H@xors" and have it sell on these points alone? Sorry, not good enough for me.This movie is plain bad, from the moment it starts right up to the moment it ends, with all the blatant overacting inbetween.If you are one of those people that doesn't like to think when they watch a movie, (and no people, that whole "Oh the Matrix makes you WONDER" line is just lame, stop it) you'll love this. If you are one of those people that aren't swayed by pretty lights and fancy special effects used to wow most audiences, stay well clear of this.

Review title: This must be one of the greatest movies ever created!
Review_body: I've seen It, and I'm sure that you have seen it to...What can I say...? This must be one of the coolest and greatest movies ever created.It's got everything, it's exciting and there are Hackers involved... This movie really made my day!!!

This is one of the films everyone copies ,talks about and model and compare themselves to !!!Every couple of years a movie come out that catches the imagination and attention of the public(STAR WARS,PULP FICTION ,TITANIC,ET,BRAVEHEART,JURASSIC PARK ETC,TERMINATOR 2,LION KING ,TOY STORY ETC...)Though they might be in different genres but bring an original concept and strike a chord with the audience! That is what The Matrix has done!!It is a breathtaking ride into visual and groundbreaking new territory, it has revolutionized and influenced a lot of new movies and with good reason!!It is a smart thinking man 's movie with smart characters and brilliant action sequences that leave you stunned!! IT is movie you must see on a big screen to catch the full effect with a kick@ss music score!! It is a cool sleak movie with John Wooish flair and visual "eyecandy" photography!! I personally enjoy stylish all out action movies or smart well written movies with heavy character developement and an intriguing storyline that maintain your interest and challenge your mind!! Unfortunately you very rarely find them both in the same film!! That is why I found this movie so entertaining it delivered on both counts ,brilliantly acted by everyone even Keanu ( yeah Keanu who would have thought totally caught me off guard!!!!)
