Review title: What is the Matrix? THE BEST MOVIE EVER!
Review_body: This movie is awesome. Not once do you get bored... you just fly through it, and at the end you look back and say "WOW! This movie is sweet!" And then, you never sleep for 5 nights because you are thinking about the Matrix... and about what the Oracle said to Neo!I really believe this movie is the best sci-fi movie ever... better than star wars for sure.

(You have to excuse the bad spelling, because I'm from Sweden)I think this picture is one of the few pictures with out any flaw, the other one is The Shawshank Redemption.All the special effects is so well done that it really was a relief when it won the Oscar for best special effects and not Star Wars episode I. And the fighting scenes is SO beautiful and I usually don't find those kind of scenes to be any good, since I feel I've outgrown them (I'm 21 at the moment). But here in The Matrix they are like....art...To all of you who hasn't seen this movie... you really have missed something! The scene in the hallway (those who have seen it know what I mean) is on of the best scenes in the movie, total action is the least you can call it.

Review title: Am I the only person who thought this film was rubbish.
Review_body: In mu honest opinion, The matrix is a poor film.The film is just a chance to show off modern special effects. It appears to me that they decided to forget about the story. Also I believe that Keanu Reeves was a terrible choice to play Neo. It didn't help that his charactor was a 1 dimensional cardboard cutout.

This is one of those movies who relies on two-thirds special F/X, mixed with one-third references to classical literature and Judeo-Christian mythology, with near zero coherence.  Unfortunately, this is almost always nearly enough to dupe the public, which is by and large amazingly stupid and take any sprinkling of metaphysical rumination as the work of a genius, as long as it has enough explosions and ickiness mixed in.  The Matrix stars Keanu Reeves as a Block of Wood, or the other way around, being equally valid. Keanu Reeves, as Neo, or Jesus Christ, Techno-Savior, with Trinity, Mary aka "the Virgin"/Mary Magdalene aka "the whore."  (Maybe someone had a bit of Freud going on, mother is the saint, but also the whore?  Same first name, you notice.)  Also, the Holy Black Man, Morpheus, who may or may not represent God or the Holy Ghost, and a generic Judas, who seeks wealth/power through the destruction of Keanu/Christ.  So basically, all that has been done is take the amendment to the Bible (the New and Improved Testament), slap on a lacquer of nihilism, technology, and explosions, no acting ability from the majority of the cast, a handful of plot holes, a reference to "Alice in Wonderland," and you have "The Matrix," the movie that succeeded mainly because it's on the same level as the general public, which is pretty sad.  However, there is a positive side to this entire SFX debacle.  Hugu Weaving, who just somehow manages to be so sexy and cool, especially in his outfit.

THE MATRIX is a great special-effects movie, setting a higher standard for future releases.  It was for this reason alone I purchased its DVD. Casting, on the other hand, I found to be weak, its leading roles unable to draw on the significant elements of the story.  In this, I failed to sense the peril of a society held hostage in a virtual reality.  Keanu Reeves, as Neo, adds to my disbelief by neither portraying a knowledgeable computer hacker or a savior of humanity.  Laurence Fishburne, as Morpheus, faired little better as a mentor or a zealot..  If there was an emotional highlight in the film's presentation, it must have been the acting of Carrie-Anne Moss.  Her characterization of Trinity showed the loyalty to their cause and the sense of underlying fear needed to make her rebel character believable.Whatever the problems I found with THE MATRIX, watching a new generation of special-effects debut was pure enjoyment.  Future productions will have to reach even higher into our imagination than ever before to match THE MATRIX. Simple copying of its techniques will never produce that sense of wonder found in their first-viewing.

Review title: One of the best action movies ever !!!
Review_body: When I first heard of it, I thought...oh just another big budget movie. O boy what was I wrong. This movie has it all, A great Plot, Great actors and acting, filled with intense action and kungfu scenes and very good Special effects.Go and see this one!!!! :-)

Review title: I don't understand what people liked about this movie.
Review_body: I am not the biggest fan of action movies, but there have been many that I enjoyed.  The Matrix wasn't one of them.  It is pretty hard to make a boring action movie, but the Matrix was successful.  The only reason I go to action movies is to see someone bust some heads, and watching the same three bad guys that look exactly the same get beat up over and over got really old after the second time.  All that computer stuff looked really neat on the trailers but I felt let down when I saw the movie because I had seen all the "cool" parts already. I just saw Vertical Limit and that was a good action movie.  It used all the action movie cliches but it was exciting.

Review title: Fast and real fighting scenes combined with a very interesting scenario
Review_body: if I had to choose the best film ever, that would definitely be THE MATRIX. It's the only film I've ever seen that combines astonishing scenario,fantastic visual effects,action and a promising end which is very important for a film to be successful. The plot puts your mind into a lot of thinking about the real world and really gets you in Neo's shoes. Once you start watching the film, you won't be able  to think anything else but THE MATRIX for many many many hours (even after the movie ends!).

This movie was extremely well written, with a plot line that could almost seem believable.  Reeves has a great performance mostly due to the casting, which called for a clue-less heroic, that Reeves is very good at.  The special effects were one of the best portion of this film, they were visually great and revolutionary to the industry.  One of my favorite things about the making of this film is that the martial arts scenes were not complete acting.  I loved that the actors were schooled for about 2 months to make it much more believable.  The music throughout the film was also great, being hip and exciting.  Overall I loved this film and cannot see it too many times.

The Matrix is one of the best science fiction action film directed by The Wachowski Brothers. The film has influenced both the cinema industry and the computer entertainment industry. When you watch The Matrix for the first time, it looks like perfect action movie with high-class special effects and good actors.Time passed and we remember only a black cloak, two hands shooting, kung-fu and running on the walls.Recently I watched it again and I was amazed that there was so much hidden behind the spectacular scenes that I needed to watch this film several times, and I would probably find something that I had missed earlier. Reality is the only what we see and feel.We can understand the movie in different ways. You will see what you emphasize. Slavery, the fight against the system, the role of man in this system and the system in life, fanaticism and faith, chosenness and resurrection.I suggest watching The Matrix even if you've already watched it.

One of my favourite movies of all time! It have a great story that will keep you on the edge of your seat. It is fast moving full of action. It has won a lot of awards, including the oscars! Need I say more?

The Matrix is a trip into the technologically fantastic. It keeps a philosophical undertone while presenting mind-blowing special effects. And in the end, it comes down to a battle of wills, between machines and humanity, between cold algorithms and humanity's ability to grow beyond its own limits and expectations. Visually stunning, a plot that a philosopher would love, and men in black suits that come back faster than cockroaches. :-)

When this film came out surprisingly i heard nothing about it. One evening a friend suggested to visit the local cinema to watch this film that he heard it was good...nothing more. We came in late and the movie had just started... Looks nice.... Why are they after him?... Sci-fi Without any effects?....Let's see now... Red pill ,blue pill, witch one should i take?....Huh...Holy...What?... I've been making these thoughts for since i can remember my self....Can this be true?? The scenario is brilliant and the effects are ahead of it's time no wonder why so many films replicated them afterward. This film moved into position No1 in my top film list the moment after he took that pill, it was like i took it. Sci-fi films will never be the same again for me, it's hard having to compare this film with any other sci-fi movie.This one has the best surprise factor ever , and believe me i figured out from the start what was happening in the (awfull) "Sixth Sense" Film. Although the sequels didn't live up to anyones expectations i consider them good sci-fi films and they complete the story of this gem.

Review title: Convincing plot with excellent cast and production
Review_body: The film reveals a concept which is so bizarre that it grips you from the start.  The visual effects are very well done, but the film has an artistic quality that makes it worth watching a second time around just to take in the artistry.  Look at the street scenes (eg. fire-escapes against building) some beautiful almost gothic imagery at times.  Look at the colour and textures of the interior sets.  There are also some curious camera angles; vertical sideways views which help to make this film distinctive.  The music is well chosen.  As the film develops to its climax and a siege ensues, there is much gunfire in the foyer of a building.  The amount of gunfire is a little over the top (but it's a movie after all), but listen to the music, if you can.  The piece was so well chosen.  Looking forward to Matrix 2.

The Matrix is the best and coolest film i have ever seen. The story, the actors and the action scenes is the best i've ever seen. The film is just The Film.... =) And that there will come nr 2 and nr 3 of it... ahh.. cant wait =)

The Matrix is a classic action film that's great for teens, and in no way does it deserve an R rating. There are a lot of fist fights and shootouts here, but there's almost no blood and nothing graphic is ever shown. The violence in this film is stylized and intense, but is still easily within PG-13 territory. Moderate coarse language is used throughout the film, including the s-word. The music during the closing credits includes a song with stronger language (though this will go unnoticed by most viewers). There are two drug references and one sexual innuendo, but those are closer to PG than R. The film has positive main characters who are willing to sacrifice themselves to save others (though there is one rotten apple in the bunch), and the film contains a lot of thought-provoking philosophical content that will interest intelligent viewers.

I've seen it five times at the cinema, three times on video and twice on DVD. "The Matrix" is probably one of the best science fiction action movies to date. Borrowing fight/action choreography from Hong Kong cinema and drawing on camera work similar to that seen in "Blade", "The Matrix" fuses them together with awe inspiring special effects. Keanu's acting short falls are well hidden and the pot is well thought out.Most people will love this film, and rightly so, but if you are under the impression that these fight scenes are the pinnacle of cinematic achievement then I am afraid they still pale in comparison to Hong Kong offerings. If you do subscribe to this opinion then I would strongly advise you towards renting "Drive directors cut" from your local video store. You won't be sorry.

Review title: A new way of looking at the world
Review_body: Matrix fell in love with me almost from the beginning. It's not one of my favorite movies, but I consider it a great work. In my personal opinion, the special effects didn't age very well. The philosophical nuances that the Wachowski sisters added were very successful. There is no better example than the iconic scene where Morpheus offers Neo two pills, one red and one blue that symbolize uncomfortable truth or blissful ignorance. The action is brutal, even if you're not too fanatical. The cliché of the chosen one becomes very repetitive, but I can say in his favor that it was done in 1999 and this was not as exploited as now. Highly recommended and must-see for those who want to start in the cinema.

Pretty enjoyable movie for the first two thirds. Seeing the redpill and bluepill was entertaining. The philosophy of idealism(real meaning) here is nothing new to me, we do live in the Matrix. The fate part is wrong because unless you can change the past(knowing the future counts) then people will only be able to do what they actually end up doing or else its not actually fate. I guess if you never read books and only watch art movies then Matrix would have new concepts for you. I can't confirm but the movie seems to be a ripoff of a better movie called the dark city and a classic novel VALIS. I'm disappointed though that the "real world" in the movie is just the same the Matrix world, instead of having it be beyond our comprehension or some crazy stuff. Then it gets into a dull action sequence lasting the rest of the movie with awful slowmotion, camera rotating and guys flying around. Also I thought this as a kid and I still think it now, that Keanu Reeves is too slim to be an action hero and struggle with charisma. This movie also fails badly at doing martial arts compared to real martial art movies from Hong Kong. Also story is pretty power fantasy, although I'll give it that it doesn't really cringe worthy until the final scene. All the enemies are white men in this movie for some reason but the heroes are diverse. Movie is pretty good overall though given my expectation of hating it as with other movies of the decade.

The story of this movie is written in multi layers. Each layer can magnetize for deferent peoples. Because of this to many deferent viewers can watch and enjoy it. the top layer is action with too many special effects (Matrix). the second layer is a Sci-fi movie that can nice for teenagers usually (Oracle). third layer that managed very smartly and hidden is triller (The Creator). that is the part of story can make deferent feel for viewers. the final layer is a deep philosophy and religionists part of story. due to my personal experiences just part of viewers that love this movie can get through to this layer, This is the Xion (Zion).

Review title: Great mix of sci-fi and action
Review_body: The matrix is the type of movie that sticks in your brain after you watch it.  Revolutionary in its cinematography, the movie provides you with eye candy in more than one way.  The special effects are beautiful, to say the least.  The movie begins with you not really knowing whats going on, and your feelings are matched by what Neo is feeling.  Then you are drawn in for a wild ride of sci fi adventure.  Admittedly, the movie is not perfect, examples of this can be found in which characters live and die, and a few choice lines at the end of the movie.  However, if you find yourself getting into the movie like I did, it won't really bother you that much.

But at the end it is still the ending question "was this real or what"

Apart from the visuals, this film is dead dull. The plot started out quite interesting, setting up a virtual world and real world, with interesting quirks that make you think we could possibly be in the matrix but then the main plot is just the typical generic; is he the chosen one, no he isn't, yes he is, no he isn't, well of course he is otherwise it wouldn't be a movie. If you're just looking for an easy watch it is enjoyable but could have been a much better film.
Just an awesome movie

Review title: Would be a 10 if the actions could be improved
Review_body: As an Asian you always fill your watch list with at least 40% kung fu movies. There has been more than enough said about this iconic movie, but very few were annoyed by the fact the martial arts moves are so mediocre. It doesn't matter how well it was praised elsewhere, one need go no further than Jacky Chan, Jet Li or even classic Bruce Lee movies.

Review title: It's about how it makes me feel, and I feel larger.
Review_body: To me, science fiction fans are ready to know more, imagine more, be more than they have ever been. The best science fiction makes you think, presents a world you wish you could be a part of, and shows heroes you wish you could be. Matrix checks all the boxes. It is clever, has truly memorable characters, and shows you ideas that you can talk about with your friends and feel cool doing it. Let's watch it again!

Review title: Excellent supporting cast makes the Matrix a keeper
Review_body:
First of all, you need a little imagination to watch any movie including this one.  I am not the biggest Keanna Reeves fan in the world, but he was a perfect fit in this role.  The Morpheus and Trinity characters were the real stars of this movie.  The main agent was a close 3.  It is the type of movie you can watch over and over and still enjoy.  The effects were truly astonishing.  Morpheus was the cool level headed leader played by Lawrence Fishborne.  Carrie-Anne moss was a real 10 in her opening scene leather outfit.  You see, you don't need a blonde with big fake bossoms to make a movie enjoyable (dont get me wrong, I'll take the blonde route too).  She just transmitted intelligence and beauty in this one.  And also the Agent had his intriguing ideosyncrasies that made you laugh.
The only thing that did not make sense was how/why the oracle was still trapped in the matrix. I am looking forward to the next movie although it seems like it is ions away from completion...

Buddhist themes? That's doubtful. I think it is very much in tune with Christian beliefs...I mean come on...Zion, The One, Trinity, Nebuchednezzer...!! Those are all terms seen in the Bible. I thought the movie was awesome, but knew many wouldn't appreciate the underlying foundation to it. And also, I forgot his name, but the one who betrays Morpheus...he could definitely be linked to Judah, when he betrayed Jesus. If you approach "The Matrix," with a religious mind set, it is easy to see and point all of this out. I think had I just gone in to watch "another action movie," I would not have gotten the same stuff out of it.
One of the Best Movies I have Ever Seen..!! What a Outbox thinking Movie..!!

Review title: Tche benchmarck for acll scic-fi filcms to come mamcbubukid
Review_body: Hollywood has had some problems combining form and matter in the sci-fi genre. There have been a lot of visually stunning works but nobody cared about the hero. (Or nobody simply cared about anything.) There a few, though, which aroused interest and intellect but nobody 'ooh'-ed or 'aah'-ed at the special effects. With The Matrix, both elements are perfectly en sync. Not only did we want to cheer on the heroes to victory, we wanted them to bludgeon the opposition. Not only did we sit in awe as Neo evaded those bullets in limbo-rock fashion, we salivated.

Review title: Action-packed, inventive & intriguing with some fantastic special effects!!!
Review_body: This is one of the most amazing movies I've seen, and definately worth a 10/10. This being my favourite movie, I can name few if any flaws in it, and I have much praise for the brilliant team of Andy & Larry Wachowski, who wrote and directed the movie.For some, the Matrix was just a great action/sci-fi flick, but I personally see so much more in it. Although the idea of artificial intelligence has been used before, The Matrix re-invents the idea very cleverly, and the concepts explored are new and actually quite thought-provoking.The special effects are amazing, with the bullet-time technology especially awesome (however I have to say that sending up the fight scenes in various comedic ways in other movies/TV shows is getting a little tired!).This movie is brilliant, so go have a look - even if just for an adrenalin rush and the special effects if the ideas in The Matrix are a little too weird for you! The DVD is loaded with special features and the action looks great with digital technology so don't worry if you missed it at the cinemas.Can't wait for the two sequels!!!

Review title: Genre-defining writing, VFX, and action sequences.
Review_body: This movie is such a milestone of action films, that had it not been made, the genre would be very different today. For '99, the special effects are nothing short of extraordinary, bullet-time being the most memorable.
I was little when I watched Matrix but growing up I have learnt to understand what the whole movie is about... Sweet look forward for the release of a new Matrix in 2020

One of the best movies...Still to this day....It never gets old.I've probably seen the movie more than 30 times, but every time I see and understand something more...deeper....and different.

Review title: THIS IS THE BEST FILM? OR NOT?
Review_body: It seems to me that the matrix is one of all the best films in the history of the cinematography. An exciting plot. The excellent game of the actors. Grimm, special effects are all at a height of 9 stars due to small movie clips

The Matrix starring the one and only Keanu Reeves with a sci-fi that will leave you on your feet on how to save the human plant and stop secret agents from killing off the world in the 90s the matrix is a movie that might be in your interest. In all the movie was a good film lots of positives was interesting and kept me engaged but it might not be for everybody as it shows a lot of negatives.The movie has a plot of a young man named Neo who is working an everyday job at a tech company and dealing off computer hacking cards we notice he just lives like any man trying to earn a little extra cash he then gets called to the Matrix as he is sent to a different place then his normal 90s life as he is in the Matrix. Now this movie is quite confusing at times I get lost in the plot you are going from the Matrix back to 90s time after time I get lost at times where the setting was and if they were in the Matrix. Now the acting is not the best I would say either now they do have some good actors who keep you entertained and intrigued in the movie. But in a couple of fight scenes we left in aw in how lame the kicks or punches were and how bad they did with some punches in kicks. But we get stunned by how bad Keanu Reeves facial expressions are during the whole film. He only has one face like looking at a man taking a poo in the toilet. In all the acting was decent besides some bad moments of seeing a Keanu Reeves poo face. It did do a good job and really carried the film to make me continue and watch it. The plot does confuse me a lot at times which does throw me off but you should give it a try and see how you think of it.Next thing was the outfits throughout the whole film as they show the people in the Matrix when they get sent back to the 90s they wear such plan easy to see clothes as they try and look discreet but really at the time of the film would be easy to be noticed they wear all black everything except for the one woman who we barely get to hear from throughout the whole film we just assume she is something special then? But overall was just said to see nothing cool and futuristic as it is a SCI-FI film! Now the soundtrack was quite good was great for fighting scenes keep us to watch the film even if the acting was not there but it was nice to hear. If you like simple outfits and a good soundtrack then I would recommend this movie to you.Overall was a movie I would rank a 6/10 which is decent for a sci-fi for me but it was still not as good as some of the older films that I had seen before this. Just know this film will draw you off to maybe check your phone for a call or a text as it might draw you away but trust me the acting will save it and the soundtrack otherwise it's lost like Forrest Gump tryna to find Jennie.

I remember quite vividly when I first caught a glimpse of this movie a few years ago. Flipping through the channels on a hotel television, I came across the film during the final chase scene and, upon first glance, it made absolutely no sense. How was the guy being chased in two places at once? What were those creatures attacking that ship? What's with him stopping the bullets? Incidentally, I ran into this same spot two nights in a row.When I actually came around to seeing the entire movie (on television yet again) in sequence several years later, I began to realize how great it actually was. I must have watched all the replays each time I clicked on the television. This would later be coupled with my general love for the trilogy that spawned about a year ago at this time.I've seen some of the comments from people who disliked the movie. They either "didn't get it" or said it was "overrated." The latter has gained more prominence since everyone and their mom has spoofed the once unique "Bullet Time" sequence and the general themes of "The Matrix". It's kind of sad that the repetition of third parties has detracted from the masterpiece and brilliance of Bullet Time, which was a revolutionary piece of art. I still love watching it (along with the rest of the movie), and I wish I could go back in time to the day the movie was released just to sit with the audience and hear their reactions as Neo bent backwards, slowly dodging and weaving out of the way of the bullets. Beautiful.To further comment on the detractions of the film, I have to say that you either "got it" and loved the movie or sat there and hated it. There's no happy medium for this film it seems, though I don't think the Wachowski Brothers mind. To be honest, there are small flaws within the movie, but it never detracts from my viewing experience.But even with all the fight scenes and special effects, what's a movie without actors? Keanu Reeves (Neo/Thomas Anderson) is not someone you would normally pick to play heavy roles, and many can't get past Keanu's "spaced" demeanor. Sure, it's definitely a laugh to poke fun at it ("Whoa!"), but within the context of "The Matrix", he's perfect. Neo, as others have described him, is the Silent Buddha type: he'll lead more through his actions than with lengthy speeches. If Neo were completely confident, brash, and outspoken, it would be hard to root for him. Thank God Will Smith chose "Wild Wild West", eh? Laurence Fishburne embodies Morpheus, the cool-headed leader with the greatest of faith in the prophecy of the One. Morpheus is brought to life by Fishburne and it's hard to imagine anyone else trying to fill that role. The same goes for Carrie-Ann Moss, who convinced me as Trinity that she can and most likely WILL kick your ass, whether you like it or not. Furthermore, she compliments Keanu's laid back style with her own intense approach. I suppose that's why, within the film, Trinity is drawn to Neo.To be honest, Hugo Weaving should get more credit for his role as Agent Smith. Smith helps carry the weight of the second half of the film along with Neo. Weaving effectively gives the Agent his confident, silently-smirking-at-you-constantly demeanor that parallels Neo's character. Much of the appeal of "The Matrix" undoubtedly comes from Weaving's performance in terms of mass media. If you put on a black suit with shades, almost everyone knows who you are.The most underrated performance is that of the late Gloria Foster, who portrays The Oracle. She absolutely nails down the character of the all-knowing, disarming grandmotherly woman who is not only witty, but also blunt and to the point. The scene where The Oracle and Neo meet is a very nice exchange, with each actor carrying their own parts appropriately.The best scene? Boy, that's a tough one. I could pick almost any scene in the movie and say why it's good. The best dialogue scenes would have to be either the interrogation with the Agents and Neo, Morpheus revealing in the Construct what the Matrix is, the before mentioned Oracle/Neo scene, or Smith's interrogation of Morpheus. And I'm just slimming down my list here, folks! The best action scene, I believe, is the subway showdown between Neo and Smith. Sure, the rooftop scene had the famous "Bullet Time" shot, and the helicopter ride was intense, but this sequence is one of THE best choreographed fight scenes I've ever seen. There are nice little touches, including the Old West-esquire showdown that occurs just prior to the fight. The Lobby Scene should not be forgotten either as it was a beautiful piece of cinematography.In the end, "The Matrix" is one of the greatest achievements in modern film making. It's not the greatest film of all time, but in the scope of science fiction, action films, and modern movies (within the last two decades), it ranks among the greats. "The Matrix" sets the bar for future films of its type.

(sorry, my English is not the better I know...)No! Matrix isn't a good film and certainly not the best of its year. In my opinion, the movie has a single interest: its special effects! But when you have seen the best ones of them more than one hundred times before seeing the movie in the traders broadcasted 24h/24 at TV... The actors will not remain in my memory too; and the characters are all but deep (special award to Trinity, ridiculous).The scenario can seem original to those who don't know anything about science fiction.  The others will recognize topics taken from different films ;  the main idea of the movie, the matrix, is close to the usual topics from novels of Philip K Dick too (just read "The three stigmatas of Palmer Eldritch"! for example).  Shortly, the scenario is not so strong as so many people are telling us, and if the initial idea is powerful, the screenwriters have probably rest after.My conclusion: if you like special effects, or if you don't know anything in Science Fiction, you can watch Matrix Else, watch Blade Runner, Existenz ... or even Star Wars.

Review title: Information about the Writers is Incorrect
Review_body: I love the movie series, but some recent information proves that WB and the Wachowski Brothers lied about the origins of "The Matrix":http://www.slccglobelink.com/media/storage/paper442/news/2004/10/28/ Entertainment/mother.Of.The.Matrix.Victorious-785067.shtml? norewrite200608291346&sourcedomain=www.slccglobelink.comIt seems She wrote the original manuscripts for "Matrix" and "Terminator", not them.Otherwise, a great series!The Premise that Reality is perception and vice versa is great.I only wished they hadn't killed Neo. Review title: I don't think people realize how profound this movie really is
Review_body: Having studied history, religion, philosophy and the secret teachings of the ancient world, I see so much more in The Matrix - than I did 10 years ago (when it first came out). The number of references to the ancient understanding of this world is overwhelming, and the message of the film is so immensely relevant to the world we live in today.As a famous writer once said "All political theater is always bad, but all good theater is always political". A great quote, which absolutely goes for the Matrix. I view the film as a GREAT metaphor to our society, set in the light of our history. The characters journey is well balanced, but at the same time, the profound message in it, hits you as a train, if you keep your eyes open.To keep it short. As I see it, the main message in The Matrix: Human beings are by the hour getting increasingly controlled, by a force difficult to define. The level of control, works through money, politics, governmental regulations, social rules, the media, and not to say the least, religious control. By this we give away our greatest asset, - our freedom, even the freedom freedom of thought. As Morpheus said, - A prison for your mind.As said by Morpheus "What is the Matrix? Control! ... To keep us under control, and turn a human being into this" - he shows Neo a battery.Thats what the system of today turns us into, a battery: A tax paying, dept controlled, obedient "brick in the wall". To break free, is "the narrow path, and is not pleasant, as "ignorance is bliss". But the choice is up to you. The red or the blue pill? "You will know, as I did. There is a difference between knowing the path, and walking the path. - Morpheus

Review title: The beginning of the worst trilogy ever.
Review_body: The Matrix is terrible. A complete abomination. And the sequels are even worse. The only worse movie series is The Planet of the Apes. Your money would be much better spent buying a homeless person lunch.Granted it seems mildly clever at first, but it is actually an underdeveloped story with a completely unsatisfactory resolution. Any comparison to Star Wars or the Lord of the Rings trilogy would an insult the clear superiority of Lucas or Jackson as both film makers and story tellers. I hope the people that profited so greatly from this film can find a way to do something with that money that is socially responsible. Having said all of that, acting was actually OK, though. And the only part of the story that makes the least bit of sense is that technology and artificial "intelligence" can be dangerous instead of helpful if abused.
The *only* thing wrong with this movie is that it had to end. Truly incredible - even 20+ years later.Perfect.

Ask your self a question. What's the best si-fi cyberpunk action packed mind blowing motion slowing movie out there? Simple enough, it's The Matrix. As we all are suck at home kin this pandemic movies and series have become a great escape for us. As such many of us have started watching old movies again for the nostalgia. And when it comes to old moves "The matrix" was the most grossed R-rated film till 2016 when Deadpool took its place. Such a movie is a must watch for everyone for it has the person we love from the bottom of our heart as the main cast whom is none other than Keanu Reeves. So all the BREATH TAKING fans out there, do watch the franchise. The movie won't disappoint you. Its a rare and rich movie which will leave a rich aftertaste in your mouth. It is guaranteed to give you the best cyberpunk feel out there as it the the originator of the genera as well as the pioneer.The Matrix was filmed in 1999 so it has got fairy old CGI and edit considering it being a si-fi action film. The whole franchise is written and directed by the Wachowskis, starring Keanu Reeves, Laurence Fishburne, Carrie-Anne Moss, Hugo Weaving and Joe Pantoliano. The movie got its inspiration from Japanese Anime and martial arts films. Mainly the anime and manga known as "Akira" or "ghost in the shell"
When the heroin Trinity is cornered by a police squad she manages to overpower them with super humane abilities and flees but soon to be pursued by mysterious agents with similar superhuman abilities. In the middle of the chase trinity answers a ringing phone in a phone booth and vanishes instantly.Meanwhile computer programmer Thomas Anderson feels that something was out of place in the world and was puzzled by the phrase "the matrix" which kept popping up in front of him ever so often. Trinity manages to contact Anderson and tells him that a guy named Morpheus knows all the answers to his questions. As a team of agents and police comes to search for Neo at his office, he soon gets captured by them. Despite Morpheus's attempt to guide Neo to safety via telephone. Undeterred, Neo later meets Morpheus, who offers him a choice between two pills, red to reveal the truth about the Matrix, and blue to return him to his former life. This is where we get the ever trending meme template from about a blue pill and a red pill. After Neo swallows the red pill, his reality falls apart, and he awakens in a liquid-filled pod among countless others attached to an elaborate electrical system. He is retrieved and brought aboard Morpheus's hovercraft. And so the journey of Neo the chosen one begins.
As someone slowly starts to watch the franchise ant emerges within the original world of the matrix they'll soon come to understand why the movie won 4 Oscars along with 37 other awards and 51 nominations.
That's why I recommend this movie downright to anyone who asks for a old si-fi movie recommendation. And we hope that the franchise will keep up its excellent and stunning work with the newest title coming out in 2022.

Review title: The first film of the new millennium
Review_body: Perhaps the first postmodern movie to be enthusiastically embraced by the public, "The Matrix" has not only sold lots of DVD players, but also passed into our cultural mythology. Which all goes to show the power of a great story well told. On a first viewing, it seemed to me that the brothers Wachowski were trying for a Zen myth, but when they got to the crunch, they bailed and went with the tried and true Christ figure archetype. Perhaps it really is still the greatest story ever told.I'm sure that there are nitpickers out there who have totted down the film's supposed flaws and inconsistencies (as my wife says, "another great adventure story ruined by kissing"), but even after several years and many, many viewings, I find the combination of the writing, the brilliant camera shots and the art direction to be really inspiring. And it's nice to see a film in which the special effects actually serve the story.

Review title: This movie is the best ever!
Review_body: The first time I saw this movie, I was amazed! The second time I saw it, I was in awe! The third time I saw it...I had to see it again! I'm serious, this is my favorite movie EVER! It has everything: Action, Adventure, Suspense, Romance, Sci-Fi, even a little humor! If you've never seen this, you should! I give it a 10 1/2! Review title: I never lose another chance to see it!
Review_body: All the negative opinions about The Matrix around here make me believe that most of the viewers did not take their time to actually UNDERSTAND what the movie's all about.All the sci-fi, specialFX, kung-fu stuff is nothing but a veil to conceal the philosophy (or the truth) which the trilogy reveals to those that make some effort and think about it for a moment.What we have there? We've got people fighting machines that keep hostage other people who are encarcelated in oniric reality created and controlled by the machines. Things emphasized throughout the whole trilogy are THE CHOICE and THE BALANCE who in the end turn out to be essential to men and machines alike. Freedom of choice of men brings balance to machine's calculations. Nevertheless it is men who are subject to machines for the freedom of choice is in fact an illusion of men calculated by the machines. The whole thing ends up optimistic though - human nature proves to be uncontrollable. There's of course more.What is The Matrix to The Reality? For a moment think of those who shape your consciousness as of the machines that weave The Matrix. Who are they? Are they one of us? Are you sure? Where do your options of choice come from? Are these the only ones? Is your choice actually YOURS? If not, what does it make of you? - Nothing but a CATTLE that feeds the farmer (or a battery that powers the machine if you like). Those thoughts scratch the surface of conspiracy by some people called 'theory'. I can see The Matrix in power everyday and in my country and in full power every four years before the election day. Its is just as Morpheus says "The problem is the choice" both to men and the lords of the matrix. Catch my drift? "The Matrix has you."

Review title: One of my favorite movies of all time
Review_body: This movie is one of my most favorite ones. I really like the concept of the movie, where we live in some kind of dream world called the Matrix and we can escape this to get into the real world. Also I like the fact that Neo the protagonist of the movie grows into his character as being The One, and has to save mankind. It's kind of like the story in many religions where one person is the savior and that there's an oracle telling the person how to be this. Just like in the Matrix where there's an oracle setting Neo on the path to become The One. The whole concept of this all is what makes this such a great movie for me, plus it has a lot of great action scenes, like the on in the entrance hall of an office building, where they go and save Morpheus.

LA PROPUESTA DE COLOR Y MANEJO DE PLANOS ES UN SELLO CARACTERISTICO EN ESTA JOYA DE CIENCIA FICCION COMBINADA CON UNA TEORIA BIBLICA DE ALTA CALIDAD POR LA MAESTRIA DE SU GUION.

If you thought that this was just a great movie, then you are among the many who missed the fun in this movie.  If you only saw it once, you missed out even worse!  The Matrix is a story of a hacker who has a question that only one man can answer, but when he finds that man (or that man finds him!) he will be propelled into something he never imagined possible....The Matrix, the first time is an awesome special effects, sci-fi thriller. The second time is an above average story with several hidden twists and meanings, the third time and every time beyond, it is a trip into the minds of the Wachowski brothers as you try to uncover every hidden detail from the names of the characters, to the buildings to the dialogue.  You will love this tastefully crafted story of inhuman-humanity that serves as a possible premise for our future as we know it!
Masterpiece! The invention of a world run by machines and the visualization of the effects is amazing!
Great movie, I recommend it to everyone. Sometimes I revise it.

Review title: Why The Matrix is my favourite movie of all time.
Review_body: I'm a fan of action, sci-fi, thrillers, darkness, originality, realistic, romance, style, deep story lines and this blockbuster doesn't just have it all, its a 10 out of 10 in each of those aspects of the movie. Now when I say realistic, you're gonna have to take that statement with a pinch of salt, as its obviously not a real story but after I saw the film back in 1999 when I was 16, I asked myself the question, wow, how do I know I'm not in the matrix right now? The movie is told in such a way that really makes you believe it could be true, where a lot of films fall short of these types of story lines. A lot of films hit you with crazy ideas too early which forces you not to believe that it can actually happen. But this movie is built and told in such a way that its almost impossible for you to deny it, and that's one of the main reasons why I love this movie so much. And as for originality, this is arguably the greatest groundbreaking movie of all time. Before and till this day, there still hasn't been a story like this in any movie.If you ever have a spare 7 hours, my advice would be to watch all 3 movies back to back and see them as one big movie, truly outstanding.
Preti nice story manches 2 action & thrills till the end.

The first time i read about the matrix i was like yeah yeah another Virtual Dumb reality movie. Then well i saw it. I was blown away from the first scene. AMAZING. Smooth movements, slick action and unbelievable stunts. Simply simply amazing. But why do i say it is art? Well just look at each and every scene. If u just take snap shots of each scene and thier art amongst themselves. The fight sequence, oh the fight sequences. My god i have seen many many Action movies from Bruce lee's to Bruce willis' but nothing prepared me for what was comming! The training scene to the tunnel scene whoa. Bullet dodging WHOA where do these brothers get thier Ideas from? Amazing. But the best part was when each and every word spoken by the Oracle proved o be true. I never understood what she meant by "U might be the one in another life but not in this" and indeed he gets reborn after being shot down. Amazing. This movie will be as cult as starwars in the following years. The whole Video and computer game industry is nuts over it. A dozen movies have ripped off the scenes of the Matrix fight sequences (READ: Charlies Angles) and the only movie that will be upto the brilliance of this movie is gonna be its sequel. The only weakness i saw in this near perfect movie is that it started off as a grim twisted psychotic cyber tale and in the ending became an all out thrill ride. Everybody who wants to watch a great movie with an amazing story and action WATCH THIS MOVIE

Review title: If action is all you saw, then you weren't watching the movie!
Review_body: Most people comment on the action or special effects when talking about The Matrix.  That is not what the movie was all about though, watch closely and see what you can discover!The symbolism in this movie is fantastic.  A person has to know their history and mythology and really watch the way things are presented on the screen.  I never knew that the name Morpheus is a mythological character of dreaming or that Nebuchadnezzar (the name of Morpheus' ship) was a ruler of the Babylonian empire who defeated his opponents to take over control. Every part of the movie is for a reason and has meaning.  Things like this are what makes this movie great and enjoying to watch!
I think the matrix was one of the greatest film of Keanu Reeves. And it was incridible for me, but watching the trailer of new The Matrix movie, I hope its still good as this one.

What is Matrix? `Matrix is everywhere, is around us. Is the world they have build front of your eyes to caver the truth' The truth is this: Technical intelligent it's a fact, the machines have identity and they have won the war with humans. The world is destroying and the mankind lives in a digital universe. One rebel group, with his leader Morpheus, battled for liberation, save Neo, a hacker who may be the Messiah and saver of human race. They uncover the truth to him.That what is following is a basic elements mixed from sci-fi movies, cyberpunk literature and comic culture. `Alice in Wonderland' meets Holly Bible and cyber grunge shift to religiously experience. The thinking is more then the action in Matrix. It seems that Wachowski brothers have work out they resources before they make this impressive storm of special effects and intension. Implicate Zen with virtual reality and the storm of shooting with violent flying choreography from Hong Kong, it seems that they invent the action movie from scratch. Special effects are not be used to make the explosions look more impressive, but to build a world from the beginning. They twist the reality, not with unreal way, but extremely believable. Even if the action scenes, from the frenzied chase in the roofs at the beginning until the shoot out at the end are breathtaking, Matrix doesn't exist only for that reason. The style triumphed, the attraction reminds us video games, but the story raise smart questions for thinking and contain an impressive number of ideas. Every detail has not only knowledge and resource, but also fantasy and particularity. Matrix is the `Blade Runner' for the new generation. It has only one `weakness'; it put the ell to high for the coming movies.

Review title: Amazing effects, superb DVD, wooden Reeves.
Review_body: The Matrix is without doubt the movie that has set the agenda for all other action movies to follow early in the 21st century. You just have to look at some of the action sequences from Charlie's Angels to see it's impact on other film makers. Aside from it's undeniably stunning graphics and images, is the film actually that great?The plot in my view is trying to be far too clever for it's own good. It is totally unbelievable, though I must confess this is probably a problem that lies with me and not the writers. A film has to have some basis in reality for me to grasp and I found the whole 'human beings as duracell batteries' plot a little too dum for this man's taste.Some of the acting from the supporting cast is top drawer, particularly when you consider that a few of these actors learnt their trade in Australian and New Zealand soap operas! Laurence Fishburne turns in an excellent performance, which is just as well as for most if the film he is having to carry the inept and wooden performance of Keanu Reeves.Overall I have to admit I enjoyed The Matrix and it's visual delights, but one of the greatest films ever made? I think not.

The Matrix clearly defined the year of 1999. It was grim, it was witty (at some parts) and it was ambitious. Wachowski brothers sure put a great deal of time to concentrate on absolutely every shot. Notice the green-filled rooms with the dark clothes of the cast. Everything is in a pure harmony, however dark it is, it is beautiful. Not to mention the incredibly sharp and "right-in-place sound effects. When you watch The Matrix, make sure you turn your attention to the echoes and reverb added to almost every single line, also listen for the ambience effects! Overall, this is one of the best films ever. And I do not speak only in terms of technical masterpiece. The Matrix has a deep plot, and strong dialogues. Actually, the only flop in the film is Carrie-Anne Moss' performance. Although it is not weak by any means, it could have been better. Yet, this is truly a magnificent film, which is best enjoyed on a big screen system with 6+ channel digital receiver, and is best viewed...alone!

Review title: Often hilarious when it's not boring.
Review_body: I tried to like "The Matrix", I really did. The commercials looked really cool with all the action shots and slow motion effects and I knew that I just had to see it. When did I give up on it? About halfway through the movie, (after the other 4 people I went to the theatre with had long since began laughing out loud at this silly, absurd, and massively boring film), Keanu goes to the apartment where the great oracle (or whatever) was baking cookies and retarded kids were bending spoons with their minds. That's when I stared laughing too. I'm sorry but my friends were right. This film sucked. Sure there were a couple of sorta cool action scenes but you had to sit through the insanely dull hour and a half of Lawrence Fishburn explaining EVERYTHING that happens in the film before these scenes even appeared. And the movie "Blade" had come out around the same time and was a MUCH better surreal action film. As for the silly karate scenes (or kung fu or Judo or whatever), they were no big deal. I mean, did you really think that Keanu was gonna be the next Bruce Lee? Do yourself a favor and rent (or better yet, Buy) the Jet Li "Fong Sai Yuk" movies. As for all the psychological babble about what world is real and what world isn't, it only added to the chaotic mess that was called a script for this waste of celluloid. Some say "Battlefield Earth" was a horrendous goofy mess. Well, it was, but no where near as bad as this. :)
When I saw this movie brilliant amazing how it was all put together amazing actors the matrix francise really great story line the designs the effects these movies really took my breath away

What is the matrix? Be careful and look around you. The matrix is the world that surround us, that has been covering our eyes from the truth. And what is the truth?Well the truth has a different meaning for every of us. But the important thing is not the truth. It is to realize that what you see may not be the truth.This is what the movie is trying to tell us. To wake us up from our daily sleep and make us try and find what is Real from the things that surround us. From that point on it is our own responsibility to walk the path to get to the truth.As Morpheus said there is a big difference between knowing the path and walking the path. And the later is something that everyone has to do for himself.You cannot be told what the matrix is. You have to find it out for yourself.

The Matrix is the best movie ever. No one has never tried to make this kind of movie. it is so unique. 10/10 is not even enough. I have seen The Matrix 23 times and I am still watching it. People who don't like the Matrix are CRAZY.

Review title: One of the best movies ever
Review_body: People will see The Matrix on multiple levels, which is a good thing.There is the lower level people, about 70%, who will boast about the cool special effects and slo-mo etc.Then there are the people who will start to think, hey, maybe we are living inside a computer.Then.. there are the people who will understand that the whole movie is a metaphor for how asleep the general population really is. We literally have energy sucked out of us due to the fear that the media, life stress etc sucks out of us. There are a lot of small details which you can look into on the movie, which makes it something you can watch again and again, and enjoy on so many levels.10/10

Review title: Hey! It´s The Turner Diaries - the Movie!
Review_body: For starters, I´d like to say that there are lots of films out there that use special effects to make brutal killings look cool, and I have no problem whatsoever with that. In fact, nothing clears the head better than an hour or two of Arnold Schwarzenegger or Wesley Snipes killing baddies and shouting one-liners. As long as an action movie doesn´t take itself too seriously, nor do the audience have to. But the Matrix is one of those really dumb action movies that aren´t content with serving as eye candy. It desperatly wants to be Thought Provoking and Carry A Message. When you start analyzing that message, you almost get to belive that perhaps the Unabomber or Timothy McVeigh filled in as script doctors. Let´s review the facts, shall we (warning, spoilers down below, stop reading if you really want to be "surprised" by this film): After the initial action scenes, the movie gets rather boring while three important facts are established: 1: That even thou "the Matrix" is a simulation, nearly all the people in "the Matrix" are real people who think they live in the real world, except for a small select group of people who know The Truth.2: That you cannot go from living in "the Matrix" to living in the real world without going though excrutiating amounts of fysiotherapy.3: That if you get hurt and die in "the Matrix" you also die in the real world.And after that those facts have been implemented over and over, the film goes on to show the heroes remorselessly shooting down and killing hordes of policemen, security guards and the occational homless person, "real people" who we have to persume are just performing their choirs and duties in what they belive to be the "real world". All this carnige is justified in the name of a Greater Cause, namely to "liberate" the inhabitants of the Matrix all at once, even though they will have no real chance of survival once liberated. Am I the only one that gets a bit distraught by this?Oh, and in case you actually didn´t know, "the Turner Diarys" is a rather infamous old science fiction novel written by a nazi and treasured by white supremacists.  It tells the "heroic" story of a little group of self-righteous fascist terroists who overthrow the American gouverment by instigating riots and killing all the evil FBI agents, among other things. Add  a bit of trendy cyberspace mumbo jumbo and what have you got? You figure it out.

The Matrix combines unbelievable special effects, mystery, and action, along with a brilliant story line to result in one of the greatest and most interesting produced films of all time.The Matrix will make you think. Unlike every other ordinary film, The Matrix brings about an entire new idea of how much control we as humans have over our lives.I can only hope that the sequels will be just as good; however will not expect them live up to the greatness of the first, which to me is legendary.Unfortunately no one can be told what The Matrix is... You have to see it for yourself.

I want you to take a walk with me. A walk that leads to a path that might be familiar to you. The first path has a wealth of memories as The Matrix breaking new ground in technology and visual treasures. Is that your experience? No? Then you are on the second path. This path has led from another generation and you were just born in 1999 and legitimately have no knowledge of this movie and/or are from a country that did not have this movie.Is that you? We won't hold it against you. In fact, that's mainly who these user reviews are helpful to the most. Do you have a cellphone? No, I am not a telemarketer nor is this a sales pitch. Technology changed greatly with this movie. The space-age telephone in this movie was a prototype and actually did not work. Now, we have moved beyond the modified flip-phone into versions that would even impress Morpheus. Be prepared to take a journey, suspend belief, and go down the rabbit hole...

Review title: Its beauty is in the details
Review_body: Ever wonder what you would get if you combined cyberpunk fiction a la William Gibson, Japanese anime, and Hong Kong action movies together?  Me neither.  But let me tell you, it makes a heck of a good movie!!!Lots of reviewers here have effectively summarized the plot and pointed out the action sequences, but I would ask that you look a little closer at some of the details in this movie that make it great.If imitation is the sincerest form of flattery, then creative team behind "The Matrix" must be feeling very flattered indeed.  Think about it: In the few years since this movie first came out, how many other film reviews/summaries have referred to "The Matrix" when describing their action scenes and/or special effects?The bad news, however, is that they are all copying the wrong things.Nowadays, "the 'Matrix' style" has become synonymous with two things: kung-fu wire-assisted jumps and slo-mo "bullet time" effects.  While it is true that "The Matrix" did much to popularize these effects (although the wirework had been around for quite some time before them), the imitators forgot that these effects were used to support a well-crafted film with an intriguing storyline and excellent camerawork/art direction.When watching "The Matrix", ignore for once the slo-mo John Woo-style shootout and "bullet time" scenes.  Instead, look at the other wonderful touches the Wachowski brothers have infused into their masterpiece:Look at the use of color--Neo's workplace and the office building used by the Agents is awash in a pale palette of glass, steel, and greenish-grey dullness.  The buildings where Morpheus and Co. can hack into the Matrix are decrepit, with lots of noir-ish backlighting, as if the very structure of the Matrix is weakened, allowing the intrusion from outside forces.Look at the use of mirrors--the Wachowskis have a fun time using mirrored images to frame certain characters and scenes.  The best example is when Morpheus presents the two "pills" to Neo; in Morpheus' glasses, you can see Neo's face clearly reflected in both lenses, but each lens only shows one of the pills, suggesting the two paths before Neo.Of course, don't forget the wonderful set design--the rusty, cluttered interior of the "Agammemnon", and the other jury-rigged equipment used by Morpheus; the sleek, menacing, organic-looking machinery of the computers; etc., etc.And all of this is shot with exquisite camerawork by the Wachowskis.  They have a true knack for "framing" a particular scene correctly, with just the right angle, distance, and lighting to provide the best effect.  It's something you can also see in their first feature, "Bound".As for the story, the plot follows a sci-fi tradition that I'm admittedly a sucker for.  It calls into question the nature of our reality--if humans measure reality by our brain's interpretation of our senses, and if our senses and our brains can be deceived, then how can we know what is real and what is illusion?  This idea is a sci-fi staple, and one that has become quite popular in recent sci-fi movies, such as "Total Recall", "Dark City", and "The Truman Show" (yes, I consider "The Truman Show" to be sci-fi). Into this mix, "The Matrix" tackles this issue in a grandiose style, fueled with stunning action sequences and visual flair, making it a new masterpiece of sci-fi.I should acknowledge that this film is not without flaws.  First, although it handles the idea of questioning reality wonderfully, its ideas on fate/destiny/prophesy, central to Neo's character, are much more fuzzy and ill defined.  Secondly, it stars Keanu Reeves, need I say more.  Lastly, I find wire stunts in fight scenes to be annoying (I thought the scenes in "Crouching Tiger..." were absolutely ridiculous) and thought that a few wire tricks in this movie were very poorly done (namely, Neo's summersault during training, and Trinity's cartwheel during the shootout).That said, I still consider this movie to be one of my favorites, and deserving of the cult following it has received.

The movie is absolutely amazing in terms of direction, screenplay and story line. I cannot really recall any movie which makes us question the reality in which we are living today. that's why this is my favorite movie.What if I tell you that the red pill is actually liquid LSD? There are lots of memorable moments in this movie which are referenced in future movies and popular media & all the action sequences brings the adrenaline rush in me.The main theme of the movie revolves around a computer program and a simulation which takes place inside that program. The protagonist 'neo' is a computer hacker which realizes that he is inside of a program by picking cues from Morpheus.

This is easily the greatest film ever made. The special effects are just brilliant and the story is quite original. A lot of the new films out now have stolen the Matrix's special effects which show how good they actually are, like romeo must die. If you haven't seen this film I suggest that you watch it.

This film is THE perfect film on this kind. He's got excellent graphic, and perfect story The special effects are remarkable and change the current cinema We wait with impatience the two other Matrix!!!

You have all heard of the Matrix. The comic-book, apocalyptic world that was created by the Wachowski Brothers. There isn't much I can say that you don't already know. The fight scenes are incredible, the action is out-of-control. Even though much of it takes place in Bullet-Time, or super slow motion, it is hard to keep up with. The dialouge is not the films strong point when you watch it the first time. However every time you watch it, you hear more deep philisophical double-meanings, and hints about what is about to come than in any movie ever. For instance, the line that Neo says towards the beggining of the film, "Have you ever had thatn feeling where you don't know whether youre awake or still dreaming," sounds deadpan and boring at first. But when you realize what the Wachowskis are setting up, it becomes suspenseful and attention-getting. The acting all around isn't spectacular, although I think Laurence Fishburnes performance could have very easily garnered him an Academy Award nomination. Hugo Weaving is perfectly cast as Agent Smith, but other than those two, the acting isn't very memorable. However, lets get to the real reason people see this movie, 8, 9, hell, 20 times! The action. This movie has the best and coolest action scenes in any movie. Ever. Mr Willis, will you please shut up? From the lobby scene (the opening of the lobby scene is my favorite part of the movie), to the training fight, to the part involving Cypher, to the helicopter scene, and of course, the best fight ever in a movie. Neo vs Agent Smith. I won't give you any details about the scene, but it is worth the price of admission.
If you haven't seen this movie, you are missing a Science Fiction as good and as culturally inmportant as the Star Wars trilogy. If will be quite a feat if the Wachowskis can top themselves with the sequels. However, I really hope they don't screw them up: (AGENT SMITH: Neo, I am your father.)

Review title: Glitch In The Matrix.....Glitch In The Matrix
Review_body: OK so who still watches out for glitches in the matrix?I am writing this review 8 years after its release because this film still has an affect on people and the Movie Industry. Like Star Wars (smaller scale obviously, I can see the faces of geeks everywhere going red with anger) The Matrix generated a new group/cult/fan base of followers across the world and influenced the way many action films were filmed after 1999. Yes you may say slow mo action sequences have been done before (Face Off 1997) and if you have seen any John Woo films (see The Killer 1989) you will recognize the same fight moves (which are timeless and I love). However nobody forgets The Matrix because of the story and the characters and the biggest of big questions (after the big bang debate) which is: "Is this real?" Questioning our existence, no one can ignore the issue and that's why this film hit the spot with audiences old and young and still does today and for many years to come. Everyone questions there existence even if you haven't seen The Matrix.The other two films were just fun/entertaining/money making/visually stunning epics. It was just exciting to see Neo and his posse kick ass! No story needed just more bullets hehe!Have you ever had a dream, that you were so sure was real? What if you were unable to wake from that dream? How would you know the difference between the dream world and the real world?PS John Woo made Face Off anyways.

This is the kind of movie you want to see over and over, because every time you watch it, you enjoy it more and more. When I first saw it, in the cinema, I almost stood up and applauded (Here in Portugal, we don't do that...) I hope the next movies are as good as this one...If they are, i'll watch them again and again. This is how every movie should be! Long live THE MATRIX!!!!!!!!!!

Review title: More than just Sci-Fi and Action
Review_body: Im trying a little different approach in this review since there are so many good reviews for this excellent film.I was 15y old when i saw this film and all i expected back than was a cool sci-fi movie with some high end SFX. It changed the way i viewed the world and was one of the reason started questioning more and accepting less things as a fact because others do and introduced me unknowingly to a lot of concepts of Buddhism.Till today its in my all-time 5 movies, but it was way more than just a high quality distraction of ca 2h.I'm very thankful to the Wachowski siblings to introduce me into the Buddhist themes and recommend this film to anyone.

Review title: A sci-fi action movie or an exploration of esoteric concepts?
Review_body: First I will say, if you are not into discussing deep intellectual concepts in film, my review will likely not be your cup of tea. Everyone else, please read on.I saw this movie when it first came out in theaters. I liked the theme of control that resonated throughout the plot--being controlled, at first not knowing it, then waking up to it and ultimately "raging against" such control.I was not taken in so much by the special effects or fight scenes. While I was not necessarily turned off by them either, I did feel they were "additional elements only" and that the core meaning of the movie strives to go much deeper.Neo is the hero because he got beyond the control mechanisms in place which deceive and thus imprison. No other human could do it, all others...Morpheus, Trinity, etc...even after their eyes were awakened to what the Matrix was, could not act outside the perimeters of this system. Neo, through his journey of self-discovery breaks beyond the barriers of human perception that defined the containers of this system. He was able to do this because a human was originally programmed into the Matrix, as explained by Morpheus to Neo. So the idea that human perception had helped construct the Matrix opened the possibility that human perception could also be liberated from the Matrix by altering the rules that governed it.We all long to break free of something, and I think that is why this movie resonated on a subconscious level with many people. I would imagine those who said they loved this film very well may have loved the concept of freewill itself. Does it exist and can we access it? How is it accessed? Is it a journey of our inner self? Neo takes such an inner journey does he not?The answer is clear, he does. Because this is how he transcends the Matrix of which others, those awakened to it and those still plugged in, could not do. And it all came down to inner belief, the exercising of freewill. Man's freewill. The idea that external reality, whether physical or virtual reality, does not control us. We define ourselves by thought. And thought itself alters reality, not the other way around.I really feel this is what the Wachowski brothers were seeking to express. I do not feel they made this movie for CGI effects or to make an action film that would be a blockbuster hit as some reviews have suggested. I do feel they aimed at a deeper undercurrent on the nature of our existence, the nature of reality. I do not, however, think they were entirely successful in their attempt which is why I gave the film 7 out of 10.Here is what I feel is detracting from the movie: The idea of combining deep philosophical interjection with typical Hollywood portrayals is bound to create a struggle between the two, which it does, and one usually has to give way for the other. Such as, the "coolness" or attempt at coolness (ie leather outfits, guns, sunglasses, martial arts sequences set to hip soundtracks) detract from the intellectual concepts being developed. Such obvious referencing takes the audience in a different direction, to more mundane and traveled territory, yet underneath this (buried in the rubble of predictability) is the highly commendable urge to denounce this very homogeneity and be original. But to be original, you have to go all the way. Once you reference the commonplace, the known and well-accommodated approaches, you undervalue what is fresh and new by the sheer momentum of agreed upon consensus (Hollywood themes) that puts an end to the intellectual exploration that could have arisen. That is, familiarity breeds a lack of curiosity.What WAS fresh and new was at the end of the film when Neo was able to stop agent Smith's bullets by "intending to". That was the beauty of this hero. He exercised his own freewill and thus altered his own reality without resorting to fists and guns in order to overpower the control mechanisms.Yet the problem continues, in the follow-up sequels of the Trilogy. Here we see Neo back to fighting agent Smith with his fists and guns again. So what happened to his ability to "intend" beyond the Matrix? It seems it is suggested (by the Wachowski brothers) that as Neo intended beyond the Matrix, agent Smith in turn also became able to transcend his own limitations. The idea that the challenger is continually challenged by his opponent, so that when the challenger gets stronger, so too does his opponent.The final in the Trilogy did have the proper ending, in keeping with this intellectual theme of freewill and how to achieve it. It has to do with compassion (Neo's compassion) and the will to surrender the NEED to control. So Neo reached this epoch in his journey (final fight scene with agent Smith). He ceased to fight back, and in doing so he became pure essence (unreachable to the controlling mechanisms). OK, message received loud and clear...or was it?I think many who saw the Matrix, or the entire the Trilogy for that matter, saw the leather and guns and fight sequences without being fully aware of the undercurrent of concepts. Well, I guess if that's what they went to see, then they got what they were seeking and no harm in that. Still, I think less focus on "coolness" by the Wachowski Brothers would have helped the esoteric concepts in the film emerge, but may have in turn drawn a smaller audience. We'll never know.Either way, I liked the Matrix and the way the Trilogy was ended. And Keanu Reeves played the role of Neo perfectly. A cross between Buddha and Genghis Khan, conveying that in the end, it is the surrendering of control(Buddhist aspect)that frees one from the Matrix.

Review title: Not Everyone's Cup of Tea, But Certainly a Strong Cup! (POSSIBLE SPOILERS)
Review_body: As this movie came out in 1999 and there are over 2,600 comments on it already, I will skip the synapsis and head straight for the critic's chair. This movie features some of Keanu Reeves's best acting to date, and the cast was absolutely perfect. This is a movie of the 21st century: fast-paced, excellent acting, action, stunts, and stunning visual effects. It also sets a new course where Hollywood hasn't gone in a long time: the profanity count was around 10 and there was no nudity. Some parts are violent, but it isn't nearly as bad as other movies I have seen. The camera shots are incredible. The long vertical shots from the tops of buildings, the mirrored images recurring throughout the film, the slow-motion shots--my favorite is the view from the ground looking up at the helicopter with the blades turning real slow with shells dropping down! You can over-analyze the physics and feasibility of the movie, but I urge the viewer to remember that it is, above all, a movie. This movie isn't perfect; there is a hole here and there in the story. Overall, though, you don't notice them much while you're sitting on the edge of your seat with your heart pounding. This movie is guaranteed to provoke thought, argument, and discussion. In doing so, it provides us all with great entertainment.

I seriously don't get it when people in the above comments say "All action, no story!!!", don't know what better story they are expecting.I mean, sure the story doesn't make you 'CRY' or feel sorry for someone at the end. There are plenty of stories like that and to be honest they are all like a formula or a pattern that they follow. This story makes you think, wonder, imagine, it fills you with awe, every single step of the way. It leaves you with a feeling of discovery, while you decipher the story, piece by piece. And finally, the message is undeniable and universal- "One can achieve anything he/she believes in". To me it will remain the most inspiring movie ever made. Wachowski brothers, take a bow!

Review title: Best Action / SciFi Movie(s) I've Ever Seen
Review_body: Basically all the Matrix Movies are the very Best Action / SciFi Movies I have ever seen. I did not see them at their original debuts at the Cinemas, yet I have seen the DVD's. Never have seen an Action Movie come close to the amount of excellent special effects, great scripts, and super suspense - Will continually vote 10 out of 10 for the Matrix Series. I watch at least 1 or 2 action films per week either on DVD, on Limewire, or at CinemaNow or MovieLink online. The Matrix (3 movies) is definitely the best movie(s) I have ever watched. Seriously don't know how they are going to be out done... Hope that you understand the Movie, I know folks that have watched it and don't understand the "matrix" and when the actors are in the "matrix" - anyway, 10 out of 10. Or 100 out of 100.

It's been a while since a movie has generated enough interest in me for me to watch it. "The Matrix" looked exciting enough in the trailers, so I decided to give it a look. What I found was an amazing movie, with some of the greatest special effects I've ever seen. The camera angles really work for the action sequences and the choreographed fight scenes made me yearn for more. Say what you want about Keanu Reeves' acting. He may not deliver the best dialogue, but his look can carry a film. He was a great choice for the role of Neo. Carrie Anne Moss was great as was the underrated Laurence Fishburne. I highly recommend this film for those who are a fan of visually stunning movies.

In common usage, hacker is generic term for a computer criminal, often with a specific specialty in computer intrusion.Computer hacking subculture is often referred to as the network hacker subculture or simply the computer underground.It is common among hackers to use aliases for the purpose of concealing identity, rather than revealing their real names. Members of the network hacking scene are often being stereotypically described as crackers by the academic hacker subculture, yet see themselves as hackers and even try to include academic hackers in what they see as one wider hacker culture, a view harshly rejected by the academic hacker subculture itself. Instead of a hacker  cracker dichotomy, they give more emphasis to a spectrum of different categories, such as white hat ("ethical hacking"), grey hat, black hat and script kiddie. In contrast to the academic hackers, they usually reserve the term cracker to refer to black hat hackers, or more generally hackers with unlawful intentions. The movie takes up advantage of the technological enhancements and it is totally good to watch ! My website supports the movie is worthful watching .....!!!www.iwebforums.org

I found this movie to be great on so many levels.  The action/fight scenes were intense and very well coreographed.  The acting wasn't the greatest of all time, but it was good.  Reeves has had enough poor performances that detract from the movie that it was nice to see him do well with this role. The plot was not predictable and I bet most of you had to see it at least twice to fully understand what just happened.  But the greatest contribution this film has made, is the great camera work.  This is no new information, but the special effects and camera work on this film has been revolutionary and mimicked by so many people since the Matrix.  I LOVED this movie, I have become a big fan of classic movies, but this is undoubtedly my favorite of all time.

You can watch this movie over and over again without getting bored since all the action will keep you awake and entertained for the full two hours.
